notes: On 2 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants stepped out of two cars to shoot at a group of people in Guasmo North. One person was killed and five others were injured. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of assailants fatally shot a man outside his home in the Munoz Rubio sector. The victim was struck by four bullets to the head. Authorities are investigating possible links between this attack and the killing of the victim's cousin hours later (coded separately). No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of assailants fatally shot a man in the La Malaria sector. The victim, who was the cousin of another man killed earlier that day (coded separately), was struck by four bullets to the head and one to the back. Authorities are investigating possible connections between the recent killings. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants fatally shot an informal taxi driver while he was driving through Olmedo and Garcia Moreno streets. The victim was struck by six bullets, including four shots to the head. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 3 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), three unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man as he was about to enter a taxi in the Miraflores neighborhood. The victim was struck by at least 15 bullets. The taxi driver was also injured by gunfire and transported to a hospital in critical condition. The victim had reportedly been threatened and had recently been released from prison. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 3 January 2023 (as reported), near Bajo de La Palma (Manabi), a suspected unidentified gang killed a man and left his body along the road leading to Los Bajos, near the Galacticos Football Club sports complex. Authorities discovered the body of the man with multiple gunshot wounds and with his hands tied. The man had left his home to recover the stolen motorcycle of his friend, but was later found dead near Montecristi. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 3 January 2023, in Pedernales (Manabi), two armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man while he was in his vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the Torres Molinos neighborhood. The man was an ex-administrative worker at the municipality. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the attackers.1 fatality.

On 3 January 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), three armed individuals fatally shot a man multiple times in the head at the intersection of Tsachila avenue and Rio Yanuncay road in the city center. The identities and motives of the attackers remain unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 January 2023, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), two unidentified individuals beat a teenage mother and her infant after entering her home in the neighborhood of La Florida. The teenager was left unconscious after the beating and the infant, who was 10 days old, was killed immediately. She was later found by her partner and mother-in-law who arrived at the house and was taken to a hospital. The teenage mother reported to authorities that she did not know why she was attacked. 1 fatality.

Around 3 January 2023 (as reported), near El Carmen (Manabi), a (suspected) unidentified gang shot and killed a man along the Paso Lateral de El Carmen bypass. Authorities discovered the body of the man with his hands tied. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the attackers.1 fatality.

On 4 January 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), two armed assailants abducted a truck driver near the southern part of the city. The assailants threatened the victim with a firearm, forcibly moved him to the cargo area, and tied his hands and feet, holding him for approximately two and a half hours. Police and transit authorities observed the attack and arrested the perpetrators near the entrance to the Puertas del Sol neighborhood on the Via a la Costa. One suspect had recently been released from prison, while the other had a prior criminal record.

Around 4 January 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed men on two motorcycles threw a tied-up minor onto La Casuarina Street at dawn. They then shot him in the chest and face with a rifle, killing him. The perpetrators left a note next to the body, announcing the start of a war. Authorities suspect the incident is linked to a conflict between gangs, as the minor was known to have drug-related issues. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a woman in a drive-by shooting in the Los Pinos neighborhood. The victim was walking when the perpetrators intercepted her and fired multiple shots before fleeing. The victim was taken to hospital where she later died from her wounds. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man who was walking to work in a drive-by shooting in the 12 de Noviembre neighborhood. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the attackers.1 fatality.

On 4 January 2023, in Bahia de Caraquez (Manabi), a prisoner known for narcotrafficking was killed while asleep in his prison cell in the Bahia de Caraquez prison. The man was arrested on 30 December 2022 with 3.9 tons of cocaine (coded separately) and transferred to the Bahia de Caraquez prison on 2 January. Reports indicate that this was the third murder within the prison in 15 days (unspecified). There is no further information on the identity of the perpetrators, but criminal gangs are known to operate in Ecuadorian prisons. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2023, in Azogues (Canar), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot a man in a drive-by shooting at a restaurant along Azuay and Luis Pozo streets. The man worked as a waiter in the restaurant where he was shot. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the attackers.1 fatality.

On 4 January 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), armed men driving a taxi pursued a woman on her motorcycle and eventually killed her in a drive-by shooting near La Replica housing cooperative. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the attackers.1 fatality.

Around 5 January 2023 (between 4 - 5 January), in Pedernales (Manabi), an unknown number of armed assailants traveling in a truck shot at two men in a drive-by shooting in the Maria Luisa neighborhood. One man died at the scene, and the other was taken to hospital with several gunshot wounds. One victim had a prior record for robbery. No arrests were made, and initial investigations suggest that the incident was due to a dispute between criminal organizations over territory for drug trafficking. 1 fatality.
On 5 January 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (Pasaje, el Oro), two armed men shot and killed a Venezuelan man in a restaurant. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 5 January 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), four unidentified armed assailants on two motorcycles carried out a drive-by shooting, firing 14 times at a male shellfish salesman and killing him at Pier 43 at the Huayla estuary. Authorities confirmed that the victim had been receiving extortion threats, which he refused to pay. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 5 January 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man who was sitting in front of his home in a drive-by shooting in the San Pablo neighborhood. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Around 5 January 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), a (suspected) criminal gang killed two men and left their bodies along the Daule road in the Lago Capeira sector. One of the two bodies was dismembered. The next day, on 6 January 2023, authorities discovered the dismembered head and leg of a person along the Francisco de Orellana avenue. Authorities suspect that the head and leg belong to the dismembered body found in the Lago Capeira sector the day before. The bodies of the 2 men remain unidentified. 2 fatalities.

On 6 January 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), five unidentified armed assailants, including a woman disguised as a passenger, kidnapped a taxi driver in an express kidnapping. The assailants physically restrained the victim, took control of the vehicle and demanded USD 2,000 for its return. Two suspects were arrested and the victim was released by authorities.

Looting: Around 6 January 2023 (between 5 - 6 January), in the rural area of Zaruma canton (El Oro), various unidentified armed perpetrators held mine workers at gunpoint at a rural mine and looted mining equipment. One perpetrator was arrested after midnight on 6 January, with police forces retrieving a vehicle, a submachine gun, ammunition, an iron rod, and explosive devices.

Around 6 January 2023 (as reported), in Santa Rosa (Tungurahua), three Los Lobos gang members threatened a local family and shot at their home multiple times. The family reported that the three men declared themselves to be members of Los Lobos and threatened to kill them if they continued selling (reports do not clarify whether they referred to selling drugs or to a family business). There were no casualties.

On 6 January 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a male municipal Transit and Mobility Agency (ATM) worker was shot and killed by an unidentified man who fled the scene in a vehicle with at least four other individuals in the Parada 12 sector of the El Panecillo neighborhood. The victim, dressed in civilian clothes, had just stepped out of a vehicle and was walking to work when he was shot. No arrests were made, and the motives remain unclear. This is the second such incident involving the murder of a transit officer in Esmeraldas, with the previous case occurring on 15 September 2022 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 6 January 2023, in Milagro (Guayas), two unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle fatally shot an off-duty officer of the Ecuador Transit Commission (CTE) near the intersection of Victor and 12 de Octubre streets, in a drive-by shooting. The assailants fled the scene and no belongings were taken from the victim. Authorities are investigating the motive, with no arrests made so far. 1 fatality.

On 7 January 2023, off the Coast of Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (described as pirates) shot and injured three fishermen aboard the Don Jacinto vessel during an assault 42 nautical miles from the Port of Manta. The perpetrators fled after firing on the victims. The Ecuadorian Navy later rescued the wounded fishermen and transported them to the Port of Manta, where they received medical attention. There were no fatalities.

On 7 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants shot and killed a motorized tricycle (tricimoto) driver in Pascuales. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 7 January 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), police forces discovered and retrieved three sticks of short-fuse dynamite left in a black bag along Bolivar Madero Vargas Avenue, near the entrance of the Port Authority. There is no further information available on who placed the explosives.

On 7 January 2023, in Tarqui (Azuay), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a fisherman. There is no further information available. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants entered a private home in Bastion Popular, and shot and killed four men inside. Authorities confirmed that this incident is linked to rival gang disputes in the neighborhood. No arrests were made. 4 fatalities.

On 8 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a taxi driver in the Monte Sinai neighborhood (drive-by). No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 8 January 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), four unidentified individuals traveling on two motorcycles shot and killed two men who were at a house with other people in the neighborhood of Los Ceibos. The armed group targeted the first man outside of the house before entering the house and targeting the second man. The two men were shot in the head and the chest. There is no further information on the identity of the two men or on the identity or motive of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: Around 8 January 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was killed and decapitated by unknown individuals and his head was left under a black bag on a pedestrian bridge near the Florida Norte sector. There is no further information on the identity of the victim or on the identity and motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2023, in El Porton (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals in a pickup truck shot and killed two men in a drive-by shooting in the El Tropezon sector. The perpetrators intercepted the target of the attack in El Porton sector, but he attempted to flee and was chased down and shot in El Tropezon, where a stray bullet fatally hit another man. The target of the attack had an unspecified criminal record. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities

On 9 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), four unidentified armed individuals riding two motorcycles shot at an unspecified person in a drive-by shooting in the Simon Bolivar neighborhood on the road to Puerto Bolivar. The victim was unharmed The perpetrators fired multiple shots but failed to hit their target before escaping. Also on 9 January, in Machala, two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting as he walked in the Machalilla neighborhood. The victim had no criminal record. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), two armed men riding a motorcycle chased and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 14 of February neighborhood, in the Platanito sector of the Santa Martha housing cooperative. Authorities suspect that this was a targeted shooting as the man was not robbed. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), two armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting while he was walking along the 24 de Mayo boulevard in the Historic Center. Authorities suspect that the shooting was due to a settling of scores. There is no further information on the identity of the man or the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), two armed men wearing balaclavas attacked a family after breaking into their house in the Bernadita neighborhood. The two men broke through the front door and shot the man eight times while he was laying in bed, killing him instantly. The attackers also shot and injured the man's wife who was sleeping next to him, as well as two teenagers who were in different rooms. The men escaped through the back patio of the house. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), several armed men attacked and kidnapped two men as they were driving a moving van on a road between the San Gabriel del Baba and Julio Moreno Espinosa communities. The two men were transporting furniture. The armed men intercepted the truck and hit the truck driver in the neck with blunt objects after he resisted. The attackers stole the truck and drove the two men to a rural area and contacted the truck driver's family to demand a ransom of USD 3,000 for their exchange. Once released around midnight into the morning of 10 January, the truck driver was taken to a local hospital, where he died from his wounds. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of armed men with rifles opened fire on a group of people outside a house in the Guasmo Sur neighborhood, injuring a couple and a newborn baby with at least 15 gunshots. The baby died shortly after the attack, while the couple was rushed to the hospital. Authorities have not identified the perpetrators or their motives. The victims had no criminal record. There were no fatalities.

On 10 January 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle, shot and killed a Chinese national in a drive-by shooting on the streets Pichincha and Sucre. At least three shots were fired at the victim. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 10 January 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Lopez (Manabi), a man was killed by an unknown group and his body was found with hands tied in the back of a transport truck along Pompeyo Guerra and Garcia Moreno streets. Authorities report that the man died from asphyxiation in the container of the truck. 1 fatality.

Around 11 January 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified assailants killed two people, dismembered their bodies, and placed the remains in multiple bags in the Juan Montalvo neighborhood. Authorities have yet to identify the victims and the perpetrators. 2 fatalities.

Around 11 January 2023 (as reported), in Colembas (Arenillas, El Oro), a male informal taxi driver was shot and killed and his dead body was found, with signs of torture. The victim had been reported missing since the night of 9 January. The man's burned vehicle was later found in Santa Rosa. The number of perpetrators is unknown. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man while he was standing outside of a house in a drive-by shooting in the Primevera 2 neighborhood. The man was standing in front of the house and chatting with a group of people when the two armed men arrived and targeted him, delivering various shots to his head. There is no further information on the identity of the victim or identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle attacked a father and son in a drive-by shooting along Juan Montalvo and 4 Agosto streets. The father and son were riding a motorcycle when the men intercepted them. The man was killed and his son was gravely injured with a gunshot wound in the abdomen. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2023, in Bahia de Caraquez (Manabi), a group of men riding motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting on a central street of the Leonidas Plaza area. The armed men drove around the victim in circles before shooting him. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least eight armed individuals shot and killed a man at his house in the Nueva Prosperina sector. The armed man arrived on various motorcycles and entered the house of the victim, shooting him various times. The mother of the victim was present, but was left uninjured by the attackers. Authorities indicate that the victim had no criminal record. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 12 January 2023, in Jaramijo (Manabi), an unidentified gunman shot a woman while she was driving in the Punta Blanca sector. The victim was critically injured and transported to the hospital, where she later died. Shortly after the attack, a vehicle was found burned nearby, suspected to have been used by the assailants. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 12 January 2023, in Manta (Manabi), at least two armed men shot and killed a Venezuelan man at a public sporting complex in the Ciudadela La Pradera neighborhood. The armed men arrived on a motorcycle, after which one of the men approached the victim on foot and opened fire, escaping the same way he arrived. Another person was injured by a stray bullet. There is no further information in the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 13 January 2023, in Olmedo (Manabi), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a businessman, supporter, and assistant to the mayoral candidate of the Citizen Revolution Movement during a political rally in Briones (drive-by). The perpetrators fled the scene and no arrests were made. The motives behind the attack remain unclear. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Primicias
notes: On 13 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a community leader in his car near Los Ceibos in a drive-by shooting. The perpetrators later abandoned the stolen motorcycle and fled in a car. The victim was known for his work in the Los Ceibos community and for taking steps in improving local security alongside the police force. On 14 January, after several police raids, seven men with linked to the attack were arrested. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 13 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Letamendi (Guayas), two unidentified individuals threw a Molotov cocktail under a parked black pickup truck on Babahoyo and Cristobal Colon streets at around 03:00. The fire spread to a nearby car. After the attack, the perpetrators fled in a vehicle waiting a block away. The vehicle owners reported no prior threats or extortion attempts. No arrests were made.

On 13 January 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), several armed assailants entered a home, shot and killed an elderly man who was under house arrest in connection with a murder investigation. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 13 January 2023 (as reported), in Santa Rosa (El Oro), two men were shot and killed, and their dead bodies were found tied at the hands and feet and with signs of torture in an abandoned cockfighting ring in the neighborhood of Las Palmeras. Police authorities also found two abandoned vehicles with open doors at the scene. The victims had no criminal records. The number of perpetrators is unknown. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 13 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting outside his home on the corner of Guayas and Octava Norte streets. Witnesses stated that the perpetrators fired around 10 shots at the victim. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 13 January 2023 (as reported), near El Carmen (Manabi), an unidentified man was tortured and shot several times in the head by unknown individuals and his body was found along the Paso Lateral road around the city. 1 fatality.

On 14 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants in a car opened fire on a parked vehicle in Horizontes del Fortin neighborhood of Nueva Prosperina (drive-by). The male victim exited the vehicle and attempted to flee but was fatally shot in the head. He had prior records for homicide and illegal possession of firearms. The female passenger was injured and taken to hospital. No arrests were made and the motive remains unclear. 1 fatality.

On 14 January 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a teenage boy in a drive-by shooting on Rio Teaone and Rio Quininde streets. The victim had no criminal record. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 14 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), four unidentified armed assailants riding on two motorcycles killed two men, one of whom was a former police officer, in a drive-by shooting at the intersection of Circunvalacion Sur (ring road) and Palmeras Street, near the Parque Lineal. The victims were in a car at the time of the attack. A nearby woman was hit and injured by a stray bullet. The former police officer had been arrested for robbery in 2009. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Machala Movil
notes: On 14 January 2023, in Loja (Loja), unidentified individuals set and detonated a stick of dynamite in front of the home of a male prison guard in the Tebaida sector, along Jose Artigas and Benjamin Carrion streets. The target worked at the Loja Rehabilitation Center. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. There were no casualties.

On 14 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed men intercepted and fatally shot a motorized tricycle driver in the Guerreros del Fortin neighborhood. The victim was shot multiple times while traveling home. The motive remains unclear and no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 15 January 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), four unidentified armed assailants in a car shot at a group of friends in a drive-by shooting in La Cadena neighborhood. One person was killed at the scene, and two victims were taken to hospital with gunshot wounds. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 15 January 2023 (as reported), in Pachakutik (Archidona, Napo), an unknown number of unidentified assailants shot and killed two men, abandoning their bodies. The victims were identified and had no criminal records. No arrests were made and the motives remain unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 15 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at two brothers in a drive-by shooting in the Tulipanes neighborhood. One victim died at the scene while the other was taken to the hospital with severe injuries. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 15 January 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed three men in a drive-by shooting at a street corner in the Ciudadela Union Lojana neighborhood. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 3 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 15 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three suspected gang members shot at a group of port workers as they were leaving their workplace in a car. The attack, which occurred in the Guasmo Sur sector, killed one worker and injured another. Two of the perpetrators got off a van, approached the workers, and opened fire. Authorities revealed that the victims had no criminal records. They later arrested one attacker, confiscated a rifle, and seized the van used in the attack. The van was linked to several other criminal acts in the city. A note found near the victims' car stated that a 'purge' had begun due to corruption at the port, and that the righteous outnumber the rest. 1 fatality.

On 15 January 2023, in the rural area of Pedernales canton (Manabi), an unidentified group shot and killed four people and injured another three at a family farm in the rural Colisa sector of Santa Teresa. Police identified all of the victims and reported that one of them had a criminal record for robbery while the others did not. One minor was among the people killed. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 4 fatalities.

On 15 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two armed men attacked and injured two personnel from the Guayaquil Transit and Mobility Agency (ATM) during a routine traffic stop along Marcel Laniado de Wind Avenue in the Ciudadela Montebello neighborhood. To avoid the control, the armed men shot one of the agents and struck the other in the head, injuring both. A few days later, the vehicle was located and seized by authorities, though the perpetrators managed to flee. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 15 January 2023 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), police forces seized 1,360 brick-shaped packages of cocaine weighing close to 1.7 tons hidden inside a banana packing facility. Three individuals were arrested. Two vehicles were also impounded and taken to anti-narcotics storage.

On 16 January 2023, in Machala (Machala), two unidentified armed men on two motorcycles shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in Los Vergeles neighborhood. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 16 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants in a car shot at two men in a drive-by shooting in Bastion Popular neighborhood, killing one and injuring the other. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 16 January 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Seis Esquinas sector. The victim was shot in the head four times and had a criminal record. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 16 January 2023 (as reported), in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a group of seven people kidnapped a minor to request 10,000 USD for ransom from his family. Police rescued the minor in the early morning of 17 January 2023 during a house raid in which they apprehended the kidnappers. The minor was discovered tied up.

On 16 January 2023, in Colon (Manabi), a group of armed men shot and killed a man at a brothel near the Colon parish cemetery. The man was with a group of friends but was the only one targeted by the armed man. Authorities indicated that the victim had no criminal record. During the attack, one of the armed men was accidentally shot in the neck and killed by one of his fellow armed group members. 2 fatalities.

On 16 January 2023, in Milagro (Guayas), two armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting while he was walking his dog. Authorities revealed that the victim attempted to escape the attackers through two blocks before they finally intercepted him on their motorcycle. Authorities indicated that the man had a criminal record for theft and the attack was likely a settling of scores. 1 fatality.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Machala Movil
notes: Around 16 January 2023 (as reported), in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), a suspect criminal group tortured and killed four people and left their bodies in a stolen car in the Carlos Rubira Infante neighborhood. Authorities discovered two bodies in the car's cabin and two bodies in the trunk. All four bodies had their hands tied and gunshot wounds to the head. Two of the victims, underage siblings, had been reported as missing to the police minutes before this discovery. The third victim was a known friend of theirs, and the fourth victim had recently moved to Anconcito. No arrests were made and the motives are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 16 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed men in a car killed a man in a drive-by shooting in Las Canas, Monte Sinai. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 16 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least two unidentified gunmen fatally shot a man inside a public transport bus in the Ebenezer neighborhood of Monte Sinai. One assailant blocked the vehicle with a motorcycle while the other boarded and shot a passenger, killing him instantly. The assailants fled the scene. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 17 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed men shot and killed a man who was playing with his young daughter in front of his home in Juan Montalvo neighborhood. The perpetrators fled by car, and no arrests were made. The victim had no criminal record and the motives remain unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 January 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two suspected criminal gang members killed a man and woman in their family home in the Ciudadela El Guayacan neighborhood. The two men entered the house and shot the man 27 times and the woman five times before escaping, sparing the woman's family members who were also in the house. The woman was pregnant with the man's child and was a Venezuelan national. Months before, a criminal organization had placed the man's nickname in a note as a threat. There are no reports on the motivation of the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 17 January 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two armed men shot and injured six members of a family while they were attending a wake in the Galo Plaza sector. The wake was for the armed man who was accidentally killed by one of his fellow armed group members during an attack inside a brothel in Colon on 16 January. The deceased man had an unspecified criminal record. Six people were injured, including two minors. It is suspected that this attack was done in revenge for the victim of the 16 January attack, as the deceased man was the only attacker identified by authorities. The family of the deceased man were not involved in the 16 January attack. There were no fatalities.

On 17 January 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an armed man described as a hitman riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the La Propicia 2 sector. The armed man was tracked down and arrested by police on the same day after reports of him leaving the scene of the attack on a motorcycle. The motivation of the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 18 January 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), two people were killed and their burned and dismembered bodies were found inside sacks. Witnesses stated the bodies were thrown from a car by unknown suspects. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 18 January 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), four individuals riding two motorcycles attacked a university dean and a professor in a drive-by shooting while they were driving a truck together in the Nuevos Horizontes neighborhood. Both men were shot, with the dean dying immediately and the professor driving into a post as he attempted to escape. The professor later died from his wounds at a hospital. The attack occurred a few blocks away from the Luis Vargas Torres University, where the two victims worked. Authorities later arrested four Ecuadorian nationals - two men and two women and one of them a minor - for the attack and confiscated two motorcycles. There are no reports on the motives of the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 18 January 2023, in Pedernales (Manabi), two men on a motorcycle killed a male merchant while he was driving his vehicle in a drive-by shooting along Maximiliano Puertas Street. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 18 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two suspected criminal gang members on motorcycles killed two minors in a drive-by shooting at an informal motorcycle taxi stop along the Casuarina avenue in the Monte Sinai neighborhood. The two victims were brothers who worked as informal taxi drivers. Authorities suspect that the victims were killed for failing to pay the extortion money that criminal gangs often demand from merchants in the sector. Two others were injured in the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 19 January 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), two unidentified men fatally stabbed a restaurant owner over a dozen times inside his establishment on 10 de Agosto and Juan Cuesta avenues. An employee was also injured during the attack and was later detained as a suspect. No arrests were made in connection with the incident, and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso
notes: On 19 January 2023, near Guayaquil (Guayas), four assailants in two cars intercepted a university professor in his vehicle and kidnapped him. They took him to an unknown location, hit him on the head, and demanded a payment of USD 20,000 from his family. After 22 hours, authorities rescued the victim on the Duran-Yaguachi road and arrested four suspects, including a minor who had orchestrated the kidnapping. None of the perpetrators had a criminal record. There were no fatalities.

On 19 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants in a truck carried out a drive-by shooting, targeting two men waiting for a bus outside the Municipal Civil Registry in the Martha de Roldos neighborhood. The attackers fled and later abandoned their vehicle, but authorities managed to capture one suspect. The victims sustained gunshot wounds and were transported to a hospital. The motives for the attack were not disclosed. There were no fatalities.

On 19 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two armed men shot and killed one man and injured another at an informal motorcycle taxi stop along Casuarina avenue in the Monte Sinai neighborhood. The victims worked as informal motorcycle taxi drivers in the area and were approached by the armed men on foot. Fifteen minutes later, in the same area, unidentified armed men shot at four people at another motorcycle taxi stop in the area. They killed three people and injured another. The victims identified by authorities did not have criminal records. The two attackers were later arrested by authorities for the attack in different locations of the city. A similar attack against motorcycle shops in the area related to extortion by criminal groups occurred on 18 January (coded separately). There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 4 fatalities.

Around 20 January 2023 (as reported), in Duran (Guayas) four assailants kidnapped a man for ransom, demanding USD 20,000 for his release. The victim was later rescued by the police and the suspects were arrested.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso
notes: On 20 January 2023, in Milagro (Guayas), three armed assailants, described as hitmen, shot and killed a female student at Milagro State University in a drive-by shooting. Authorities arrested three men linked to the attack, and confirmed that this was a targeted attack, with pictures of the victim found on their phones. The victim had no criminal record, and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 20 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unidentified armed man shot and killed a woman working in a pharmacy in Las Canas neighborhood. Authorities suspect that the victim refused to pay extortion money, as businesses in the neighborhood are often targeted by criminal organizations. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 20 January 2023, in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in front of his home in El Milagro. The perpetrators asked the victim for directions before shooting and killing him. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 20 January 2023, in Loma de Paja (Puebloviejo, Los Rios), a group of around eight armed assailants opened fire on people inside a shop in San Juan, using rifles. The attack left three people dead and two others injured. No arrests have been made, and the motive behind the shooting remains unknown. 3 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: MOVER: Green Revolutionary and Democratic Ethical Green Movement; PSP: Patriotic Society Party; UP: Popular Unity (Ecuador)
source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Machala Movil
notes: On 21 January 2023, in Salinas (Santa Elena), two armed men on a motorcycle killed a mayoral candidate for the UP, PSP, and MOVER parties in a drive-by shooting during a political rally in the Jose Luis Tamayo parish. The two armed men fled to the Eugenio Espejo neighborhood, where they abandoned their motorcycle and boarded a taxi waiting for them. Authorities later arrested one of the attackers with various weapons and munitions. Police suspect that the attack was done as a threat by a criminal group, as the victim had received several anonymous threats over phone calls. He had also vowed to combat corruption in Santa Elena. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 21 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), members of a suspected criminal gang shot a traffic agent from the Guayaquil Transit and Mobility Agency (ATM) in the head twice, killing him at the Carlos Julio Arosemena avenue, near the Alban Borja shopping center. Reports indicate that the attack was due the victim's refusal to pay extortion money to the attackers. The perpetrator fled in a white unidentified car. 1 fatality.

Around 21 January 2023 (as reported), near Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a man was tortured and killed and his body was found on the unnamed road toward the Praderas del Toachi school outside of the city. The man's body was also mutilated and left in a jute sack. Authorities suspect the man had been killed within 24 hours. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2023, in Quito (Pichincha), a group of locals beat a driver who ran over two pedestrians in his car. He hit a first pedestrian, and while fleeing the scene, he hit the second pedestrian and crashed his vehicle, and the group of bystanders pulled him from his car and beat him, and detained him. The man was under civilian restrain when the police arrived at the scene.

On 22 January 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed individuals aboard a vehicle attacked two men in a drive-by shooting as they walked along 111th Avenue in the area known as the Callejon del Diablo or Siete Punaladas sector. Both men were injured and taken to the hospital, but one died from his wounds soon afterward. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a municipal an on-duty traffic agent in the Carlos Julio Arosemena Av., in the north area of the city. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 22 January 2023 (as reported), in Pitahaya (Manabi), a man was stabbed and killed by an unknown group and his body was found partially burned in a vacant lot in the town. Authorities indicated that a trap was set for the victim by unknown individuals. The man had a criminal record of vehicle theft. 1 fatality.

Around 23 January 2023 (as reported), in La Hojita (Urdaneta, Los Rios), four men were shot and killed by unidentified assailants. Their bodies were found in a vacant lot. Authorities identified the victims and suspect that the murders had occurred in a different area before the bodies were abandoned at the scene. None of the victims had a criminal record, and the perpetrators remain unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 23 January 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), a group of armed individuals who arrived on a vehicle and at least one motorcycle shot and killed two men inside a liquor store around Palmas and Jose Pantaleon streets in the Ciudadela Brisas del Mar neighborhood. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

Around 23 January 2023 (as reported), in Tulcan (Carchi), El Tren de Aragua gang members killed a person and buried their body that had their hands tied in a sack in an empty lot. Authorities later arrested nine gang members in the nearby Ciudadela 19 de Noviembre neighborhood for this and another attack around 25 January 2023 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 23 January 2023, near Buenos Aires (Imbabura), a mob of local community members clashed with police personnel who escorted members of the Hanrine mining company operating in the rural El Triunfo area. Local community members attempted to block the mining company from entering the area in repudiation of the company's activities in the area and clashed with the escorting security personnel, leaving several people injured and two community members detained. Later in the night, mining personnel exited from El Triunfo sector due to the community's continued resistance. The community members held a celebratory night march to express their continued resistance to the mining company's presence in the area.

On 24 January 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), four men riding two motorcycles attacked and injured a man in a drive-by shooting in front of a car wash along Zamora avenue. The man was taken to the hospital under police protection. Authorities later arrested three of the attackers. There is no further information on the identity of the victim or on the identity and motivation of the attackers. There were no fatalities.

On 24 January 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), various unidentified armed individuals who arrived in two vehicles shot and killed a woman and attacked a man inside their house on Clemente Yerovi and Huancavilca streets. The man was the target of the attack, but the perpetrators shot and killed the woman as she attempted to defend him. A day later, police authorities discovered the burned remnants of one of the vehicles the perpetrators used in the attack. Authorities later identified one of the attackers after several police raids. 1 fatality.

On 24 January 2023, in Catamayo (Loja), two armed men riding a motorcycle shot at people playing a casino game in a home in the Buenavista sector, San Jose area. The armed men approached the house on foot and opened fire on the people gathered inside, shooting and killing one man. The attackers then fled on a motorcycle and accompanying taxi. Authorities later arrested four people for the attack and confiscated the weapons and vehicles used. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 25 January 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified men riding a motorcycle threw a grenade at the headquarters of a mayoral candidate's campaign (Avanza), who was also a municipal councilor until September 2022. This attack came after the candidate had already survived an attempted assassination earlier in December 2022 (coded separately). Four people were injured in the resulting explosion, but the candidate was unharmed. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Los Lobos Gang (Ecuador); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); R7 Gang (Ecuador)
notes: On 25 January 2023, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Buena Fe, Los Rios), authorities arrested a high-ranking police officer and seven others during an anti-crime operation conducted by the Unidad de Inteligencia Antidelincuencial (UIAD). The officer was charged as the leader of an organized criminal group involved in kidnappings, robberies, and extortion. Authorities linked the group to Los Lobos, Choneros, and R7. Weapons, ammunition, cash, and drugs were seized during the operation.

On 25 January 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed assailants (described as hitmen) shot and killed a man in Coquito Bajo neighborhood. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 25 January 2023 (as reported), in Tulcan (Carchi), nine members of the Tren de Aragua Gang killed a person, tied them and buried their remains in a bag. The perpetrators were arrested by police in the 19 of November neighborhood shortly after. Authorities also seized four firearms, ammunition, five phones, two knifes and drugs. They also found a rope with similar characteristics to that of the crime scene. According to the Public Ministry, the perpetrators also participated in the killing of another person found on 23 January, in similar conditions (coded separately). The victims have not been identified yet. 1 fatality.

On 25 January 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two armed individuals on a motorcycle intercepted a woman riding a motorcycle along La Republica Avenue, near the Ecuadorian Social Security Institute hospital building. The assailants shot her seven times, including five times in the head, and executed her on the ground after she fell. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed men shot and killed a gas station attendant in La Margarita station on the road to the harbour of Esmeraldas. No arrests were made and the motive remains unclear. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 26 January 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), four unidentified armed men who arrived in a pickup truck shot and killed three people and injured others at a private home in the 24 de Mayo neighborhood. The victims were part of the Blue Star Orchestra musical group and were hosting a party. Authorities suspect that the perpetrators had targeted the wrong house, thinking that a man they were chasing had escaped into the house. None of the victims had a criminal record. 3 fatalities.

On 26 January 2023, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), unidentified individuals lit and detonated a stick of dynamite at the front door of a store located between Colon and Libertad streets. Video footage shows the perpetrators placing the explosive and running away. The store owner claimed that he had received several threats and calls from unknown callers, including phone messages accusing him of no longer writing against politicians on social media networks. There were no casualties.

On 26 January 2023, in Pedro Carbo (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants (described as hitmen) shot at a man who then sought refuge in the Fire Department Facility. The assailants pursued him inside, injuring both their target and a firefighter. Both victims sustained critical injuries, but no arrests were made. The motive of the attack remains unclear. There were no fatalities.

On 27 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), a group of locals detained a group of four suspected kidnappers and beat one of them in the San Francisco cooperative. The suspected kidnappers attempted to flee, but the residents surrounded the car and removed one of the men and attacked him. He was transferred to a health center under police custody. Four people were arrested.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2023, near Buena Fe (coded to San Jacinto de Buena Fe, Los Rios), the police confiscated 3 tons of drugs that were hidden in several bags. The drugs were discovered on a farm located in the outskirts of the town. The seizure is suspected to have been a key factor in a subsequent violent retaliation in Daule the next day, where five people were killed (coded separately). One person was arrested.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), Ecuadorian police seized 1.1 tons of cocaine discovered in a shipping container carrying boxes of bananas in the port of Guayaquil. The containers were intended for Belgium. There were no arrests made.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2023, in the rural area near Puerto Chanduy parish (Santa Elena), Ecuadorian police engaged in an operation that captured and dismantled two 500 to 900 meter-long runways that served drug trafficking aircrafts in a rural area between the Tugaduja and Engunga communities. This was done in a simultaneous raid where they seized another runway in Salinas canton (coded separately). Authorities are investigating whether the runways were used by Los Tiguerones Gang members. There were no arrests made.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2023, in the rural area of Salinas canton (Santa Elena), Ecuadorian police engaged in an operation that captured and dismantled a 500 to 900-meter-long runway that served drug trafficking aircrafts in a rural, coastal sector known as La Diablica. This was done in a simultaneous raid where they seized another two runways near Puerto Chanduy parish (coded separately). Authorities are investigating whether the runways were used by Los Tiguerones Gang members. There were no arrests made.

On 27 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle carried out a drive-by shooting at a family of three as they walked home from a restaurant at the intersection of 45 and Francisco Segura streets. The parents were fatally shot, while their son sustained a gunshot wound but survived. One victim had a criminal record for theft and illegal possession of firearms. No arrests were made, and the motive remains unclear. 2 fatalities.

On 28 January 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two unidentified armed individuals fatally shot a man riding a motorcycle near a school in the La Venus neighborhood. The victim was struck by six bullets and had a prior criminal record for robbery in 2018. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 28 January 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), a group of unidentified armed assailants arrived in a taxi car and exited the vehicle to open fire on a group of people attending a wake in the El Coco sector, shooting and injuring five people. The authorship and motivation are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 28 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators (described as hitmen) riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting as he played outside with his grandchildren in sector B of Los Vergeles neighborhood. Police authorities found an abandoned motorcycle and helmet at the scene, suspected to belong to the assailants. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Property destruction: On 28 January 2023, in the rural area of San Jacinto de Buena Fe canton (Los Rios), Ecuadorian police seized around three tons of cocaine hidden in jute sacks during the raid of a farm near Buena Fe. Police confiscated 30 jute bags as well as firearms and ammunition.

On 28 January 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), various armed men in wigs shot and injured four people outside of a restaurant in the Huachi El Belen sector. The armed men waited in a car and shot at the victims as they were closing the restaurant. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. There were no fatalities.

source: El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four armed men in a car shot and killed man and a woman near a supermarket in the Los Rosales sector. The armed men approached the couple as they were exiting the supermarket, shooting and killing the man as he entered his car and shooting and killing the woman as she tried to escape back into the supermarket. Later that day, authorities arrested the four perpetrators, and seized the stolen vehicle used in the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 28 January 2023, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), armed individuals traveling in a white pick-up truck killed two men in a drive-by shooting as they were walking along a street in the San Vicente neighborhood. One man died at the scene while the other was injured but died over a week later while in a hospital. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 29 January 2023, in Puerto Lopez (Manabi), police forces seized around 1.3 tons of cocaine at Los Frailes beach during a police operation in which they intercepted and arrested five individuals who were attempting to load the cocaine from a truck onto a speedboat. Authorities also confiscated the boat, the truck, and a satellite buoy intended for tracking the shipment.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Machala Movil
notes: On 29 January 2023, in Milagro (Guayas), four armed men who arrived on motorcycles shot and killed five people with rifles in a pool hall on Arturo Yepez and Homero Moria avenues, in the Ciudadela Maria Teresa neighborhood. The armed men first shot and killed two men who were standing outside of the building before entering and opening fire on three people inside. Three people were killed and one was gravely injured. There is no further information on the identity and motives of the attackers. 5 fatalities.

actor2: Farc Dissident - Urias Rondon Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces Of Colombia Dissident Faction (Urias Rondon)
notes: Property destruction: On 30 January 2023, in Tobar Donoso (Carchi), Ecuadorian armed forces raided and dismantled a cocaine lab with the capacity to manufacture half a ton of cocaine in Tobar Donoso sector, at the border with Colombia and Esmeraldas canton. Reports later indicated that the lab was in use by the FARC Dissident Urias Rondon Mobile Column.

Around 30 January 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants fired shots at the La Casuarina municipal market, injuring a security guard and his dog. They also intimidated merchants and left threatening notes demanding extortion payments. Authorities suspect the attack was an attempt to pressure vendors into paying these fees. No arrests were made. There were no fatalities.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 30 January 2023, in Pajan (Manabi), armed men got off a motorcycle, shot and injured a female judge from the Pajan canton and her male secretary while they were eating inside La Gallina restaurant on Mayo street. The attackers abandoned and set fire to the motorcycle they used for the attack before fleeing the scene. Both of the victims were gravely injured and hospitalized. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. There were no fatalities.

On 30 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), eight criminal gang members fired their weapons at the house of homeowners who refused to pay their extortion fees in the Paraiso de Flor sector. Security footage reveals the armed men shooting at the exterior of the house. There were no casualties.

Around 30 January 2023 (as reported), in Portoviejo (Manabi), a man was killed by unknown individuals who left his body on the side of the road to Las Canteras de Picoaza, near the Cerro Azul sector. The man was shot 10 times and the body was discovered with his hands tied behind his back. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a taxi driver while he was transporting several passengers in a drive-by shooting along 25 de Junio Avenue. The attackers followed the taxi driver while he was making a trip from Pasaje canton to Machala and managed to intercept him as he slowed down for traffic. They shot him at least 15 times and injured a female passenger who was hit by one of the bullets. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed individuals traveling in a vehicle shot and injured three men in a drive-by shooting in the Divino Nino 2 neighborhood. The three men were hospitalized. Authorities later discovered an abandoned and burned vehicle that the armed individuals used for the attack in the nearby Costa Azul sector, four blocks from the site of the attack. One of the hospitalized men later died from his injuries. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2023, in Playas (Guayas), an unspecified perpetrator shot a man, with one bullet to the head, during the closing of campaign party of CREO mayoral candidate Danny Mite Cruz. The man was taken to a hospital. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

Around 31 January 2023 (between 30 - 31 January), near Duran (Guayas), a man was killed and his body with torture wounds was left, wrapped in plastic bags and tied at the hands and feet, by the roadside near the Puente Alterno Norte (highway bridge). The victim had no criminal record. He was last seen by a relative on 30 January, and his abandoned car was found nearby. Authorities suspect that the victim was kidnapped before being killed. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), various unidentified armed men (described as hitmen) traveling on three motorcycles shot and killed two people in two drive-by shootings in the Flor de Bastion neighborhood. The first victim was killed in Block 2 of the neighborhood, and the second victim was killed in Block 3 around an hour later. Authorities indicated the use of 9mm firearms in both incidents and noted that the victims did not have criminal records. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 31 January 2023, near Buena Esperanza (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed a man along the road to Pajonal, near a banana plantation close to the Hacienda La Maria and Buena Esperanza sectors. Authorities arrived at the scene shortly after the attack and discovered the victim's body with a rope around its neck, indicating that the victim had been asphyxiated and tortured before being executed. Police authorities further recovered around 20 bullet casings at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2023, in Vinces (Los Rios), two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting at a political caravan at the intersection of Cordova and 9 de Octubre streets. The perpetrators fired multiple shots. Three bystanders were injured during the attack. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 January 2023, near San Juan (Los Rios), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a male van driver in a drive-by shooting near the La Aurora rest stop along the San Juan-Babahoyo highway. The man parked at the location to pick up a group of farm workers to take them to a farm in Santa Elena. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); MRC: Citizen Revolution Movement
notes: On 1 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), armed suspects attacked by gunfire a deputy of the national assembly, who is also a mayoral candidate (MRC), in an assassination attempt during a political rally. Videos of the event show a stampede of the crowd running from reported gunshots. The candidate shut his campaign after the attack. Motivation was unknown, although alternative reports indicate that the gunshots were caused by two arguing groups who were attending the rally. There were no casualties.

On 1 February 2023, near Puerto Limon (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), several taxi drivers chased down, beat, and cut off the hand of a man for stealing a cell phone. The man, who was traveling on a motorcycle with one other person, stole a cellphone along the road to Quevedo. Several taxi drivers chased the two men along the road to the entrance of the Puerto Limon parish, where they managed to capture one while the other escaped. After beating him, the taxi drivers burned the man's motorcycle and cut off his hand. There were no fatalities.
On 1 February 2023, in Quito - Tumbaco (Pichincha), two men riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Eugenio Espejo and Abdon Calderon streets. 1 fatality.

On 1 February 2023, in Abdon Calderon (Manabi), at least three men shot and killed a male livestock trader after entering his home. The attackers shot the victim 10 times before leaving the scene. The attack was captured on video, but there is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 1 February 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed an informal taxi driver in a drive-by shooting as he worked at the corner of Azuay and Olmedo streets. The perpetrators shot the victim five times. The family had received threats from an unspecified organized criminal group. 1 fatality.
On 2 February 2023, in Rosa Zarate municipality (Esmeraldas), two armed suspects on a motorcycle fired shots at a female mayoral candidate (CREO). Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: Around 2 February 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Pasaje Canton (coded to Pasaje de las Nieves, El Oro), military personnel and officers of the Control of Weapons, Ammunition and Explosives (CAMEX) unit discovered and removed explosive material in the Cerro Azul sector. Authorities stated that the material was for illegal mining use in the sector. They seized 64 explosive capsules, 52 dynamite-like explosives plugs, 300 meters of slow fuse, and a light generator.

On 2 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), six armed men shot and killed a husband and wife after breaking into their home in the Nueva Prosperina housing cooperative. The armed men announced themselves as police and broke into the home, demanding that the couple hand over their drugs. The couple claimed they did not know about any drugs before being shot and killed by the armed men. The couple's three children were in the house but were left unharmed. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

Around 2 February 2023 (as reported), in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), an unidentified man was killed and his decapitated head was left near the Ciudad Jardin sector, in the woods of the South Metropolitan Park. 1 fatality.

On 2 February 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), a group of residents beat up a male thief and tied him to a pole in the Ciudadela Los Cerezos neighborhood. Police arrived to take the man away. There were no fatalities.

On 2 February 2023, in Pedernales (Manabi), two individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Jaime Roldos and Maria Auxiliadora streets in the Siete Punaladas neighborhood. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); MC25: Construye Movement Party
notes: On 2 February 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), unidentified perpetrators fired 10 shots during the closing election campaign party of the mayor of the city (MC25), who was running for re-election, along Chone Avenue. There is no further information available. Police arrested two suspects. There were no casualties.

On 2 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), various unidentified individuals traveling by car fired multiple shots at the facade of a store in a drive-by shooting in the Martha de Roldos neighborhood. Authorities collected 28 bullet casings at the scene. Locals indicated that the attack may be linked to extortion attempts, similar to those reported in the nearby Las Orquideas neighborhood. There were no casualties.

On 2 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed two men as they worked at a hydraulic vehicle parts workshop in a drive-by shooting along the 25 de Julio Avenue in the Santa Monica neighborhood. The victims had no criminal records.1 fatality.

On 2 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle shot and killed a male teenager in the Socio Vivienda 2 sector. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 3 February 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two men riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Maria Auxiliadora alley. The victim was playing bingo with a group of people but was targeted by the armed men. There is no information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 3 February 2023, in Daule (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting at a funeral home in the urban Banife parish. The victim's father owned the funeral home, but he was not there to work. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso
notes: Around 3 February 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), a man was killed and his body, with hands and feet tied, was found floating in the Salado estuary near the Antonio Neumane housing cooperative in the Isla Trinitaria sector near the Guayaquil port. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Comercio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 4 February 2023, in Puerto Lopez (Manabi), two armed men shot and killed a candidate for the mayor's office (MRC) of the municipality, and injured three other people, inside a commercial building along Machalilla Avenue, hours before regional elections. The three injured people were taken to the hospital, but one died hours later. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle and entered the building to target the candidate. The candidate had received extortion calls days before. A pamphlet was discovered nearby in which the New Generation Cartel took credit for the attack, claiming that the mayoral candidate was affiliated with the Los Tiguerones Gang. 2 fatalities.

On 4 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), five armed men armed with rifles opened fired on a group of people watching an amateur league game at La Isla football field, initially killing two and wounding another six. Three of the six wounded later died from their injuries. One of the two men who were killed on-site was the target of the attack and had a criminal record of robbery and weapon possession. The armed men shot him multiple times in the head and shot him again as they left the football field. At least 100 people were present at the football field when the armed men opened fire on their target and the people around him. Police authorities suspect that the target of the attack was related to one of the five people killed on 28 January by a group of armed perpetrators in Daule, Guayas (coded separately). 5 fatalities.

On 4 February 2023, in Rosa Zarate (Quininde, Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed a man in the San Jose de los Aserrios neighborhood by shooting him 15 times in the back. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 4 February 2023 (from 3 - 4 February), in El Carmen (Manabi), unidentified armed men shot at the home of the MRC mayoral candidate for El Carmen, firing multiple times at the house. The same armed men returned a few hours later, in the early morning of 4 February, to open fire at the front of the home. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown. There were no casualties.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 5 February 2023, in Palestina (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators opened fire against the house of a mayoral candidate (MRC) in the Primero de Diciembre neighborhood. The shot at the house four times. The mayoral candidate declared the action an assassination attempt. The motivation is unknown. There were no casualties.

On 5 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two armed individuals who arrived on a motorcycle shot at five men in a house in the 1 de Agosto housing cooperative in the Guasmo sector, killing two and injuring the other three. One of the attackers got off the motorcycle, stuck his weapon through the front fence of the house and opened fire. Of the two victims killed, one had a criminal record for robbery and indecent (sexual) assault, while the other had no criminal record. There is no information on the criminal record of the three injured victims, who were hospitalized. 2 fatalities.

On 5 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), two armed men shot and killed a man on P-6 street in El Pacifico neighborhood. The man was visiting the house of his girlfriend when he was intercepted by two men on a motorcycle (drive-by). One of the armed men shot him 15 times in the head, back, arms, and legs. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle injured a couple in a drive-by shooting outside a house in the 8 de Marzo cooperative, near La Pradera. The victims were hospitalized. Police authorities believe they were collateral victims as the attackers were looking for other individuals. There were no fatalities.

On 5 February 2023, in Palestina (Guayas), fights broke out between supporters of two political parties at a polling station during the vote count for the Ecuador 2023 elections. The disturbances occurred both inside and outside the facility, where rioters kicked doors and threw bottles and other objects. Police and armed forces intervened to disperse the rioters. There were no fatalities.

On 5 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed men traveling on a pickup truck killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the El Desquite 4 sector. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2023, in Rosa Zarate (Quininde, Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man as he was in his vehicle with his wife in a drive-by shooting on Jorge Chiriboga Avenue in the Nuevo Quininde sector. His wife was also injured by one of the bullets. Likewise, four unidentified armed individuals riding two motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting on 5 de Agosto Avenue in central Quininde (Rosa Zarate). The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 5 February 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man driving his vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the El Matecito sector. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Military Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); PSC: Social Christian Party (Ecuador)
notes: On 5 February 2023, in Santa Lucia (Guayas), a group of rioters attempted to storm a polling station and hit the mayor of Santa Lucia (PSC party member) with stones and bottles, injuring him in the knee and leg. The rioters belonged to an unspecified opposing party and were accused of attempting to burn ballots at the polling station. Police and military forces intervened. There were no fatalities.

On 6 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three armed men shot and killed a woman in a house in the 3 de Noviembre housing cooperative in the Guasmo sector. One of the attackers got off the motorcycle and entered the house, shooting at the four people inside, while the other two waited outside. The victim's husband and two male friends escaped through the back of the house, but the victim was hit multiple times with gunfire. One of the men present later indicated that this was an attack intended for himself, but there is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 6 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in Block 17 of the Flor de Bastion neighborhood. The perpetrators chased down the victim as he attempted to flee and fired six shots, striking him in the head and thorax. The victim had an unspecified criminal record and police are investigating whether the attack was an act of retaliation. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a woman in a drive-by shooting in Block 6 of the Union de Bananeros housing cooperative in the Guasmo Sur sector. The perpetrators intercepted the victim while she walked on the street. A man standing with her was also injured. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 February 2023, in Salinas (Ibarra, Imbabura), around 50 individuals attacked police officers with sticks and stones to prevent the transport of two impounded trucks carrying illegally mined resources. The rioters set up barricades and damaged two police vehicles, forcing authorities to release two of the five detained suspects and allowing the trucks to be taken. The police managed to transport the remaining three detainees to a secure location and have launched an investigation to identify those responsible. There were no fatalities.

Around 7 February 2023 (as reported), near Machala (El Oro), a man was stabbed and killed and his dead body was found, with hands tied up, along a rural path near the road to Puerto Grande. The victim had stab wounds in the back and thorax. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 7 February 2023 (as reported), in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), a criminal gang kidnapped a father and son in the San Antonio de Pichincha neighborhood. The gang blindfolded, robbed, and kidnapped the two victims with the intention of holding them for ransom. On 7 February 2023, Police forces raided the gang's house of operation in the same neighborhood and rescued the father and son, who were tied up. Authorities arrested eight gang members and confiscated military uniforms, firearms, ammunition, drugs, a vehicle, and cash in their possession.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo
notes: On 7 February 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), a group of local residents, including Indigenous community members, caught and burned the car of four perpetrators who attempted to rob a restaurant in the Carmen de Guzho neighborhood. The perpetrators were repelled by the restaurant owner, who was armed, and chased off by a group of local residents who witnessed the event. They drove off but left their car behind in an attempt to escape. The group of residents lit the vehicle on fire, calling for the death and burning of criminals. Firefighters arrived to put out the vehicle fire. There were no casualties.

Around 7 February 2023 (as reported), near Ambato (Tungurahua), at least five Los lobos gang members kidnapped two unidentified people for extortion. On 7 February, police freed the two victims during a police raid in the Atocha sector, where they were discovered tied up. During the raid, Police also arrested five gang members present and confiscated various arms and drugs. The same police officers continued the raid in the nearby Atahualpa parish, where they arrested another two Los Lobos gang members who were part of the same cell. There was no report of an armed clash during the police raids.

On 7 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two armed men riding a motorcycle attacked four people traveling by car in a drive-by shooting along Domingo Comin avenue in the Guasmo Sur sector, killing three while injuring the other. The armed men shot at the vehicle 15 times. One of the killed victims was a teenager.
