There is no further information on the identity of the victims or identity and motivation of the perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

On 7 February 2023, in Leonidas Plaza (24 de Mayo, Manabi), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting as he stood on the porch of a house. The perpetrators shot him multiple times. Two others were injured in the attack and were transported to hospital. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 8 February 2023, in Sucre (Manabi), a female candidate for city council (PSP) and her husband were kidnapped for extortion by a criminal group that demanded 3 million dollars for their release. The perpetrators broke into the couple's homes to kidnap them. The two victims were later freed on 18 February by Anti-Kidnapping and Extortion (UNASE) police officers during a raid in the Crucita parish in Portoviejo. There were no arrests made.

On 8 February 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man inside a brothel along Bolivar and Azuay streets. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle, entered the establishment, and shot the victim nine times in the head before fleeing. The victim had prior criminal records for weapons possession and robbery. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 8 February 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), police forces intercepted and confiscated a fuel truck carrying 1.7 tons of cocaine. Authorities arrested the truck drivers, two men and a woman, for drug trafficking.

On 8 February 2023, in Abdon Calderon (Manabi), unidentified armed men traveling in a vehicle committed a drive-by shooting on a group of people waiting at the Santa Clara bus stop, killing one man. The group, who were friends, dispersed as the perpetrators opened fire but one was injured and died later at a regional hospital. The armed men later abandoned the vehicle they used in the attack at the nearby community of Jose-Playaprieta in the Rio Chico parish. There is no further information available on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 8 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two men riding a motorcycle killed a man walking along a street in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Santa Rosa neighborhood of 24 de Mayo parish. The perpetrators shot the man 26 times. 1 fatality.

On 8 February 2023, in Balzar (Guayas), two unidentified armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed a man, an unspecified local government employee, in a drive-by shooting while he rode his motorcycle in the Rosa Paredes neighborhood. The victim tried to avoid the shot and crashed his motorcycle into a fence, where the attackers killed him with three more shots to the head and torso. Police authorities suspect the attack to be a settling of scores. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 February 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), a man was shot and killed and his dead body was found with gunshot wounds to the head in the El Guayabo sector. A note was left next to the victim's body that accused him of being a thief and extortionist. The victim had a criminal record for robbery. The number of perpetrators is unknown. The authorship is unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 9 February 2023, in Latacunga (Cotopaxi), two foreign men (suspected to be Venezuelan) accused of wanting to commit a homicide and a robbery at a gas station were beaten, burned, and killed by a group of locals in the Toacazo neighborhood. The perpetrator's firearm malfunctioned, leading to their capture and subsequent beating by a mob before being set on fire. While reports indicated indigenous justice, indigenous organizations stated that the attack could be linked to local gangs and that the confrontation between criminal groups. Police suspect the perpetrators are part of Venezuelan criminal gangs involved in drug trafficking, arms, and money disputes. Investigations are ongoing. 2 fatalities.

Defusal: On 9 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), unidentified perpetrators threw an unlit dynamite stick at the house of a national police sergeant along Abdon Calderon 21 and 22 streets in the Viva Alfaro parish. Intervention and Rescue (GIR) police officers retrieved the explosive. There is no further information available on the identity or motivation of the perpetrators.

On 9 February 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting near Kennedy and Gran Colombia avenues. The man was also on a motorcycle and was being chased by the attackers, but got off at one point to run toward a police station to seek help, where the attackers caught up to him and shot him. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 9 February 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Bajo de La Palma canton (Manabi), unidentified perpetrators killed a man and his burned body with its hands tied was found in the rural Tres Cruces sector. The man was a resident of the nearby Toalla Chica community and had been missing for various days. 1 fatality.

On 9 February 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), various armed men riding multiple motorcycles killed a man sitting in front of his home in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Las Orquideas neighborhood. The man attempted to run into the house but was shot multiple times. He was transported to a hospital where he died. 1 fatality.

On 9 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), armed men shot and killed a man at the corner of Maldonado and Tulcan streets. The attackers recorded a short video of the attack. There is no information on the motivation of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 9 February 2023, in Nobol (Guayas), four unidentified armed assailants riding motorcycles shot and injured two men while they were at a juice and toast stand in a drive-by shooting on the corner of Rio Amazonas and Eloy Alfaro streets. Both victims were hospitalized, and neither had a criminal record. There were no fatalities.

On 9 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), either one or two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man while he was driving a trimotor taxi in a drive-by shooting along Patate and San Lorenzo streets in the Vilcabamba sector, in Pascuales. The victim was shot six times. He was working at the time. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 February 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), two unidentified armed assailants riding a motorcycle through Calderon Street shot and killed a woman in a drive-by shooting. The woman was a leader of the local LGBTQ+ community, known as the queen of the community. 1 fatality.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

notes: Around 10 February 2023 (as reported), in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a man was killed, and his dead body was found tied to a tree, with a plastic bag over his head and showing signs of violence, in the park around Bomboli hill. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 10 February 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Zaruma canton (El Oro), military forces discovered and seized explosive materials used for illegal mining in the area around El Calvario mountain. Authorities confiscated 12,400 meters of slow fuse, 3,360 non-electric detonators, 8,300 ordinary capsules, 600 pieces of slow fuse with fulminate, and 750 meters of unmarked detonating cord. There were no arrests.

On 10 February 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (described as hitmen), disguised as delivery workers, shot and injured a barber inside his shop near the IESS Hospital. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle carrying balloons and a gift, knocked on the door, and asked for the barber before shooting him around 11 times. A bystander was also injured by a stray bullet. The perpetrators escaped the scene when a local security guard approached. Both victims were hospitalized. The authorship and motivation are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 10 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in front of his home near 39 and Sedalana streets by shooting him 10 times. The reason for the attack is suspected to be for a settlement of scores. The victim had served a jail sentence for an unspecified crime. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the La Propicia neighborhood. The perpetrators opened fire on a group of four people, hitting the victim six times. Two other men were injured and hospitalized. Police indicate that the victim had a criminal record for robbery and that the attack may have been related to drug trafficking. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2023, in Balzar (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Sinaloa neighborhood. The perpetrators shot the victim more than four times before fleeing. The victim had recently fled from Guayaquil after a previous attempt on his life and was staying with relatives in Balzar (unspecified). The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2023, in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals on two motorcycles killed two men in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. The perpetrators opened fire on a group standing outside a house, hitting one victim with at least five shots to the head and back, killing him instantly. The second victim was shot in the head and chest and later died at a hospital. Police are investigating whether the attack was linked to territorial disputes between criminal groups. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 11 February 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting outside his home in the Salinas neighborhood. The victim was shot over ten times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 February 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), three armed individuals (likely Los Aguilas Gang members) shot and killed a man (likely a Los Lobos Gang member) in a drive-by shooting along Octavia and Brasil streets. A male teenager who was present on the street also died from a stray bullet. Reports indicated that this attack was a retaliation for an attack involving the two gangs on 8 February 2023 in Guayaquil (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 11 February 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), between three to six armed men on motorcycles killed one person and injured two others in a drive-by shooting in the Flor de Bastion neighborhood. Moreover, unidentified perpetrators killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Proletarios Sin Tierra housing cooperative. 2 fatalities.

On 11 February 2023, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), two men shot and killed another man after entering his home in the Miguel Cilio neighborhood. One additional man present was injured collaterally. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. Police arrested three suspects the next day. 1 fatality.

On 11 February 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), four criminal gang members shot at four friends, two men and two women, who were chatting along a street in the Santa Martha housing cooperative. The perpetrators fired at least 50 gunshots. All the victims were injured, but one of the two women later died from her injuries. Reports indicate that the target of the attacks was either one of the men, who had been threatened before, or one of the women, who had rejected associating with one of the gang members. 1 fatality.

Around 12 February 2023 (as reported), in Coco Viche (El Oro), a man was shot and killed and his dead body was found at the entrance of the resort at El Coco beach. The victim was shot various times in the head. Authorities recovered five bullet casings at the scene. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 12 February 2023 (as reported), in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a male taxi driver was shot and killed, and his dead body was found inside his taxi near the Juventud Park along the Quito highway. The victim was shot multiple times from outside the taxi. Police authorities described the perpetrators as suspected hitmen. A second report from the same source indicates that the man was killed at the Zaracay esplanade after an argument with a group of people, who placed his dead body in the taxi and pushed it to the location where it was found. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.
On 12 February 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), two armed individuals killed a man in a drive-by shooting while he was outside his home in the Ciudadela San Francisco neighborhood. 1 fatality.

Around 12 February 2023 (as reported), near Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), unidentified perpetrators killed an unidentified man and his body was found with hands and feet tied, near the Perimetral Road around the city. 1 fatality.

On 12 February 2023, in Montalvo (Los Rios), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man inside the El Paisa billiards hall on Babahoyo and Lindon Marino streets. The perpetrators entered the establishment and fired seven shots at the victim. Police indicate that the victim had a criminal record related to drug possession and illegal firearm possession. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 12 February 2023, in Ricaurte (San Lorenzo, Esmeraldas), various hooded individuals armed with rifles and wearing military-style clothing shot and killed two men and caused an explosion that injured a woman. The perpetrators entered the victim's house and forced them into the street before shooting them various times. One victim was a Colombian national. The perpetrators also left and detonated an explosive device that caused damage to the front of the house and injured a woman. It is suspected that the woman was injured, but local witnesses claimed she died in the explosion. Authorities suspect a criminal group was responsible. The motivation is unknown. At least 2 fatalities.

On 12 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man riding a stolen motorcycle in the Nueva Prosperina sector. The attack took place near the residence of a teenager under house arrest for the killing of a man involved in drug trafficking on 16 June 2022 (coded separately). Reports indicate that the perpetrators may belong to the same criminal group as the teenager, who were keeping guard of the house in fear of retribution from a rivalling criminal group. Police authorities have not confirmed whether the victim was attempting to attack the teenager under house arrest. On 15 February, the same armed individuals who suspected of perpetrating this attack killed two men in the same neighborhood they suspected of coming to kill the teenager (attack coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 13 February 2023, in Licto (Chimborazo), indigenous citizens of Tulabug Escaleras community captured, stripped of their clothes, whipped with nettle and threw cold water at two suspected robbers. They followed Indigenous Justice rituals that are protected by the constitution with a police officer's supervision. The suspected robbers were later released.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 13 February 2023, in Camilo Ponce Enriquez (Azuay), an unidentified assailant riding a motorcycle shot at the mayor in a drive-by shooting outside the local government offices while he was carrying out his Monday-morning public audience with local residents. The mayor was injured, and the assailant escaped. The victim was also a candidate running for re-election (Azuay Primero). There were no fatalities.

actor2: Farc Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces Of Colombia Dissident Faction
notes: Property destruction: Around 13 February 2023 (as reported), in Tobar Donoso (Carchi), Ecuadorian armed forces raided and dismantled a cocaine lab with the capacity to host 50 workers and manufacture half a ton of cocaine in the Tobar Donoso sector, at the border with Colombia and Esmeraldas canton. Authorities declared that the lab was operated by FARC Dissident Groups.

Property destruction: On 13 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot at the front of a store in the Mucho Lote 1 neighborhood, damaging it. Reports indicate that this was likely an act of extortion by a criminal gang. There were no casualties.

On 13 February 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), two perpetrators killed a garbage collector in the El Pacifico neighborhood. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 13 February 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police confiscated over 1 ton of cocaine in a container in the port of Guayaquil. The drugs were intended for the Netherlands. There were no arrests made.

On 13 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), three heavily armed individuals shot and killed a male ex-police officer in a shopping area in the center of the city, collaterally injuring his female partner. The couple was boarding their vehicle when they were intercepted by the armed perpetrators, who stepped off a pick-up truck and opened fire around 50 times. The police officer was discharged in 2013 and was briefly jailed after participating in a robbery in 2022. Reports indicate that this attack was likely in connection to the group he was jailed with. 1 fatality.

On 13 February 2023, in Balzar (Guayas), two armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man traveling in his vehicle in a drive-by shooting along Victor Manuel Rendon street. The perpetrators rode away after firing five shots. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 13 February 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), three armed individuals (described as hitmen) shot and killed three people, all family members, in their home in the Los Tulipanes neighborhood. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle and entered the house, where they shot and killed a mother, her daughter, and her daughter's male partner. A young witness mentioned that the perpetrators made the family kneel, killing them in an execution. 3 fatalities.

On 14 February 2023, in Santa Marianita (Manabi), various unidentified armed men described as hitmen shot and injured a man in the Pescador neighborhood. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 14 February 2023 (between 14 - 16 February), in Ancon (Santa Elena), a taxi driver was shot and killed and his dead body was discovered, with hands tied and showing signs of torture, behind the parish cemetery. The victim had gone missing on 14 February, with authorities suspecting that he had been kidnapped and had his taxi vehicle stolen. Police authorities also suspect that the victim was killed on the same day he disappeared, but this is not confirmed. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 February 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), four criminal gang members traveling on two vehicles opened fire at the national Judiciary Council building in Santo Domingo, firing over 35 bullets and injuring one lawyer working there. A few minutes later, authorities discovered a burned vehicle that was likely used in the attack. Police indicate that the target of the attack was a man who had been arrested earlier that day with four other gang members and was being held in the building. There were no fatalities.

On 14 February 2023, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), various armed suspects entered the house of a Venezuelan national and tortured, stabbed, shot, and killed him, leaving his body in the bathtub. The motivation of the attack is unknown, as the man did not have a criminal record. 1 fatality.

On 14 February 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified and heavily-armed individuals shot and killed a man at a bus stop. The man was leaving on a bus to Cuenca. The victim's mother was present but unharmed, and she indicated that the victim had received death threats for an unknown reason, and did not often leave their home as a result. Police suspect the attack to be linked to unspecified illegal border activities. Over a dozen bullet casings were found at the scene. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 February 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (described as hitmen) shot and killed a man inside a beauty salon in the 18 de Noviembre neighborhood. Two bystanders were also injured in the attack. The perpetrators used a vehicle that was later found burned. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in block 7 of the Paraiso de la Flor housing cooperative. Two passengers in a nearby-by taxi were injured by stray bullets. 1 fatality.

On 15 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified perpetrators (coded as/likely criminal gang members), attacked three Colombian nationals who had recently been released from prison, shooting them, killing two and injuring one, in the Ciudadela Costa Azul neighborhood. Reports indicate that the Colombian nationals were only in the country for a few days, and were likely hired to commit an attack, before they were caught and jailed around 13 January for possessing a stolen vehicle. There was security camera footage of the attack. Police recovered the vehicle used in the attack nearby, which the perpetrators burned and abandoned. 2 fatalities.

On 15 February 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting outside a mechanic shop where he worked in the Abdon Calderon neighborhood. The victim was working on a vehicle in front of the shop when he was shot twice by the perpetrators. Police are investigating whether this murder is connected to the recent killings of the Concha family in the Los Tulipanes neighborhood on 14 February (coded separately). The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 February 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals killed a man in a drive-by shooting outside a bar in the Zona Rosa area. Two Venezuelan women, who were working at the bar, were also shot and injured. The women were collateral victims. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 16 February 2023, in Turi (Azuay), inmates detained seven prison guards during a shift change at Turi Prison.

Weapons seizure: On 16 February 2023, in Giron (Azuay), police forces raided a house where both long and short firearms (rifles and pistols) were manufactured and sold. The operation resulted in the seizure of 29 firearms. Reports indicate that this seizure affected criminal delinquent groups. There were no arrests reported.

On 16 February 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a taxi driver in the Puerto Nuevo neighborhood. Witnesses indicated that a perpetrator shot at the taxi driver from within the vehicle and fled the scene on a motorcycle after killing the driver. Police authorities discovered four bullet casings within the taxi and one outside of it. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Movement of forces: Around 16 February 2023 (as reported), along the border with Colombia in northern Esmeraldas (coded to San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas), the Armed Forces of Ecuador mobilized 12,000 troops to guard the border area in response to a cross-border incursion by the Urias Rondon FARC dissident group near the border towns of El Pan, Corriente Larga, Guadalito, and Ricaurte. The Urias Rondon group crossed into Ecuador following unspecified clashes with the Oliver Sinisterra front in Colombia over drug trafficking.
On 16 February 2023, in Daule (Guayas), two armed individuals riding a trimotor killed a man in a drive-by shooting as he was approaching his parked vehicle along Jose Olmedo street. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 16 February 2023 (as reported), in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), police forces raided a property in Calacali sector and confiscated 19 tons and 275 kilos of calcium chloride, illicitly held chemicals for the manufacturing of 60 tons of cocaine. Police arrested 6 criminal gang members present and reported that they effectively dismantled their criminal drug operation active in the cantons Quito, Guayaquil, and Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas.

On 16 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators riding a motorcycle attacked a group of people in a drive-by shooting along Callejon Parra and 42 streets, injuring three people. There were no fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso
notes: On 16 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle (described as hitmen) shot and killed a woman who was playing bingo outside of her home in a drive-by shooting in block 4 of the Union de Bananeros housing cooperative, in the Guasmo sector. The victim was a former member of an unspecified criminal group and had a criminal history for robbery, drug trafficking, and homicide. The victim's nephew was killed in a similar attack in the same neighborhood on 23 May 2023 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 16 February 2023, on a rural road between Valencia and Quevedo cantons (coded to Valencia, Los Rios), unidentified perpetrators traveling in a pick-up truck attacked a man and woman in a drive-by shooting, killing the woman and injuring the man. The couple was traveling together on a motorcycle from Valencia to Quevedo when they were attacked. The man had an unspecified criminal record and was likely the target of the attack. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: Around 16 February 2023 (as reported), in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), police officers seized and decommissioned a large quantity of dynamite explosives during an operation in the Carcelen neighborhood. The explosives were found during the inspection of a man riding a motorcycle, who was subsequently arrested. Bags of drugs were also confiscated. Police authorities suspect the dynamite was intended for criminal attacks.

On 17 February 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), unidentified perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Callejon Ardilla. Police discovered an abandoned vehicle likely used by the attackers near the site of the attack, with weapons inside. 1 fatality.

On 17 February 2023, in Palestina (Guayas), two armed subjects shot and killed the owner of El Sol night club, at the front entrance of his establishment, in a drive-by shooting along Fausto Espinoza avenue. The attackers shot the man 10 times before driving away. 1 fatality.

On 17 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators traveling on two motorcycles killed two men, and injured one other, in a drive-by shooting outside of a house in the Guasmo sector. Also on 17 February 2023, in Guayaquil, unidentified perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed two people on the street in a drive-by shooting in the Derechos de los Pobres housing cooperative. 4 fatalities.

On 17 February 2023, around La Esperanza parish (Los Rios), a group of armed individuals traveling on two vehicles (a car and motorcycle) killed a male driver in a drive-by shooting along the road to El Vergel. The man was a local banker and was discovered dead in his vehicle. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 17 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), members of an unidentified crime group kidnapped a truck driver and purposefully crashed and set his truck on fire in the Kennedy Norte sector. At the same time, different members of the same group robbed the Plaza Vendome jewelry store at the same hotel. Around 15 criminal group members participated in the simultaneous events. Authorities suspected that the perpetrators burned the truck to distract authorities from their attack on the jewelry store. The group stole around USD $500,000 worth of merchandise. On 19 February, the truck driver was liberated after 24 hours of being abducted. It is not specified whether the man was freed by police or released by his kidnappers.
On 17 February 2023, in Balzar (Guayas), armed men traveling on a motorcycle shot and killed two men in a drive-by shooting along El Estudiante avenue. 2 fatalities.

Around 17 February 2023 (as reported), in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), unidentified perpetrators killed and dismembered a man and the upper half of his body was found in a black bag along Simon Bolivar Avenue. 1 fatality.

On 17 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), four armed individuals who arrived on two motorcycles shot and killed two people inside a tattoo parlor in the Stella Maris sector. Two of the perpetrators, the passengers, got off the motorcycles and entered the establishment, where they shot the two people inside. The identity and motivation of the perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 17 February 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed individuals traveling by motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting at his art workshop on El Oro Street. The victim was the brother-in-law of the prefect of Esmeraldas. Police authorities suspect that the attack was due to extortion. The perpetrators shot the victim at least five times in the head. There have been various attacks on local administrators of Esmeraldas Prefecture due to ongoing extortions threats by an unspecified criminal group (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 18 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling by vehicle shot and killed a man along the Burro River between the Simon Bolivar and Santa Clara neighborhoods (drive-by). At least seven bullet casings were found at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 18 February 2023, in San Pablo (Manabi), at least two unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed a man in San Pablo parish, shooting him over 26 times. Authorities discovered a burned and abandoned vehicle nearby, near Espejo in Pedro Gual streets, that the perpetrators likely used for the attack. Police reported that the armed attack was drug related. Two perpetrators were later arrested. Also on 18 February, in Portoviejo, an unknown number of armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed two brothers in a drive-by shooting in the El Floron 4 neighborhood. Authorship and motivation for each event is unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 18 February 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela La Francisca neighborhood. Upon seeing the perpetrators, the man attempted to flee in a direction but was shot as one of the perpetrators caught up to him. The perpetrators shot at the man around 18 times (with a different source saying at least 10 times). Also on 18 February, in Pasaje de las Nieves, two unidentified armed individuals killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Enrique Rengel and Oswaldo Hurtado streets. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 18 February 2023, in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 9 de Octubre neighborhood. The victim had received threats that advised him to leave the area from an unspecified group. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 February 2023, in Quito - Tumbaco (Pichincha), local residents at Puembo parish captured three suspected thieves, two women and one man, following an attempted robbery at a pharmacy and set fire to their motorcycle. The residents detained the three individuals and turned them over to police. They then set fire to the suspect's motorcycle in response to the crime.

On 19 February 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), a group of individuals shot and injured four people, a family of two men and two women, at their home in the Nuevos Horizontes neighborhood. The group of individuals arrived at the scene in a vehicle and stepped out of it to open fire at the victims, who were hospitalized. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 19 February 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators tortured and killed a male taxi driver and his body was found with its hands tied, in a ditch. The man was reported missing on 10 February and was last seen driving passengers near the Guayaquil bus terminal. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Property destruction: Around 19 February 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of La Bonita village (Sucumbios), Ecuadorian armed forces raided and dismantled a cocaine lab with the capacity to manufacture two tons of cocaine in La Barquilla sector, near the Colombian border. Police confiscated various resources and materials, including weapons and munitions. There were no arrests made.

On 19 February 2023, in Saquisili (Cotopaxi), a group of people, including Indigenous community members, captured a man attempting to rob people at a bus terminal and stripped off his clothes, whipped him with nettle, and threw cold water at him. The group followed Indigenous Justice rituals that are protected by the constitution and proclaimed that they would enforce punishment on criminals in the area. The event was recorded by surrounding witnesses. There were no fatalities.

On 19 February 2023, in Anconcito (Santa Elena), two armed men riding a motorcycle attacked a man as he was walking with his wife in a drive-by shooting in El Faro sector. The perpetrators fired at the man at point-blank range but missed his vital organs. The man was hospitalized for his injuries but remained stable. There were no fatalities.

On 19 February 2023, in Colimes (Guayas), two armed subjects (likely gang members due to threats received by the victim) entered a house and killed a man who was playing cards. The man was a local musician and had no previous criminal record. Police reported that he had received previous threats from a criminal gang, but no further information is available. 1 fatality.

On 19 February 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), two armed men killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Jorge Moreno and Union Nacional Ecuatoriana streets. 1 fatality.

On 19 February 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in a busy commercial area near the city's pier. Witnesses reported hearing over ten shots fired. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 February 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals in two vehicles attacked a family celebrating Carnival outside their home, killing one man and injuring six other family members. The perpetrators used rifles. One vehicle used in the attack was found abandoned the following morning. Two victims had unspecified criminal records. Police are investigating whether the attack was connected to local narcotrafficking. 1 fatality.

On 19 February 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a group of unidentified perpetrators (described as delinquents) in two cars and five motorcycles kidnapped a couple for extortion. The perpetrators took the couple's parked vehicle while the two of them were inside. The man managed to escape through the vehicle's window, while the woman was taken to an undisclosed location. Police authorities liberated the woman on the same day and arrested one perpetrator for extortion and kidnapping. The perpetrators were planning on dismantling the stolen vehicle.

Around 20 February 2023 (as reported), in Colembas (Arenillas, El Oro), two men were shot and killed and their dead bodies were found in a farm area. Each victim was shot multiple times, with one victim having six gunshot wounds to the head. Police authorities suspect the victims were executed at the location where they were found. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 20 February 2023 (as reported), near Bahia de Caraquez (Manabi), unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a taxi driver and his body was found with his hands tied, inside his taxi along kilometer 9 of the Caraquez-Tosagua, near the La Cantera sector in Bahia. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 20 February 2023, in Noboa (Manabi), two armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man who was sitting outside his home in a drive-by shooting. The man was a local businessman and was well-known in Noboa parish. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 20 February 2023, near Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), police discovered and confiscated over 1.1 tons of cocaine hydrochloride hidden in a truck they discovered in the Panamericana Highway. There were no arrests made.

On 20 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), three unidentified individuals were apprehended after a police chase that ended in a crash. The suspects had been seen acting suspiciously and fled when officers attempted to stop them. After a 4-kilometer pursuit, they collided with a metal gate. Inside their vehicle, authorities found a retired police officer who had been abducted from a nightclub in La Mana. The victim was held captive and wounded in the leg during the 40-minute ordeal. The suspects, who claimed the incident was a drunken mistake, were identified and taken into custody, with one suspect admitting to accidentally shooting the victim. Authorities are investigating possible ties to the Los Lobos gang. There were no fatalities.

On 20 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals in a vehicle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Guasmo Sur sector. Likewise, an unknown number of armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot at a couple traveling in their car in a drive-by shooting in the Isla Trinitaria sector. The victim's vehicle was struck by 17 bullets. Both victims were injured, but the woman died later from her injuries. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 20 February 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle killed two men in a drive-by shooting at the corner of Pedro Vicente Maldonado and Pichincha streets. The perpetrators approached the target of the attack as he spoke with three other men on the street corner. The victims were shot various times. The target of the attack was killed on the spot while three other people were shot and injured. One of them was later reported to have died. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 20 February 2023, near Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man and a woman, an off-duty Ecuadorian Navy officer and his partner, while they were traveling in a vehicle on the Perimetral (ring) road. The attack left 15 bullet casings at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 21 February 2023 (as reported), in Buenavista (El Oro), two men were shot and killed and their dead bodies were found in the Guabita sector. Both victims were shot in the head. Individuals described as hitmen took the victims to the location to kill them and. Police described as an execution. The number of perpetrators is unknown. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 21 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed individuals traveling in a vehicle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood, in Tarqui parish. The man was standing on a street corner with a group of friends and was targeted by the perpetrators. Police discovered an abandoned burned vehicle nearby in the Las Cumbres neighborhood, which the perpetrators likely used for the attack. 1 fatality.

On 21 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), armed individuals riding a motorcycle attacked five people sitting in a car in a drive-by shooting in the Los Vergeles housing cooperative in the Guasmo Norte sector. A man and a woman were killed in the attack, while another three women were injured. The perpetrators fired over 30 times. 2 fatalities.

On 22 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting outside a condominium in the Socio Vivienda 1 sector of the Nueva Prosperina district. The victim was sitting on a bench when the attackers approached and fired at least five times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 February 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two armed subjects riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the San Rafael sector of the Voluntad de Dios neighborhood. The man was waiting at a bus stop when the perpetrators approached him and shot him four times in the head and chest. 1 fatality.

On 22 February 2023, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), various armed individuals armed with pistols approached a man and executed him in the Carapungo sector. The perpetrators, traveling in a vehicle, intercepted the victim, forced him on his knees, and executed him with 13 gunshots. The man had a criminal record of robbery. Police indicate that this attack was likely as a result of a territorial dispute between criminal gangs. 1 fatality.

On 22 February 2023, in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as hitmen riding motorcycles attacked a local administrator and four other people who were traveling in a vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the Luis Cevallo neighborhood, killing three and injuring the other two. One of the killed victims was a local cultural manager and an official at the Ministry of Public Health. 3 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 22 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four police officers were attacked by a group of between 30 and 50 people who intercepted, disarmed, and attacked them while they were conducting a patrol in the Sergio Toral housing cooperative in the Monte Sinai sector, near the port of Guayaquil. The group returned the police officers' weapons, without ammunition, after threatening them. Police launched a subsequent operation in the area and later arrested one person. An alternative report indicates that the entire group was made up of criminal group members.

On 22 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), at least two unidentified armed individuals who arrived on a motorcycle killed a male Colombian national at a sports court in the Jocay neighborhood. One of the perpetrators got off the bike and fired at least seven shots at the victim. The victim had recently left prison after being detained for the illegal possession of firearms. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 February 2023, in Naranjito (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped two people, a couple, and demanded a USD $5,000 ransom from their family for their release. Police authorities carried out an operation that liberated the suspects on the same day and arrested one of the perpetrators, who had previously been detained for a similar crime in August 2022 (unspecified) but was released on bail.

On 22 February 2023, in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as hitmen riding motorcycles killed two people in a drive-by shooting in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. Authorship and motivation for both events are unknown. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023)
notes: Around 23 February 2023 (from 22 - 23 February), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), criminal gang members riding motorcycles attacked multiple targets in drive-by shootings from the night of the 22nd into the morning of 23 February. First, six armed individuals traveling on three motorcycles attacked a group of people standing outside of a home Proletarios con Tierra housing cooperative in the Guasmo sector, killing a woman, injuring another woman, and also injuring a man who was in active military service. The attack was recorded by security cameras. Shortly after, likely into the morning of 23 February, the same perpetrators intercepted and killed two off-duty police officers, who were brothers, who were driving home in the sector. Authorities arrested two suspects on 23 February. 3 fatalities.

Around 23 February 2023 (as reported), in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), unidentified perpetrators stabbed and killed a man and his body was found with hands tied, on a road toward the Mount Bomboli sector. The victim was not identified. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 23 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), five armed criminal group members killed four people, and injured two others, in a drug rehabilitation center along Casuarina avenue, in the Nueva Prosperina sector. The armed subjects arrived on motorcycles and entered the establishment with the intent of killing one of its patients, a man who had appeared on Ecuadorian television to speak on his rehabilitation from drugs and showcase his work at the center to help local youth rehabilitate. The criminal group recorded the attack. 4 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (Ecuador); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023)
notes: On 23 February 2023, in Gualel (Loja), a group of local community members, including Kichwa Indigenous community members, burned a vehicle and confronted mine workers representing the Guayacan Gold company. Community members resisted in response to police personnel escorting mine workers along with 30 mining trucks belonging to the Guayacan Gold company to the Fierro Urco mine. A woman was injured during the confrontation between community members and mine workers. Community members denounced the police for entering their community with anti-riot teams and trained dogs to intimidate the population. There is a long-standing resistance among Indigenous communities in the area to present mining operations. There were no fatalities.

On 23 February 2023, in San Roque (Imbabura), local residents and Indigenous community members caught a robber and tied him to a post and whipped him. The man was retrieved by police. There were no fatalities.

On 23 February 2023, in Daule (Guayas), four unidentified armed perpetrators riding two motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Los Daulis Avenue. Police authorities are investigating whether a social media video threatening unspecified criminal gang members in the area is connected to the attack. The victim had a criminal record for robbery. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting at his home in the Balerio Estacio neighborhood. The perpetrators fired through the victim's window. Five bullet casings were found at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 February 2023, along a road in Los Rios region (coded to Babahoyo, Los Rios), four unidentified armed men traveling by vehicle kidnapped a man. The perpetrators also took the victim's vehicle and were driving him to an undisclosed location before being intercepted by police. Police authorities arrested the four men and liberated the victim. It is unspecified whether the motivation for the kidnapping was robbery or another reason.

Property destruction: Around 23 February 2023 (as reported), in Santa Lucia (Guayas), police authorities confiscated 1.1 tons of cocaine found in a house they raided in the city. Two persons were arrested in the raid.

On 24 February 2023, in San Agustin (Santa Rosa, El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a man at an unspecified location and held him for ransom. The perpetrators demanded $20,000 and held him hostage. The victim was liberated on the same day by National Anti-Kidnapping and Extortion Unit (UNASE) police forces.

On 24 February 2023, in Duran (Guayas), two Los Choneros gang members shot and killed a man after they intercepted him on a street near the UVC Duran hospital. There is no further information on the motivation of the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 24 February 2023 (as reported), in Huaquillas (El Oro), unidentified criminal group members kidnapped a man and held him for an ransom of USD 20.000 (express kidnapping). Police freed the man on 24 February after a sting operation. There is no further information on the criminal group. The man's current whereabouts remain unknown.

On 24 February 2023, in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators placed and detonated an explosive device at a woman's house in the Primero de Mayo neighborhood, causing an explosion that left the woman injured. The explosion caused shattered glass, which injured the woman inside. Police authorities also discovered and removed an undetonated explosive device on the house's roof. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 25 February 2023, in La Esperanza (Quevedo, Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed a man. The victim had a criminal record for theft and drug possession. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 February 2023, in Abdon Calderon (Manabi), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in a residential area of the parish. Reports highlight that the man was friends with three people who were murdered in November 2022 in a rural area of Montecristi (unspecified). 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 25 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), perpetrators arrived at a brothel along Sucre and Octava streets and shot and killed three men from their vehicle twenty minutes after they had killed a man in a drive-by shooting. They were likely traveling to the location of the primary attack as police suspect that the first male victim was killed due to a mistaken identity. One other person was injured. Police authorities suspect that the attack was related to territorial disputes. Also, an unknown number of unidentified armed men armed with pistols and rifles shot and killed a man inside his home in the 15 de Noviembre neighborhood of San Cristobal parish. Police authorities indicate that the perpetrators were targeting the victim's nephew, who managed to escape. Police authorities discovered 13 bullet casings at the scene from 9-mm and 556 calibre bullets. 5 fatalities.

On 25 February 2023, in Duran (Guayas), at least two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man in his vehicle in a drive-by shooting in Sector 5 of El Recreo neighborhood. Police authorities arrested the two perpetrators shortly after, one of whom was a minor. The motive for the attack is suspected to be related to a land dispute involving the victim's father. It is unspecified whether the perpetrators were hired as hitmen. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 25 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a minor who arrived on a bicycle left a stick of dynamite at the front door of a metal recycling company in the Bastion Popular neighborhood for extortion. The explosive was left after the company refused to pay a $5,000 extortion demand given to the business owner the previous day by an unspecified criminal gang. Police authorities arrived at the scene to remove the explosive device.

Around 25 February 2023 (as reported), in Quevedo (Los Rios), a man was shot in the head and killed and his dead body was found, with hands and feet tied, in the Venus del Rio Quevedo parish. The victim had been shot in the head. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed two men in a drive-by shooting as they talked in front of their home in the Centinela neighborhood in the Guasmo Sur sector. Authorship and motivation for attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 25 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Letamendi (Guayas), two unidentified armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed a tire repairman in a drive-by shooting as he worked on a vehicle along Francisco Segura and Guerrero Valenzuela streets in the south of the city. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 February 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling by vehicle opened fire on eight people and injured them in a drive-by shooting outside a liquor store on Malecon and Martin Icaza streets. The target of the attack was one of the individuals standing in the group of seven men and one woman. Two of the wounded victims are in critical condition. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Cofan Indigenous Group (Ecuador); Unidentified Communal Group (Ecuador)
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); ProtectDefenders.eu; Wambra Medio Comunitario
notes: On 26 February 2023, in Dureno (Sucumbios), hooded armed assailants shot and killed a Cofan Indigenous leader outside of his home. The perpetrators approached the man and shot him in the back before escaping the scene. Cofan indigenous representatives claimed that the motivation of the attack was due to oil extractors, as the leader was an advocate for Indigenous territorial rights against oil and mining companies. Authorities later arrested one person in relation to the crime, the suspected driver who transported the armed perpetrators. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; Ecuavisa; El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Telegrafo
notes: Property destruction: Around 26 February 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police forces conducted various sting operations around the port of Guayaquil in which they discovered and confiscated around 8.8 tons of cocaine in various containers headed to Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Libya. In a simultaneous operation in Puerto Bolivar, authorities discovered and confiscated 620 kilos of cocaine in a container also heading to Belgium. Police arrested five people for drug trafficking. Arrests were reported.
On 26 February 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), four armed individuals riding on motorcycles shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Las Nieves neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 26 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man, also riding a motorcycle, in a drive-by shooting along 114 street in the Cristo Rey neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 26 February 2023, in Manta (Manabi), residents caught and beat a man who was caught assaulting a person in the Costa Azul neighborhood in Los Esteros parish. Authorities arrived at the scene and took the man to the hospital to recover from his injuries. There were no fatalities.

On 26 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a group of armed individuals kidnapped a woman near her home in the Sauces 9 neighborhood. She was rescued a day later by the Anti-Kidnapping and Extortion Unit of the Police (Unase) in Daule (Guayas). The motives and perpetrators are unknown.

Around 26 February 2023 (between 24 - 27 February), in the rural area around Angel Pedro Giler (Tosagua, Manabi), a man who was the political lieutenant of Canuto (Chone) parish was killed and his dead body was found in an irrigation canal within Angel Pedro Giler (La Estancilla) parish. The victim had been abducted on 24 February along the Atahualpa street area in Canuto (Chone), where he was forced into a vehicle by unspecified perpetrators. The victim's body was found on 27 February with a note next to his body, which was illegible due to water damage. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 February 2023, near La Esperanza (Quevedo, Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen traveling by motorcycle and a pickup truck killed two people and injured two others traveling together in a drive-by shooting on the road from Valencia to Quevedo. The victims were a family, with an elderly woman being killed during the attack and a child dying later from his injuries at a hospital. A man and a woman were injured. The target of the attack was the male driver of the vehicle, who had a criminal record for robbery. 2 fatalities.

On 26 February 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators traveling in a vehicle with shaded windows killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the El Portal sector of the San Camilo parish. The victim was shot three times in the head. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.
On 27 February 2023, in Quito - Tumbaco (Pichincha), residents captured, stripped of his clothes and beat up a suspected robber. Police officers later took the robber to a police station.

On 27 February 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals traveling on two vehicles opened fire on a house in the 10 de Septiembre neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. A few minutes later, a stolen vehicle was set on fire and exploded in the nearby Justicia Popular neighborhood. This was likely committed by the same perpetrators. The residents of the home were likely at home (sleeping at the time of the attack). Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

On 27 February 2023, near Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle shot and killed two men riding a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting on the principal road to Tres Cerritos. Thirteen bullet casings were found at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 27 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man driving a vehicle in a drive-by shooting along Causarina avenue in the El Fortin sector. The target of the attack attempted to flee on foot after the armed perpetrators intercepted his vehicle, but was shot and killed on the road. Two other people on the street were injured by stray bullets. 1 fatality.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 27 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a group of unidentified armed individuals kidnapped a woman outside of her home in the Sauces 5 neighborhood. The group intercepted the woman as she was being dropped off at her house by her boyfriend. They initially took the boyfriend also but dropped him off nearby, taking only the woman. The armed group demanded a ransom fee of USD 50.000 for the woman's release. Police forces carried out an operation in Duran on 28 February and released the victim.

On 27 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Urdaneta (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a man in the Ciudadela Garay neighborhood for a ransom of USD 100.000 for his release. The current whereabouts of the man remain unknown.

On 27 February 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling by vehicle and a motorcycle killed a man working at a mechanic's workshop in a drive-by shooting on Cuenca Street. The victim was followed by the perpetrators prior to the attack and was shot various times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), residents captured, tied to a post and whipped a suspected robber near the School of Industrial Engineering. Police officers later took the robber to a police station.

On 28 February 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals fired shots at a house and threw an explosive at the property, causing damage. Residents were inside the house. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

On 28 February 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), armed individuals driving on a motorcycle shot and killed a pregnant woman in drive-by shooting in the Mirador del Fortin sector. The woman was at the front of a home in her neighborhood when visiting a friend. She had no previous criminal record. 1 fatality.

On 28 February 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), three armed individuals shot and killed a male mechanic while he was fixing a car in his workshop along 38 and 18 streets in La Union neighborhood. The perpetrators escaped the scene on a motorcycle. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 28 February 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals in a car described as hitmen opened fire on the occupants of a mototaxi in a drive-by shooting in the 18 de Noviembre neighborhood. Two teenagers and a woman died as a result of multiple gunshot wounds. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 1 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Olmedo (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the La Bahia sector. There is no further information about the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 1 March 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals entered a home in the San Francisco neighborhood and opened fire on a group of people. Three people were killed. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

On 1 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle opened fire on the occupants of a car in a drive-by shooting in the Machala Libre neighborhood. Two people in the vehicle were killed. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 2 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), unidentified individuals (described as suspected members of an organized criminal group) entered the Abel Gilbert Ponton Hospital and subsequently shot and killed a prisoner who was a patient in hospital. During the attack, a police officer who attempted to respond to the attack was injured. Two guards and a maintenance worker at the hospital suspected in helping the perpetrators enter and escape the building, were detained. The motives and perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 2 March 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was killed and his dismembered body was found inside two bags in front of the Monte Sinai Community Police Unit (UPC). There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 2 March 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Manta canton (Manabi), a man was killed, and his body was found inside a plastic tank on the Manta - San Lorenzo road. The victim had been kidnapped the previous day in the San Agustin neighborhood, and his body was found with gunshot wounds, stab wounds, and head injuries. The number of perpetrators is unknown. There is no further information about the motives and the perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

Security measures: On 3 March 2023, in Esmeraldas province (coded to Esmeraldas), President Guillermo Lasso signed Decree 681, declaring a state of emergency for 60 days in the province of Esmeraldas. The decree restricts freedom of movement, transit, and gatherings, and imposes a curfew from 9 pm to 5 am. The measure was taken in response to the escalation of violence by organized criminal groups in the area.

On 3 March 2023, in San Carlos (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals opened fire on the main door of a drug rehabilitation clinic. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. There were no casualties.

On 4 March 2023, near Chanduy parish (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified individuals opened fire on the occupants of a car on the San Rafael-Chanduy road. The perpetrators fired more than 40 shots, killing four people, including a young girl, and injuring at least two others. The victims were relatives of a leader of the Los Tiguerones gang who was killed in January in the Pedro Carbo canton (coded separately). According to authorities, after the gang leader's killing, his family began receiving threats and extortion demands over his properties. There is no further information about the perpetrators of the attack. 4 fatalities.

Around 4 March 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was killed, and parts of his dismembered body were found inside a sack in the Flor de Bastion sector. Inside the sack, authorities found the victim's head and one leg, along with a cellphone that contained a video of the killing. The victim had a criminal record for illegal possession of weapons and robbery. It is suspected that the attack was a retaliation between unidentified criminal gangs over drug trafficking in the area. The number of perpetrators is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 March 2023, in Valle Hermoso (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), several unidentified armed individuals broke into a house in the Cristobal Colon sector and opened fire on two people who were in a room. A man and a teenage girl were killed. According to the victims' relatives, the perpetrators mistook the teenage girl for the man's romantic partner. The man and his partner were the intended targets of the attack. The perpetrators subsequently fled on a motorcycle. There is no further information on the motives behind the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 5 March 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle, described as hitmen, shot and killed a man and injured another in a drive-by shooting on Che Guevara Street in the Briones neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives or identities of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 6 March 2023, in Duran (Guayas), five members of the Los Chone Killers gang kidnapped a merchant who was walking on Shyris Avenue and Trebol Street and took him to an unknown location. The perpetrators called the victim's family, demanding a payment of 50,000 dollars for his release (express kidnapping). The police rescued the man hours later in the Nuevos Horizontes area and arrested two members of the Los Chone Killers gang, who have criminal records for drug trafficking and possession of weapons.

On 6 March 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals fired shots at a house in the 18 de Noviembre neighborhood. It is likely that there were people inside the house, as the attack occurred in the early morning hours. The attack is suspected to be related to extortion threats. There is no further information about the perpetrators behind the attack. There were no casualties.

On 6 March 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), several unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a taxi driver in the 13 de Mayo neighborhood. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 March 2023, in Chacras (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals killed a man with about 20 gunshots, and his body was found hours later in La Chiquita sector of Chacras parish. Residents of the area claimed they heard gunshots hours before the body was found. The victim had been detained in 2021 for committing a robbery in Huaquillas. The motive for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 March 2023, in El Empalme (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed two men, and left their bodies in the San Roque sector. Local residents reported hearing gunshots before finding the victims' bodies. Police stated that the victims had been forcibly taken from a drug rehabilitation clinic before the attack. The motives and perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador)
notes: On 7 March 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals abducted a woman from her shop on Jose Abel Castillo Street, between Maldonado and Calicuchima, and demanded a 70,000 dollar ransom from her family. The perpetrators recorded a video of the victim blindfolded and with hands tied, asking for help from his son while being threatened with a weapon. The victim was released days later due to police pressure against the perpetrators.

On 7 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals detonated at least one stick of dynamite at the door of a bakery on Carlos Plaza Danin Avenue and Juan J. Medina Street, causing material damage to the shop. Although there were employees inside the place, no one was injured by the explosion. The attack is suspected to be a warning by extortionists to other businesses in the area, as the bakery's owner stated that he had not received any threats or extortion demands. There were no casualties.

On 7 March 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting while he was washing his car in El Porvenir sector. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 March 2023, in La Iberia (El Oro), two unidentified armed assailants shot and killed the son of a recently elected council member in 8 de Diciembre neighborhood, in La Iberia parish. The assailants intercepted his vehicle while he was driving, and shot at the car multiple times, killing him, and injuring two others in the car. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 8 March 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), residents of Cristal neighborhood burned down the car used by robbers as a warning to all robbers for carrying out criminal activities in their sector.

On 8 March 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a man inside the barbershop where he worked in the Jocay neighborhood. The perpetrators fled on a motorcycle. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 9 March 2023 (as reported), in Cuenca (Azuay), a man was killed, and his body was found with his hands and feet tied under the Unidad Nacional Avenue bridge. The police arrested three suspects. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. The number of perpetrators is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 March 2023, in Daule (Guayas), four unidentified armed individuals arrived at a restaurant in La Joya sector, intimidated and robbed several people, and subsequently kidnapped a couple and a child. The perpetrators forced the victims, who are business owners, to withdraw money from ATMs and then forced them to hand over $70,000 they had in their company's safe in a different part of the city (express kidnapping). The woman and the child were released in the early hours of the following day. There is no further information about the man's whereabouts and the perpetrators' identity.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); Women (Ecuador)
source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 9 March 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), two unidentified individuals in a car opened fire with rifles on the vehicle carrying the director of the Guayas No. 2 women's prison in a drive-by shooting . The woman was unharmed, but her two police security guards were injured and taken to hospitals. A former female director of the same prison was attacked in the same area in January 2022 (coded separately). The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 9 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), around 200 people staged a demonstration outside the Teodoro Maldonado Carbo Hospital against the manager. The crowd set fire to tires and subsequently forced their way in, destroying doors and objects inside the hospital. Hospital authorities stated that the demonstration was organized by members of a cleaning and maintenance company who claimed to have provided services to the hospital and are demanding payments owed to them by previous administrations. There were no casualties.

On 9 March 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals, described as extortionists, opened fire on a house between Pinas and Libertadores streets, damaging a car and the property's facade. The homeowner, a woman, was inside during the attack but was unharmed. The woman had received extortion calls days before the attack. There were no casualties.

On 9 March 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed individuals who arrived on a motorcycle, described as criminals, opened fire on a house in El Floron 5 neighborhood. One man who was sleeping inside the property was injured in one leg. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 9 March 2023 (as reported), in Santa Rosa (El Oro), a man was killed, and his body was found with gunshot wounds to the head and other parts of the body, with signs of torture near the Panamericana Highway (Troncal de la Costa). Authorities indicated that the attack was carried out in a different location since no ballistic evidence was found at the scene. The motives behind the attack and the number of perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 March 2023, in Ventanas (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen (likely drug traffickers due to the victim's drug debts) shot and killed a man at the intersection of Hector Cabrera and Quito streets. The victim had a criminal record for drug possession and theft and was suspected of having issues related to drug debts. 1 fatality.

On 9 March 2023, in Santa Marta (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in front of a property in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Martha sector. The reasons behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 March 2023, in Pindal (Loja), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a Venezuelan man with several gunshots to the head in La Pampa neighborhood. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 March 2023, near Tillales town (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle, described as hitmen, intercepted and opened fire on a man who was driving a vehicle on the Panamericana Highway (drive-by). The man was killed, while a woman who was with him in the car was injured. There is no further information on the motives behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 10 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle killed a man with four gunshots to the head at the intersection of Domingo Comin and Juan Pendola avenues, in Guasmo Sur sector. The victim had a criminal record for robbery, attempted homicide, and drug possession. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two suspected members of Los Tiguerones gang temporarily kidnapped a female journalist and a man who were in a taxi on Las Aguas Avenue. The perpetrators struck one of the victims with a weapon, blindfolded them, and inappropriately touched the woman. The suspects forced them to withdraw money from their bank accounts and also stole their belongings. There were no casualties.

On 10 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of individuals (described as delinquents) kidnapped a taxi driver for ransom (express kidnapping). The perpetrators demanded 20,000 USD to free the driver, who was rescued by the police a day later alongside two more kidnapping victims in a house in the neighborhood Socio Vivienda. Two unidentified persons were detained.

Around 10 March 2023 (as reported), in El Carmen (Manabi), a pregnant woman was killed, and her body was found with gunshot wounds in the La Restrepo area. A local resident stated that the victim was a drug user who frequented the area. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. The number of perpetrators is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 March 2023, in Loja (Loja), residents captured a suspected robber at 18 de Noviembre street, between Celica and Gonzama avenues, and beat him up. The suspected robber was later turned over to police officers. There were no fatalities.

On 11 March 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle parked in front of a house in the Vina Loma area. One of them got off the vehicle and opened fire on a man who was inside the house. It is unclear if the man was injured by the gunfire. The motives behind the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 11 March 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen killed a man with at least seven gunshots while he was watching a game in Las Americas soccer field. Authorities stated that the victim had a criminal record for theft and the attack is suspected to be related to a local drug trafficking dispute. 1 fatality.

Around 11 March 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), parts of a dismembered human body were found inside plastic bags in different locations. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 March 2023, in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), three unidentified armed individuals opened fire on a group of people during a social event. Three people were injured. None of the victims have criminal records. The motives behind the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 11 March 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as suspected hitmen shot and killed a man in the Israel neighborhood.
