The man was shot seven times. According to local residents, the victim was a drug user and the attack is suspected to be related to the victim's drug-related debts. 1 fatality.

On 12 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), several unidentified armed individuals opened fire on a vehicle with four occupants in the Nueva Prosperina sector. The perpetrators fired more than 60 rounds with a 5.56 caliber rifle and a 9mm pistol, killing all four victims, including a minor. None of the victims had a criminal record. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 12 March 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), three unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen killed a man with several gunshots at the intersection of Azogues and Pichincha streets in 11 de Noviembre neighborhood. The victim had an unspecified criminal record and had recently been released from prison. The police arrested five people in connection with the crime, including two minors. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 12 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as delinquents fired from three vehicles at a group of people in the Bastion Popular area (drive-by). One man died at the scene, and another was injured. After the shooting, the perpetrators threw explosives onto the street as they fled. According to the police, the victims were in front of a known drug-selling property. 1 fatality.

On 12 March 2023, in Quero (Tungurahua), around 140 people captured and beat a man accused of committing a robbery moments earlier. The citizens struck the suspect with sticks and whips before handing him over to the police. There were no fatalities.

On 12 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three people were shot and killed outside of their home by several unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting in the Las Malvinas neighbourhood. The motives and perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 13 March 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), dozens of motorcycle taxi drivers blocked the Daule highway with burning tires as a demonstration to decry the excessive fines and the high amount of authorized motorcycle taxi units approved by the local government.

On 13 March 2023, in Duran (Guayas), three unidentified individuals described as delinquents kidnapped the owners of a moving truck for ransom (express kidnapping). The perpetrators tied up the victims, locked them in the back of the truck and demanded a $5,000 ransom for their release. After several hours, police rescued the citizens and arrested two women, one of whom had criminal records for theft and drug possession.

Around 13 March 2023 (as reported), in Chongon (Guayas), a taxi driver was killed, and his body was found swollen and with his hands tied in the Tres Bocas sector. The man had been missing since 11 March, when he was driving his vehicle. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 13 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), a group of citizens beat up a man accused of attempting a robbery on Thelmo Sandoval Avenue. The man was later handed over to the police. There were no fatalities.

On 13 March 2023, in Rio Bonito (El Oro), several unidentified individuals kidnapped a man, killed him, and his body was found with multiple gunshot wounds and signs of beating. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 13 March 2023, in Viche (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed the owner of a hardware store inside his shop. It is suspected that the attack occurred because the man had refused to pay extortion money. 1 fatality.

On 13 March 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), four people, including a minor, were killed by unidentified individuals in the Villa Bonita neighborhood. The motives and perpetrators are unknown. The means of killing were not disclosed. 4 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 13 March 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), the anti-narcotics police discovered a drug storage site and seized 484 blocks of cocaine, three fire arms, and ammunition. This operation 'Roma' took place in an area known as 'Chupadores Chuco', in the Gulf of Guayaquil (Puna). No arrests were made.

Around 13 March 2023 (as reported), in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified individuals opened fire on a vehicle in the La Ensenadita sector, killing one man and wounding another. The deceased victim was a former police officer. Authorities found a rifle, a submachine gun and a 9mm pistol in the victims' car. The reasons behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 March 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), during a demonstration public transportation drivers attacked other bus drivers on Parque Industrial Ambato sector, damaging the vehicles of transport drivers that were not following the strike for demanding a raise in bus fares. This is the second day of strikes.

On 14 March 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unidentified armed individual shot six times at a man inside a commercial establishment in the Codesa sector. It is suspected that the man had been threatened for refusing to pay extortion money. 1 fatality.

On 14 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), three teenagers kidnapped a taxi driver on Portete Street with the intent to extort him (express kidnapping). The police pursued and captured the perpetrators and rescued the victim.

On 14 March 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), a group of citizens captured and beat up a man accused of breaking into a house at the intersection of Lavayen and Agustin Delgado streets and attempting to rob it. There were no fatalities.

On 14 March 2023, in Balao (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle chased two people who were also riding a motorcycle and shot them in a drive-by shooting on the Balao boardwalk. One of the victims, a teenager, was killed by eleven gunshots, while the other person was injured and taken to a hospital. Two days later, during the teenager's funeral, unidentified assailants killed another teenager who was a friend of the victim (coded separately). The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals kidnapped a businessman at Km 7.5 on the road to Daule for ransom. The perpetrators demanded $200,000 for his release. The police rescued the victim on 17 March and arrested six suspects, seizing five cell phones and three vehicles.

On 15 March 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), for the second consecutive day, during a demonstration public transportation drivers attacked other bus drivers in La Magdalena sector, damaging the vehicles of transport drivers that were not following the strike for demanding a raise in bus fares. This is the third day of strikes.
Around 15 March 2023 (month of), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was killed and his head and his partial neck were found abandoned on a park bench. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: Around 15 March 2023 (month of), in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), police forces confiscated 16 sticks of dynamite among other weapons during a raid on an unspecified organized criminal group in the Carcelen sector. The sticks of dynamite were made in Peru. One criminal gang member was arrested. The gang member was foreign-born, but the nationality is not specified.

Property destruction: Around 15 March 2023 (as reported), in Loja (Loja), armed forces seized pieces of machinery and materials used for illegal mining in the Teneria sector. Authorities confiscated 5,000 gallons of fuel, 450 explosive sticks, and 100 kg of ammonium nitrate.

On 15 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle (drive-by), described as hitmen, intercepted a man who was driving his vehicle and killed him with at least eight gunshots at the intersection of Gran Colombia and 12th streets. The victim was the lawyer of two members of Los Choneros gang. An elderly man at the scene was injured and taken to a hospital. There is no further information on the motives behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 15 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle opened fire on a group of people in a drive-by shooting outside a house in the Barraca sector of Blanca Garcia neighborhood. Two women and one teenager were injured. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 15 March 2023 (month of), in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), unidentified individuals (described as invaders), suspected to be part of Los Lobos gang, destroyed doors and meters from various homes in the neighborhood Ecuador. Additionally, they burned police patrol cars. The motive is linked to invasions of plots of land without formal ownership documents. The police is patrolling the area. There were no casualties.

On 16 March 2023, in Balao (Guayas), two unidentified individuals riding a motorcycle (drive-by) described as hitmen shot and killed a teenager who was attending the funeral of another minor killed two days earlier (coded separately). The victim died from two gunshot wounds to the chest. As the suspects fled, they ran over a girl who had to be taken to hospital. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 March 2023, in Olmedo (Manabi), two armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting on the road to San Roque in San Jacinto neighborhood. The victim was the owner of the Casa Blanca brothel in Olmedo. 1 fatality.

On 16 March 2023, in Pedernales (Manabi), two unidentified men on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman and injured a teenage boy in a drive-by shooting as they were walking around the La Escalinata sector. The teenager was later found wounded with multiple gunshot wounds next to the woman's dead body. According to witnesses, the victims were a couple. There is no further information on the motives and circumstances behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 17 March 2023, In Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), approximately five criminal gang members traveling by two vehicles (also described as hitmen) entered the a Night Club in Carcelen Industrial sector and opened fire on a group of people, killing four and injuring several others. The perpetrators used a combination of firearms, knives, and explosives. They killed three men and one woman. An unspecified number of additional people were injured. The criminal gang members were arrested around 31 March 2023 (coded separately). The gang members were also linked to the kidnapping of a businessman in Cuenca (unspecified). 4 fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 17 March 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police forces seized more than 3,7 tons of cocaine hidden in export products at the port of Guayaquil. The seized drugs, valued at over seven million dollars in Ecuador, were intended for shipment to Sierra Leone.

Around 17 March 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), a person was killed and their body was found with their hands tied and a gunshot wound in the Pascuales parish. There is no further information about the motive behind the attack. The number of perpetrators is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as extortionists threw a stick of dynamite at a commercial establishment at the intersection of Babahoyo and 4th North Streets. The blast caused structural damage to the property, and although there were people present, no one was injured. The attack is related to extortion demands. There were no casualties.

Around 17 March 2023 (as reported), in La Chorrera (Los Rios), police forces arrested a member of the Los Tiguerones gang, one of the country's most wanted individuals, who faced criminal charges for killings in Esmeraldas province.

On 18 March 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in Abdon Calderon neighborhood. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 March 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), an unidentified armed individual described as a hitman shot and killed a man inside his own restaurant in El Progreso 1 neighborhood. When the victim fell to the ground after being shot several times, the perpetrator shot him in the head and left a note next to his body that read, 'Rest assured that you will be next on my list.' The attack is suspected to have been a settling of scores. 1 fatality.

On 19 March 2023, in Tenguel (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on motorcycles chased, intercepted, and killed two people in a vehicle on the Panamericana road in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 19 March 2023, in Vinces (Los Rios), at least 200 citizens attacked officers at the Vinces Community Police Unit (UPC) and threw Molotov cocktails in response to the killing of a man minutes earlier during a police operation (coded separately). The mob set several police vehicles on fire and prevented firefighters from putting out the flames. There were no fatalities.

On 20 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a journalist from the media outlet Ecuavisa was slightly injured after a USB drive he received in an envelope exploded at the television channel's offices. The victim received an envelope with the USB drive, which partially exploded when he connected it to his computer, causing minor injuries to his hand and face. Four journalists from TC Television, Teleamazonas, and Radio Democracia also received the same type of explosive envelope, which did not detonate. The motivation behind the explosives remain unknown. There were no fatalities.

Defusal: On 20 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces defused an explosive device placed inside a vehicle's tire in the parking lot of Riocentro Norte Mall. The motives behind the explosive are unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Labor Group (Ecuador); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards; Women (Ecuador)
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Esmeraldas News; Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 21 March 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an armed assailant shot and killed two people on San Martin de Porres Bajo Street. The suspect was a member of the Los Tiguerones gang. The target was the director of a women's rehabilitation center (penitentiary detention center) who survived. The two fatal victims were relatives of the director, while she and one security guard, both employees at the same prison, were injured. The director had received threats previous to the attack (unspecified). Motivations unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 21 March 2023 (as reported), on the road between Ancon and Atahualpa (coded to Atahualpa, Santa Elena), unidentified armed individuals tied up, beat and shot a man in the head near an oil well where his body was found. The victim's face was painted to look like a clown. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 21 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals threw a grenade at a Community Police Unit (UPC) in the Guasmo sector. The explosive did not blow up and was later safely detonated by the police.

On 21 March 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified assailants shot and killed one person and injured two others in the La Poza de San Alejo sector. On the same day, unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a man in the La Florida sector of the Picoaza parish. Locals stated that the victim was a drug user. There is no further information on the motives behind the attacks. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 21 March 2023, on the outskirts of Nobol canton (Guayas), police forces seized 1,1 tons of cocaine hidden inside a truck at the Chiveria Toll, on the Daule-Nobol road. Authorities arrested the two occupants of the vehicle.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Expreso
notes: On 22 March 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals (described as criminals) kidnapped a business woman and held her captive for an extended amount of time for ransom. The individuals demanded 1 million dollars for the release of the woman, which the family was unable to pay. The perpetrators kept the victim captive at different locations for nine days. Authorities rescued the woman on 31 March during a police raid in Manta, where they discovered her tied up in a house. Police arrested two people connected to the kidnapping after raids in the Cuba and Jocay neighborhoods. One perpetrators was an Ecuadorian national and another was Venezuelan.

On 22 March 2023, in Manta (Manabi), several unidentified individuals (described as hitmen) shot and killed a woman as she was leaving a medical center in the Las Acacias neighborhood, and injured a Venezuelan man who was accompanying her. The woman had survived another attack on 18 July 2022, and her husband was killed in Manta on 29 November 2021 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 22 March 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), five unidentified armed individuals killed two people with a rifle and a 9mm pistol in the El Mirador sector of the El Progreso neighborhood. One other person was injured. After the attack, the police arrested five suspects and confiscated two pistols, a rifle, and three grenades. The motives behind the attack are unspecified. 2 fatalities.

On 22 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants in a car and on a motorcycle shot and killed four people in a drive-by shooting in Guasmo Sur. The motives behind the attacks are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 22 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals (described as hitmen) entered a home in the Martha de Roldos cooperative and opened fire on the people present. Four men were killed. One victim had been receiving dead threats (unspecified). The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 24 March 2023, in Loja (Loja), a group of prisoners at the Loja Prison clashed with the police in response to a search operation. Several inmates and a police officer were injured. The circumstances under which the individuals were injured are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 24 March 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as criminals opened fire from a vehicle on a group of people outside a home on Francisco de Paula Moreira Street in a drive-by shooting. Three Venezuelan men were injured in the attack. The motive behind the attack is unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 24 March 2023, between La Aurora and La T de Daule (coded to La Aurora, Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen opened fire with a machine gun on the occupants of a vehicle near the Plaza Tia roundabout. One man died, and another was injured as a result of the attack. The injured victim is a former police officer. There is no further information on the motives behind the attack. 1 fatality.
On 25 March 2023, in Quito - Tumbaco (Pichincha), residents of Pifo parish captured, beat up and burned a man accused of robbing a car. The man was rescued by firefighters and taken to a hospital.

Around 25 March 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two men were killed, and their dismembered bodies were left in different bags in the Juan Montalvo cooperative. The body parts were abandoned by unidentified individuals in a vehicle. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 25 March 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), four unidentified individuals described as suspected hitmen, arrived on two motorcycles and opened fire on a group of people at a volleyball court at the intersection of Sucre and Boyaca streets. Two men were killed, and another person was injured. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 25 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as extortionists threw a dynamite stick into a store on Pasaje between 9th and 10th West streets. One person at the location was injured. Perpetrators unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 25 March 2023, in Riochico (Manabi), two unidentified individuals in a vehicle opened fire on two men, who were cousins, in a drive-by shooting outside a house in Riochico Parish. According to locals, the perpetrators fired at least 14 shots. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 25 March 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), two unidentified individuals described as hitmen chased a man into his home in the Union Civica neighborhood and killed him. The perpetrators shot the man multiple times with 9mm firearms. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 25 March 2023 (as reported), in Yantzaza (Zamora Chinchipe), a group of citizens captured a man accused of committing a robbery minutes earlier. The crowd beat the man, tied him up, and hung him upside down from a streetlight pole. Police arrived at the scene and took the victim to a hospital. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 25 March 2023, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), unknown individuals described as criminals tied out security guards and then stole five vehicles from the Casabaca Toyota dealership in the Calderon warehouse. The disappearance of the vehicles is linked to criminal networks.

On 27 March 2023, in Alausi (Chimborazo), residents staged a demonstration outside the local government offices to reject the presence of president Guillermo Lasso, who came to hold a meeting with local authorities and propose actions about the landslide that happened days prior. The residents clashed with police and military officers, and they damaged the tires of the cars of the president's caravan.

On 27 March 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed a man in the Democracia Sur neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The reasons behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 March 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man inside a restaurant on Camilo Ponce and Pasaje de Huaquillas streets. Two more people were injured in the attack. The motives behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 March 2023, in Machala (El Oro), a group of people tied up and beat a man, described as a delinquent, accused of having robbed a woman minutes earlier on Kleber Franco Street. The police intervened to protect the individual from the mob. There were no fatalities.

Around 27 March 2023 (as reported), in Paquisha (Zamora Chinchipe), a group of unidentified armed individuals opened fire on two men who arrived at a mine in the Chinapintza area, intending to ask for work. One of the men was killed, and the other was injured. There is no further information about the circumstances and motivations behind the attack. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed the female director of the Teodoro Maldonado Carbo Hospital from the Social Security Institute (IESS) in a drive-by shooting in La Pradera area. There is no further information on the motives behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 29 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an armed individual abducted a private security guard at a jewelry store in the Sauces 9 sector, in the north part of the city. The victim was taken to an unknown location, where he was beat up as unknown individuals forced him to disclose information regarding the jewelry shop. They day after dynamite sticks were attached to his body and the victim was taken to the shop. Police forces were activated and the explosive devices were removed. One of the responsible was arrested months later.

On 30 March 2023, in Quito - Eloy Alfaro (Pichincha), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed a man and left his body, with hands and feet tied, along La Sofia street connecting the La Forestal and La Ferroviaria sectors. The victim was shot eight times in the head. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 30 March 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed three people inside a hostel near Jocay stadium. The perpetrators used rifles to carry out the attack. Minutes later, the police found the vehicle used by the perpetrators incinerated. Two of the victims had criminal records for murder and robbery. 3 fatalities.

On 30 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed an off-duty police officer in a drive-by shooting in the Jacobo Bucaram sector. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 30 March 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle shot and injured two men in a drive-by shooting in the La Sal area. The attack is suspected to be related to a territorial dispute between criminal gangs. There were no fatalities.

On 30 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least three unidentified perpetrators beat and kidnapped a man who worked as an unarmed security guard at a local jewelry store in Sauces 9 and forced him to wear a vest with explosive devices to extort the jewelry store. The perpetrators beat the man as they kidnapped him. Police authorities later defused the explosive devices strapped to the victim's body. There were no fatalities.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Defusal: On 30 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces deactivated several explosive devices strapped to the body of a security guard at a jewelry store in the Sauces 9 area. The explosives were tied to the man by members of Los Tiguerones Gang as retaliation for the store owners' refusal to pay an extortion demand. One member of the Tiguerones Gang was arrested for terrorism.

Around 31 March 2023 (as reported), in Cuenca (Azuay), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as delinquents killed two men, both Venezuelan nationals, and dumped their dead bodies with hands tied in the Ucubamba municipal forest park. The two victims were also strangled. Their bodies were discovered with threatening messages toward extortionists in the area. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 31 March 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified heavily-armed men described as delinquents used explosives to break into and rob a Pichincha Bank location, injuring the bank's security guard in the process. The perpetrators detonated the explosives while there were clients inside the bank. The bank's security guard was injured by the explosion. Police authorities arrived at the scene to evacuate people from the area. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

On 31 March 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified individuals traveling by motorcycle shot and killed a woman in a drive-by shooting at the Multiplaza Commercial Center in the Tripa de Pollo neighborhood. The attackers had followed the victim from the moment she left her house until when she was intercepted at the center. The victim was shot nine times with 9-caliber bullets. 1 fatality.

On 31 March 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeralda), an unknown number of armed perpetrators traveling on motorcycles shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 15 de Marzo neighborhood. The victim was chatting on a street corner with a group of friends when they were approached and shot by the perpetrators. Four men were injured in the attack. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 31 March 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as delinquents shot and killed a man in the Abdon Calderon neighborhood of the San Camilo parish. The victim's name was discovered on a threatening pamphlet distributed in the area on 27 March, in which an unspecified criminal group proclaimed that it would 'clean up' the city. The perpetrators approached the victim while he was at home with his mother and opened fire over 20 times. 1 fatality.

On 31 March 2023, in Quito (Pichincha), the Ecuadorian police arrested the leader and multiple members of Los Lobos gang linked to robbery, killings, kidnappings, and extortion. The gang was linked to the attack on a night club on 17 March (coded separately), and to the kidnapping of a businessman in Cuenca (coded separately). This is part of a nation-wide operation that occurred the same day in which 23 members of the criminal gang were arrested.

Defusal: On 31 March 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces deactivated an explosive device placed inside a restaurant in the Mucho Lote sector. There is no further information about the motivation or identity of the perpetrators.

On 31 March 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a man with a rifle on J-9 Street in the Jocay neighborhood. The perpetrators fled in a car that was later found incinerated in the Las Cumbres neighborhood. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: CREO: Creating Opportunities (Ecuador); Former Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023)
notes: Movement of forces: Around 31 March 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), President Lasso delivered 130 upgraded police vehicles and introduced 400 new police officers to reinforce the security of Guayaquil. The new officers will be deployed to the most critical areas of Guayaquil, specifically to the districts Florida, Nueva Prosperina, and to the South of Guayaquil.

On 1 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals traveling in two vehicles fired on a group of people in a drive-by shooting at the crossing of 16 and Francisco Segura streets in the southeast of the city, injuring seven. Among the injured were two young girls, three women, and two men. Police authorities indicated that the targets of the attack were a group of young men who were also at the intersection. They also indicated that the reason for the attack was likely due to the sale of drugs.

Security measures: On 1 April 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), the national government declared a 60-day state of emergency in Guayaquil, Duran, and Samborondon in the province of Guayas, as well as the provinces of Santa Elena and Los Rios. The measure includes the mobilization of military forces, control operations, and a curfew every day from 1 a.m. to 5 a.m. with the aim of combating the high levels of insecurity and violence in these areas.

On 1 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man and injured two others in a drive-by shooting at the Playita del Guasmo artificial beach. The victims were sitting on a wall alongside the waterfront when the perpetrators passed them and shot them various times. Authorities indicate that the man killed was the target of the attack, as he was shot various times while the two injured men were only shot once each. The injured victims were taken to a hospital. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 1 April 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela El Floron 5 neighborhood. The perpetrators shot at the victim through the window of his house. There is no further information available on the identity or motivation of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 1 April 2023, in Estancia Vieja Afuera (Manabi), two armed men (described as hitmen) riding a motorcycle killed five men in a drive-by shooting in the Estancia Vieja sector of Colon parish. The men were walking along the road when the attackers approached them and opened fire using a rifle and 9mm pistol. Three of the victims were cousins. None of the victims had criminal records, but authorities pointed out that the area in which they were walking is a known drug-using spot. There is no further information available. 5 fatalities.

Around 1 April 2023 (as reported), in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), four unidentified armed individuals kidnapped two people for ransom (express kidnapping). One of the perpetrators was a minor. They demanded USD 50,000 to release the victims. Police authorities liberated the two victims on 1 April in an operation in which they arrested the four perpetrators and confiscated one firearm, one vehicle, and various cell phones.

On 1 April 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), various armed men described as hitmen shot and killed a man along Jorge Carrera and Aurelio Espinoza streets in the Juan Montalvo housing cooperative. The perpetrators were traveling by vehicle but got off to approach the victim on foot. The male victim was chatting with a group of friends when the armed men approached him and opened fire around 15 times. The group dispersed and the victim attempted to run away but was shot down by the perpetrators. He was a local lender. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 1 April 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as delinquents shot and killed a taxi driver in the Esmeraldas Municipal Market, near the Eloy Alfaro secondary school. The man was at the market working as a taxi driver and was accompanied by his son, who was not injured in the attack. The victim was shot twice. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 1 April 2023, in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), two armed individuals tied and killed a male restaurant owner and his wife at his restaurant in the Carcelen Bajo sector. The perpetrators entered the restaurant and tied up the man and the woman before killing them. Although they first suspected a robbery, authorities later took back this suspicion as the perpetrators did not steal from the restaurant. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

On 2 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed men described as an organized group of delinquents traveling on various vehicles opened fire on six people in a drive-by shooting in the Floresta sector, killing one and injuring the other five. Another victim died from their wounds. The victims were walking on the street and ran into a local property to seek shelter when the perpetrators intercepted them. The perpetrators used high-caliber rifles and machine guns and fired over 40 shots. The five victims were Venezuelan nationals. A collateral victim was a nearby Ecuadorian woman who was injured by a stray bullet. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 2 April 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and injured an off-duty police officer as he drove along Los Shiris and Pedro Carbo streets. The victim was driving home from a nightclub when he was intercepted by the perpetrators, who opened fire various times. The victim was hit by two bullets and hospitalized. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

On 2 April 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed two men along Los Rios and Urbina Hado streets in the Union y Progreso neighborhood. The armed individuals got out of a vehicle and approached the victims, who were in front of a house. They opened fire various times. Authorities indicate that the attack was likely due to a territorial dispute between criminal groups. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Correo (Ecuador); Diario Extra (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 2 April 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen/delinquents who arrived on a motorcycle shot and killed a man at a restaurant on Eloy Alfaro and Juan Montalvo streets. The perpetrators approached him on foot after he entered a crab shop along Eloy Alfaro and Juan Montalvo streets, shooting him five times in the head. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 2 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting at the corner of 10 de Agosto and Ecuador streets, in the Los Algarrobos neighborhood. The man was chatting with a group of friends near his home when the perpetrators arrived to shoot him. Authorities declared that the attack was due to a territorial dispute between organized criminal groups. 1 fatality.

On 2 April 2023, in Daule (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a man at his home in Banife parish. The two attackers approached the man as he stood at his doorway speaking with friends. They fled on a motorcycle after shooting him. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Around 2 April 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a private security guard and left his decapitated head inside a blue diaper bag in a corner of a hostel room in the Villa Hermoso sector. The man worked as a security guard at the Delfina Torres de Concha hospital. The victim had been missing for around a day. The perpetrators of the attack uploaded a video in which they dismembered the victim using machetes. Also around 2 April 2023, in Esmeraldas, a man was killed by an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators and his decapitated head was found in a black bag near a taxi stop in the Tabu sector. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: FARC Dissident - Oliver Sinisterra Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Oliver Sinisterra Front)
notes: On 2 April 2023, in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police authorities arrested the leader of the Negro Yi gang. Authorities report that the Negro Yi gang was operating in Esmeraldas on behalf of the FARC Dissident Oliver Sinisterra Front.

Around 2 April 2023 (as reported), in Naranjal (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a man for extortion. Police authorities liberated the victim on 2 April 2023. There is no further information available.

Property destruction: On 2 April 2023, in Banos de Agua Santa (Tungurahua), an unidentified individual described as an extortionist set fire to a store on 16 de Diciembre and Martinez streets. The perpetrator doused the front of the store with gasoline and used a match to set it on fire. Authorities indicate that the man set the store on fire due to the failure of the store owner to pay a weekly extortion fee. The store was likely empty due to the time of the attack. The fire was quickly neutralized by neighbors.

Around 2 April 2023 (as reported), in Babahoyo, (Los Rios), two men were killed and their dead bodies were discovered along the Babahoyo (Catamara) river in the Barreiro parish. The two bodies were discovered floating in the river with hands tied up behind their backs. One of the bodies was shot once in the forehead. One of the two victims was identified as a man who had gone missing from Puebloviejo two days earlier after going to search for work at a banana plantation. The number of perpetrators is unknown. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Property destruction: Around 3 April 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police confiscated over 1 ton of cocaine they discovered in a banana container in the port of Guayaquil. The container was part of a shipment heading to Germany. There were no arrests made.

On 3 April 2023, in Jipijapa (Manabi), four unidentified individuals, two heavily armed men accompanied by two women, kidnapped a man in a restaurant. The perpetrators forced the victim onto a white vehicle and took him away. He was found alive on 4 April 2023 on the road toward Puerto Cayo. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the perpetrators.

On 3 April 2023, in Loja (Loja), two Los Lobos gang members shot and injured three men standing outside of the Paris Night Club on the road to Zamora. The two male perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle, stepped off, and opened fire on a group of people, and wounded three men, who were later hospitalized. One of the victims was placed in extended hospital care. None of the victims had criminal records. In response to the shooting, police authorities conducted various raids in the area, which resulted in the apprehension of six suspects connected to the attack. They identified the suspects as Los Lobos gang members and confiscated various amounts of drugs and weapons with each arrest. Authorities indicated that the gang members were likely targeting the business for extortion. There were no fatalities.

On 3 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), several unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle attacked three men in a drive-by shooting in the Dos Bocas sector, killing one of them. The perpetrators used heavy-caliber weapons to shoot at the three victims, who were injured and hospitalized. One of the victims later died from his wounds. Authorities indicated that this was a targeted attack linked to the sale of drugs. 1 fatality.

On 3 April 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unidentified armed individual riding a bicycle (described as a hitman) killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the San Jose neighborhood. The perpetrator approached the victim as he was arriving at his house in a car with his mother. The armed individual approached the car on a bicycle and asked the victim for directions. The perpetrator shot the man five times as he responded. The perpetrator fired at least 12 shots. The victim's mother was injured by a stray bullet and hospitalized. Police authorities indicated that the perpetrator was picked up by another individual riding a motorcycle after the attack, indicating that the perpetrator likely used a bicycle to approach the victim easily. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Ecuador); Former Unidentified Gang and/or Colectivo; Prisoners (Ecuador)
notes: Around 3 April 2023 (as reported), in El Rodeo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a prisoner in El Rodeo prison and left their strangled bodies in their prison cell. The prisoner was a Venezuelan national who was in prison for the kidnapping and extortion of a business woman in Manta (coded separately). He had been arrested on 31 March during a police raid in which authorities also liberated the victim. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 3 April 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as criminals traveling by vehicle shot and killed two men and injured one other in a drive-by shooting along Eleodoro Solorzano Avenue. At least three victims were driving their vehicle along the avenue when the armed individuals intercepted them and opened fire. One of the victims died instantly, while the other two were injured and hospitalized. One of the two injured victims later died from their wounds. One of the victims had recently been released from prison for an unspecified crime. The other victims did not have criminal records. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 3 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a Venezuelan man standing outside a barber shop in a drive-by shooting in the Juan Montalvo neighborhood. The victim was first injured but died later at a hospital. The perpetrators fired six times. One other person was injured by a stray bullet and hospitalized. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 4 April 2023, in Coaque (Manabi), five unidentified armed men described as hitmen traveling by vehicle shot and killed two people and injured four others in a drive-by shooting at a local sports court. They opened fire on a crowd of people. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 4 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), one unidentified armed individual described as a hitman riding a motorcycle killed a Chilean man while he was in a vehicle in a drive-by shooting near the Bim Bam Bum building in the Los Ceibos neighborhood. The victim was with his partner, a woman who was driving their vehicle. The couple was stuck in traffic when the armed perpetrator arrived on a motorcycle and opened fire. The man was likely the target of the attack, as he was shot multiple times in the head and thorax. The woman was also hit by a bullet but managed to drive away toward a local hospital, where the man was immediately pronounced dead. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 4 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as delinquents placed an explosive device near the San Jose retirement home in the Ciudadela Kennedy neighborhood. Police authorities arrived at the scene to retrieve the device. There is no further information available.

On 4 April 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed men described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man attending a wake in a drive-by shooting along Cotopaxi and 9 de Octubre streets in the Paraiso neighborhood. Two other people were injured. There is no further information available. Also in Huaquillas, on 4 April, an unknown number of armed individuals traveling on two motorcycles (also described as hitmen) killed a man attending a funeral. Three other people attending the funeral were shot and injured. Authorities revealed that none of the victims had criminal records. The identity and motivation of the perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 4 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle shot and killed two people attending a funeral in a drive-by shooting in the Adolfo Bucaram neighborhood. The perpetrators arrived at the scene and fired a volley of bullets at the people present. Three men attempted to run away but were all shot. One of them died at the scene. The other two men were taken to a local hospital, where one later died from his wounds. The man who died at the hospital had a criminal record for weapon possession. Authorities indicate that one of the victims had received threats from prison. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

Around 4 April 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of perpetrators killed a man and left his dead body on the street, with hands tied behind his back with a telephone cable, in the El Cerro Housing Cooperative in the Mapasingue Este sector. The body also had unspecified signs of violence. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 4 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police authorities safely retrieved an explosive device placed by one perpetrator described as a delinquent and suspected extortionist at a gas station along Francisco de Orellana Avenue, near the Pascuales parish. The explosive was a stick of dynamite placed near the gas pumps. The perpetrator was a teenager that approached the location by foot and escaped on a motorbike with an accomplice after placing the explosive. One of the station workers reported that, before leaving, the perpetrator announced himself to be part of the mafia and asked that they call the phone number next to the explosive device.

On 5 April 2023, in Tiputini (Orellana), Waorani Indigenous residents entered the North Facilities Station (NPF) of block 16 oil field as a demonstration to demand benefits from Petroecuador that is managing the station. Military officers threw tear gas to disperse them, but the demonstrators attacked them with guns, and five officers were injured.
On 5 April 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), residents of Huancavilca sector captured, stripped of their clothes and beat up two men that had allegedly stolen a motorcycle.

On 5 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a bicycle described as criminals/delinquents killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Nueva Granada housing cooperative. The perpetrators shot at least 11 times with 9-mm bullets. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 5 April 2023, in Turi (Azuay), a group of prisoners took various prison guards hostage in Turi prison during a riot in solidarity with imprisoned Los Lobos gang members who were killed in La Roca prison on 4 April (coded separately). Three prisoners climbed onto the roof of the maximum security building. The prisoners further announced a hunger strike and impeded the changing of prison guard shifts. Prison guards diffused the situation in an unspecified manner.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: Diario Regional Los Andes; Ecuavisa; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 5 April 2023 (between 4 - 5 April), in Guaytacama (Cotopaxi), imprisoned Los Lobos gang members held 21 prison guards hostage in Cotopaxi prison to show solidarity with imprisoned Los Lobos gang members who were killed in La Roca prison on 4 April (coded separately).

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 5 April 2023, in Milagro (Guayas), two unidentified armed men described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed two men in a drive-by shooting along Amazonas and 9 de Octubre streets. The two men were traveling on foot when they were intercepted and shot several times in their heads and chests by the attackers. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 6 April 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Colorados (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), dozens of merchants of Valle Hermoso parish captured and beat up two men that they claim had been demanding money in exchange for not harming them. Police officers later rescued the men and took them to a police station.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Esmeraldas News
notes: Around 6 April 2023 (as reported), near Malimpia (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of Los Lobos gang members kidnapped, stabbed, tortured, and killed three women and buried their dead bodies, with hands tied, on a rural road toward Valle del Sade along the Rio Blanco/Esmeraldas river. Workers at a rural farm discovered the three bodies. The perpetrators had kidnapped the victims, who were reported missing on 4 November, while they were driving out of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. On 20 November 2023, authorities arrested three Los Lobos gang members, including one who claimed responsibility for the attack. 3 fatalities.

On 6 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed men described as hitmen/criminals/delinquents shot and killed two men in the 5 de Diciembre housing cooperative in the Isla Trinitaria neighborhood. The perpetrators parked their motorcycle on a street corner close to where the two men were drinking together. One of the perpetrators walked toward the victims to shoot them, while the other waited with the motorcycle. The two victims were cousins. Neither victim had a criminal record. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

On 6 April 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a woman outside of her home in a drive-by shooting in the Urseza 3 sector 4 neighborhood. The perpetrators intercepted the woman, who was elderly, as she stood outside of her home and fired several shots. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil
notes: On 6 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), four unidentified individuals described as delinquents and members of an organized criminal group set fire to and exploded a car in the Brisas del Salado housing cooperative in the Isla Trinitaria neighborhood. One of the perpetrators arrived in a car, while the other three arrived on two motorcycles. They then poured gasoline on the car and set it on fire before using their two motorcycles to leave the area. The car then exploded into a fireball and damaged five or six nearby homes. Some sources indicate that a woman was injured by the shockwave of the explosion, while another source states that the woman jumped out of her window as the fire from the burning car spread to her building. Despite initial reports, police authorities investigating the scene denied the presence of an explosive device inside the car. There were no fatalities.

On 6 April 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), four unidentified armed individuals riding on two motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting on Sucre street, at the entrance of the 26 de Junio neighborhood. The armed men shot their victim seven times. Reports indicate that the man's head was 'destroyed.' There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 6 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals traveling by motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in block 17 of the Balerio Estacio housing cooperative. The man was also traveling by motorcycle with a woman passenger when they were intercepted and shot by the attackers. The woman was shot in the thorax and was taken to a local hospital. The attackers took the victim's motorcycle after the attack, but authorities discovered it abandoned a few minutes later. The male victim had an unspecified criminal record. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 6 April 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), two unidentified armed individuals (described as hitmen) shot and killed the provincial chief of operation of the national Ecuadorian Transit Commission (CTE) near the Driver Union's gas station. The armed individuals parked the motorcycle they were traveling on as one of them approached the victim on foot in a restaurant close to the gas station. The perpetrator used a 9-mm calibre pistol. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Around 6 April 2023 (as reported), in Viche (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a man and placed his decapitated head on a bench in the center park of Viche, at the mouth of the Viche river onto the Esmeraldas river. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 6 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of perpetrators kidnapped a merchant along Alborada street for ransom and injured him by cutting off his finger. The victim's family paid USD 10,000 for his release, but the perpetrators demanded more money and cut the victim's finger. The perpetrators had demanded USD 500,000 for his release. Police liberated the victim on 7 or 8 April 2023. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

Around 6 April 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least two unidentified individuals kidnapped two people near the 9 de Octubre district. On 6 April, in the 9 de Octubre district, the two kidnapped victims were liberated after police authorities intercepted the vehicle in which two perpetrators were driving them to an unspecified location. There is no further information available.

On 7 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed men described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Napoleon Mera Street and Zaruma Alley. The victim was outside his home washing his motorcycle when the perpetrators arrived and fired at least eight bullets. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Expreso
notes: Weapons seizure: Around 7 April 2023 (between 6 - 7 April), in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), national police personnel from the Anti-Bomb Squad of Intervention and Rescue Group (GIR) retrieved 20 blocks of high explosives discovered in a vehicle (car bomb) parked by suspected criminal gang members next to a gas station near the Terminal Terrestre bus station. The explosives were reported and retrieved around the night and morning of 6 and 7 April. The vehicle had been reported stolen in 2022. There were no arrests made. Police later indicated that 17 out of the 20 dynamite sticks were made in Peru and were likely placed by criminal gang members, as the sticks of dynamite were the same kind as ones confiscated from a criminal gang member during a police raid in Quito's Carcelen neighborhood in March 2023 (coded separately).

Around 7 April 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), at least two unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a teenage girl and forced her into prostitution. Police authorities liberated the victim on 7 April and arrested two perpetrators.

On 7 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified individuals (described as extortionists), who arrived on two motorcycles, shot and killed a merchant in front of his family inside their home in the La Ladrillera sector of Monte Sinai. The perpetrators killed the victim because he refused to pay an extortion fee. The victim had been extorted for the past three months, with the attackers demanding 20 USD per week. The victim was shot twice in the chest and once in the head. There is no further information about the perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 7 April 2023, in Santa Lucia (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a man after entering his house in the city. The armed individuals entered the house and shot at two men inside multiple times. The homeowner died while a friend who was visiting him was shot multiple times in the chest but survived, being transferred to a hospital in Daule. The identity and motivation of the attackers is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 April 2023, in Valle Hermoso (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), residents captured and beat up three men that were demanding extorsion money. They burned down the car that they used. Police officers later rescued the men.

On 8 April 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), various unidentified armed men described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man outside of a house in a drive-by shooting along 20 de Julio Street, in the Las Canonazos sector of San Pablo parish. The armed individuals intercepted a man and opened fire, killing him and shooting and injuring two nearby children, one of whom was walking with him. Both children were hospitalized. 1 fatality.

On 8 April 2023, in Daule (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals killed a man in a drive-by shooting at a tortilla stand along Jose Hurtado and Velasco Ibarra streets in the Ciudadela Patria Nueva neighborhood. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 8 April 2023, in Milagro (Guayas), two armed individuals described as hitmen riding motorcycles killed a man riding his motorcycle in a drive-by shooting along Sucre Avenue. The perpetrators intercepted the victim near a commercial center and shot him various times. 1 fatality.

On 9 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), around 100 residents of the La Floresta sector attacked police officers with rocks and sticks after police attempted to capture suspected robbers in the area. The authorities seized a rifle and three motorcycles used by the suspects. They also recovered a police gun that had been stolen from one of the officers amid the mob. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 9 April 2023 (as reported), off the coast of Santa Elena peninsula (coded to Santa Elena, Santa Elena), the Ecuadorian Navy confiscated 1 ton of cocaine in a barge 262 nautical miles (around 485 kilometers) northwest of the Santa Elena peninsula. They apprehended two individuals.

On 9 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as extortionists riding trimotors attacked a public bus in a drive-by shooting in the Pascuales sector. The perpetrators intercepted the bus as It arrived at the bus terminal and opened fire while circling it. The bus driver got off the bus and ran away as it got hit by bullets. Reports indicate that the perpetrators are suspected local criminal gang members who demand an extortion fee of half to three dollars for each bus route in the city. Other bus cooperatives in the area mentioned having to pay 50-dollar daily or weekly 'protection' fees to extortionists. There were no casualties.

On 9 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as extortionists wearing hoods shot at the front of a nightclub along Santa Catalina Street and the Norte de Machala Periphery Road. Police authorities suspected the armed individuals of being local extortionists. There were no casualties.

On 10 April 2023, in the rural area of Paquisha canton (Zamora Chinchipe), two unidentified armed individuals traveling by motorcycle killed a former municipal council candidate in a drive-by shooting in the rural Chinapintza mining sector. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Policia DMG Zona 8
notes: On 10 April 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), four armed individuals traveling in a van kidnapped a male business owner along Ayacucho Street for ransom. The business owner had left his shop with two employees when they were intercepted by the perpetrators. Two perpetrators exited the van with rifles, robbed the victim's colleagues, and then coerced the victim into the vehicle. They contacted the victim's family, demanding a large sum of money (sources range from USD 100,000 to 500,000 and USD 1 million) for his release. Police liberated the victim on 13 April in the Flor de Bastion neighborhood during an operation in which they also arrested one suspect.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 10 April 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a male off-duty police officer while in the Santisima Trinidad church. The armed individuals entered the church and opened fire on the people inside, targeting the police officer. A stray bullet killed a woman and inflicted injuries on three others. The armed individuals took the police officer's gun after the attack. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 10 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a man after entering his house in an area known as La Barraca in the Blanca Garcia de Alvarez. The two hitmen arrived at the victim's house on a motorcycle and approached the victim inside on foot. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 10 April 2023 (between 9 - 10 April), in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men and left their dead bodies in an empty lot in the Altagracia neighborhood, in the Las Malvinas sector. Local residents reported hearing around 6 or 8 gunshots the night of 9 November. They also indicated that the empty lot was a known spot for drug users. The report indicates that a drug user was the one who discovered the two dead bodies. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

On 10 April 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), five unidentified heavily armed individuals shot and killed a father and son in their home in the San Martin de Porres Bajos neighborhood, also known as El Quilombo. The perpetrators arrived at the house on motorcycles and entered it. They first shot the father twice in the living room and then the son in an adjacent room. Police authorities indicate that the son was the target of the attack. There is no further information on the motivation of the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 11 April 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), at least 30 unidentified hooded and armed individuals in boats and vehicles shot and killed nine people and injured another four in the artisanal fishing port. Several victims were local merchants and fishers. The authorship and motivations are unknown. 9 fatalities.

Looting: On 11 April 2023, in Naranjito (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as delinquents stole 44 rifles from the Community Police Unit (UPC) of Naranjito. Police authorities arrested one suspected police officer for collaborating with the perpetrators. There is no further information available.

On 11 April 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), three unidentified armed individuals described as delinquents shot and killed two people inside their house in the 9 de Octubre neighborhood. The attackers arrived in a vehicle and stepped out to open a barrage of fire on the exterior of the house, killing the two men inside. Authorities indicate that the attack is suspected to be a dispute between criminal organizations. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Around 11 April 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was killed and his dismembered head was found inside a car parked behind a church in the 26 de Junio neighborhood. The victim was a construction business owner. The number and identity of the perpetrators is unknown. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 11 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), various unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and injured two men in La Floresta 1 neighborhood. The armed individuals arrived at the neighborhood in a vehicle and approached the two victims to open fire. They shot one of the individuals as he tried to flee into a house. Police discovered 18 bullet shells at the scene. Police forces later apprehended seven suspects linked to the attack, confiscating three vehicles and four guns in the process. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. There were no fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Defusal: On 11 April 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), police authorities confiscated two sticks of dynamite left by an unspecified criminal gang to extort a female merchant along Lizardo Garcia and Medardo Angel Silva streets. One armed perpetrator had stepped out of a vehicle earlier in the day to place a box on the street corner containing two dynamite sticks. The perpetrators had left a signed message threatening the woman. According to police authorities, the explosives were not going to explode because the perpetrators did not include wicks. Police indicated that the explosive was left by the extortionists to threaten the merchant to pay them extortion money.

On 11 April 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), four unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen traveling by car killed two men in a drive-by shooting at a drug rehabilitation clinic in the La Poza de Tamarindo sector, near the Juan Pablo II school. The perpetrators drove up to the clinic and used pistols to shoot at patients near its entrance. The clinic had 12 patients. One of the victims was hit and killed inside the clinic, while the other was hit by a bullet as he attempted to run away. Police authorities suspect that at least one of the patients killed was the target of the attack. Both of the victims were undergoing an unspecified judicial process. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 11 April 2023 (as reported), in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unidentified man was killed and unspecified parts of his dismembered body were found in a sack hanging from the Antonio Andrade Bridge (South Bridge) in the San Camilo parish. The number and identity of the perpetrators is unknown. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 11 April 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), police authorities confiscated two smoke grenades discovered on a roundabout in the Pope Pio XII sector. The police authorities conducted an investigation into the suspicious placement of the grenades, as they found them 30 meters from a police security camera and 100 meters from a gas tank.

Around 11 April 2023 (between 10 - 11 April), in Daule (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two men, both Russian nationals, in La Aurora parish. The men had gone drinking with friends at a private party but disappeared overnight, and their dead bodies were found in the morning. One victim was shot seven times in the head and thorax, and the other five times in the thorax. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 12 April 2023, in La Mana (Cotopaxi), residents captured, tied, and beat up a man that they accused of being a robber. They also forced him to walk though 28 de Mayo street while being whipped by nettle. Police officers rescued the man and took him to a police station. There were no fatalities.

On 12 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators stabbed and killed a man and left his dead body wrapped in blankets in a trimotor carriage along Juan Pendola Avenue. The victim was likely killed on the same day as the body was discovered, as the trimotor was discovered in the middle of a busy road and reported quickly. 1 fatality.

Around 12 April 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals killed six prisoners in the CPL Guayas No1 pavilion of the Litoral Penitentiary. A different report indicates that the bodies were discovered in pavilion 5, which is controlled by the Los Aguilas Gang. The bodies were discovered hanging in their cells by a prison guard. There is no further information available. 6 fatalities.

On 12 April 2023, in Loja (Loja), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen (also 'gatilleros') shot and killed a woman along Paris and Brussels streets, near the Private Technical University of Loja. They shot the woman three times. Police apprehended the two suspects, an Ecuadorian and a Venezuelan national, soon after the attack. The Ecuadorian national had an existing criminal record for extortion, illicit trafficking, and carrying a weapon. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 12 April 2023, off the coast of Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of armed perpetrators opened fire on 13 fishermen by La Caraguay port as they headed by boat to a shrimp farm near Puna Island, injuring six of them. The perpetrators stole the fishers' belongings and took two firearms from two guards on the fishing boat. The perpetrators were suspected pirates that were spotted returning to Puna Island the day before after an attack on fishermen in Posorja (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

On 12 April 2023, in Junin (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man in his car in a drive-by shooting at a site known as La Reformada. The victim was driving his car along the road when he was intercepted and shot by the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 12 April 2023, in Machala (El Oro), police forces retrieved and remotely detonated a dynamite placed inside a pickup truck by unidentified men described as extortionists in sector 3 the Ciudadela El Bosque neighborhood. The perpetrators broke the truck's window and placed the explosive with a threatening note inside. The note was addressed to the owner of the truck and a local restaurant, demanding USD 2,000 in exchange for not killing him.

On 12 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Assad Bucaram housing cooperative in Pascuales parish. 1 fatality.

On 12 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as delinquents shot and killed a man at the intersection of 24 and Febres Cordero streets. The attackers intercepted the victim's vehicle to shoot him. Authorship and motivation unknown. On the same day, also in Guayaquil, an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a woman along 41 and Maracaibo streets. The woman was in a vehicle accompanied by two other people, who were not injured. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 12 April 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Zona H sector. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; El Comercio (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Policia DMG Zona 8; Primicias
notes: On 13 April 2023, off the coast of Posorja (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (described as pirates) shot and killed three fishermen at the Posorja fishing port. The perpetrators had intercepted the fishermen while they were at sea, close to the port area, and shot them. Two of the fishermen were left dead in their boat, while one died later from his wounds. The perpetrators had travelled from Puna Island and returned in that direction after committing their attack. 3 fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 13 April 2023 (as reported), in Daule (Guayas), national police forces confiscated 1 ton of cocaine during a raid in Daule. Authorities indicated that the drugs had come from a distribution center in Nobol. They arrested two Ecuadorian nationals.

Around 13 April 2023 (between 12 - 13 April), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), three unidentified individuals killed a man and left his dead and mutilated body at the entrance of the 26 de Junio neighborhood, also known as Tripa de Pollo. The man had been reported kidnapped in the El Bolsillo neighborhood on 12 April 2023 by three individuals who forced him into their vehicle. 1 fatality.

On 13 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two armed men described as extortionists riding two motorcycles shot and killed a local business owner after entering his home in the La Ladrillera sector, near Monte Sinai. The perpetrators had arrived at the victim's house to collect a USD 20 weekly extortion fee. Once discovering that the man could not pay it, they stole his wife's cellphone instead, but the man resisted and was shot once. The perpetrators then executed the man by shooting him once in the head (tiro de gracia) before leaving the house. 1 fatality.

On 13 April 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals traveling in a mototaxi opened fire on a group of people in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Las Americas neighborhood, injuring two. One of the victims was shot in the head and was hospitalized in critical condition. During the attack, the attackers used at least one revolver pistol. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

On 13 April 2023, in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed men described as hitmen traveling by motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in front of a sports field along Tomas Larrea Street. The perpetrators intercepted the man as he exited the field and gave chase to him before shooting at least four times and killing him. 1 fatality.

On 13 April 2023, in Cayambe (Pichincha), four unidentified armed individuals described as extortionists traveling by vehicle injured three people in a drive-by shooting of a local nightclub. Security video footage shows the perpetrators first attempting to park their vehicle near the nightclub before turning around and driving directly toward the building. The perpetrators opened fire at the building and injured the club's guard and two people standing at its entrance. There were no fatalities.

Around 14 April 2023 (as reported), near La Chorrera (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators described as criminals shot and killed a woman and left her dead body, with hands tied, at the side of the E-15 highway from Pedernales to Jama. The victim's body had bullets wounds throughout it and showed signs of torture. Police authorities indicate that the victim was taken from a different location and dropped at the site where her body was discovered. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 14 April 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Salinas neighborhood. The victim was shot various times. 1 fatality.

On 14 April 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as delinquents and criminal group members placed and detonated an explosive device at the front of a pharmaceutical building in an act of extortion and fired at least four shots at the front of the building. The explosive device detonated and damaged the metal door of the building. There were no casualties.

Weapons seizure: Around 14 April 2023 (as reported), in Sucumbios province (coded to Santa Rosa de Sucumbios), military forces confiscated nearly a thousand mines, 30 blocks of explosives, and 10 kilograms of Amex explosive at a rural clandestine mining site. The raid was conducted by the No. 68 Engineer Battalion of Cotopaxi. There were no arrests made.

On 15 April 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Colorados (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), residents of San Juan de Rio Verde burned down two motorcycles that were used by two men to rob Otongo Mapali commune and who were arrested minutes prior.

On 15 April 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), residents of the Solis neighborhood captured and beat up a man after he had attempted to rob a house. Police officers later rescued the man and took him to a police station.
