One of the victims was running his father's business, who had been killed in February 2023 (coded separately). Police are investigating the possible connection to the father's death. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 2 fatalities.

Around 18 June 2023 (as reported), in Bahia de Caraquez (Manabi), a man was killed and parts of his dismembered body were found on Velasco Ibarra Avenue in the Nariz del Diablo sector. The remains of another man were found the previous night in various parts of the municipality (coded separately). There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 18 June 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), an unidentified individual, described as hitman, shot and killed a man outside a commercial establishment on Municipalidad Street and Marcos Aguilera. The assailant fled the scene on a motorcycle with an accomplice. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 19 June 2023 (as reported), in San Vicente (Manabi), a person was killed and their torso was found without head and limbs inside a bag under the municipal dock. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, between Portoviejo and Crucita (coded to Crucita, Manabi), several unidentified individuals opened fire from a vehicle at another car, wounding two of its occupants (drive-by). The injured victims reached a hospital on their own. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. There were no fatalities.

On 19 June 2023, between Guayaquil and Samborondon municipalities (coded to Guayaquil, Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals kidnapped two people and held them for ransom (express kidnapping) while they were traveling from Urdesa to Samborondon. The perpetrators demanded a payment of 200,000 USD for the release of the victims. The police arrested two individuals involved in the kidnapping and rescued the victims hours later.

On 19 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a transgender woman in a drive-by shooting near the El Tunel sector. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals, described as hitmen, shot and killed a man inside his house in the Los Vergeles sector. Police found seven blocks of drugs on the victim's property. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot at two men in a drive-by shooting from a car in the Paso Lateral sector. The men were injured and taken to hospital. One victim is a relative of the Los Choneros Gang leader. The motives behind the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 19 June 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot at a woman and her daughter standing outside their home in Viva Alfaro (drive-by). The daughter shielded her mother by hugging her, but she was hit with seven fatal bullets. The daughter succumbed to her injuries in the hospital, while her mother survived the attack. No arrests were made, and the motives remain under investigation. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants shot and killed the son of a business man who was a passenger on a motorcycle driven by his father in San Cristobal. The attack is related to an extortion, where assailants had demanded $10,000 dollars from the father. Despite the murder, the extortionists continued to demand money from the family. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.
Defusal: On 20 June 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), police forces destroyed a stick of dynamite left in front of a house. There is no further information available.

On 20 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), three unidentified armed individuals, described as delinquents, kidnapped a taxi driver for ransom (express kidnapping) on Narcisa de Jesus Avenue and left him tied by the hands near Samanes Park. The perpetrators stole the victim's vehicle and called his relatives to demand payment of 2,000 USD to return the car. Members of the police, alerted by a citizen witness, rescued the victim. However, the perpetrators fled the scene. The perpetrators are unknown.

Around 20 June 2023 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), four men were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds to the head on the Pajonal road. Two of the victims had a criminal record for theft, trespassing, personal injuries, and weapons possession. It is suspected that the attack was related to a dispute between criminal gangs who are fighting for control of the territory and illicit income. 4 fatalities.

On 20 June 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed a taxi driver between 299th Street and 200th Avenue in the La Paz neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 20 June 2023 (as reported), in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), a teenage girl was murdered and her body was found with signs of violence and strangulation on a road. The victim had bruises on her body and was wrapped in a sheet. The victim had gone missing the previous day. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 20 June 2023 (as reported), between San Agustin and La Cuca (coded to San Agustin, El Oro), a man was killed and his body was found tied up and with signs of violence (unspecified). There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2023, in Huambalo (Tungurahua), dozens of residents captured and burned alive a man that was accused of extortion of merchants. The man was killed and police officers later took the body. Police say the victim was of foreign national. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Sucre (Guayas), a group of people beat an individual who minutes before had stabbed a man in an attempted robbery between Manabi and Av. del Ejercito streets. The mob also set fire to the suspect's motorcycle, who was later detained by the police. There were no fatalities.

On 21 June 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), several unidentified individuals broke into a house in the El Rocio sector of the San Pablo neighborhood pretending to be police officers and subsequently shot two male members of the same family. One of the victims died and his brother was injured with a gunshot to the head. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in San Vicente (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals opened fire on the occupants of a taxi. In the attack, three people and a baby, the son of one of the victims, were killed. One more person who was at the scene survived the attack and was injured. The perpetrators fired at least 22 shots at the vehicle. The victims' relatives took the bodies by their own means, preventing the corresponding procedures of the authorities. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 4 fatalities.

Around 21 June 2023 (as reported), in San Vicente (Manabi), human remains were found floating on the seashore on Los Perales beach. Among the remains were a head, an arm and a leg. Authorities investigate whether the human parts found belong to a human body that was found without limbs on 19 June under the municipal dock. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 21 June 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a person was murdered, and their body was found decapitated. Hours later, a person's head was found inside a sack on Casuarina Avenue. It is suspected that the head and the body belong to the same victim. There is no further information available on the reasons and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 21 June 2023, in San Luis (Chimborazo), during a security operation in Riobamba prison, three prisoners were found dead with signs of strangulation. In the morning, there was talk of a possible riot after a security search was carried out in the early morning hours, in which the Police, Army and Prosecutors Office intervened. Shortly after, the three bodies were discovered. The victims had recently been transferred to the prison. The case remains under investigation. 3 fatalities.

Around 22 June 2023 (as reported), in Cumanda (Chimborazo), a person was killed, and their body was found in a sack on La Isla Avenue. The motives and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 22 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), several unidentified individuals described as delinquents opened fire on the doors of a photography shop on Simon Bolivar and 10 de Agosto streets. There were pedestrians in the area at the time of the attack; however, no one was injured. The attack is suspected to be related to an extortion attempt against the shop's owner. Perpetrators unknown. There were no casualties.

Defusal: On 22 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police forces carried out a controlled detonation of 19 sticks of dynamite that were thrown outside a house in the Isla Trinitaria sector. Perpetrators unknown.

Property destruction: Around 22 June 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), police forces seized more than one ton of cocaine in a banana shipment bound for Belgium at one of the city's ports. One person was arrested.

On 22 June 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting near the Machala Prison. The victim had just been released from prison after serving a sentence for arms trafficking. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals on a motorcycle (likely drive-by) shot and killed a lawyer in the Brisas de Machala neighborhood. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Manta (Manabi), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle (likely drive-by) shot and killed a man in the La Pradera sector. According to witnesses at the scene, at least 13 shots were heard. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed a man in the Los Esteros parish. The victim's wife, who was pregnant, was injured as a result of the attack. The victim received several gunshots to the head. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 22 June 2023 (as reported), off the coast of Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals described as pirates shot and killed a fisherman in the Punta de Jambeli area. The individuals arrived in four boats and shot several times at the victim. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2023, in Valencia (Los Rios), a group of unidentified individuals intercepted and killed three members of the same family who were traveling in a vehicle in the Aguas Claras sector. One of the victims was found dead inside the car, while the bodies of his two sons were abandoned next to a banana plantation. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 22 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an informal taxi driver was shot and killed by an unknown number of armed assailants on La Cruz street. No arrests were made and the motives are unclear. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 22 June 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), over 700 police officers, military personnel, and naval forces raided 25 locations and destroyed eight wooden houses that served as hideouts for Los Choneros gang members in El Coco and La Sapera neighborhoods. The brother of the leader of the criminal organization was arrested during this operation, and authorities also destroyed 34 barricades and obstacles that were placed on the streets to prevent police patrols.

On 23 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped the owner of restaurant in La Garzota, an Italian national. At least two perpetrators were wearing police uniforms. The kidnapping was likely due to extortion and ransom, as the same victim suffered an extortion attack on 27 September 2023 (coded separately). The victim was released six days later.

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Cumanda (Chimborazo), a man was killed, and his decomposing body was found inside a sack among the bushes on the Cumanda - Buenos Aires road. The victim had multiple gunshot wounds. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators of the attack. 1 fatality

Around 23 June 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was killed and his dismembered body was found inside three sacks in the Las Canas sector in Monte Sinai. Next to the body was a note with a threatening message against people who steal on public buses, suggesting that the victim was a thief. There is no further information about the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

source: El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified individuals kidnapped an Italian chef from his restaurant in the La Garzota neighborhood and took him to Posorja rural area. Two of the individuals were armed and dressed as police officers. The victim was held captive for several days, threatened with having his ears and fingers cut off, and beaten. The kidnappers demanded various sums of money for his release. They also stole a watch and money from his bank accounts, in addition to an extra ransom paid by his relatives. The victim was freed on 28 June after a clash between the police and the kidnappers, during which a suspect was killed (coded separately) and another was arrested. There were no casualties.

On 23 June 2023, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle chased and killed a man with a submachine gun in the 29 de Noviembre neighborhood. Five suspects were arrested. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Primicias
notes: On 23 June 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), two unidentified armed suspects stepped out of a car and shot at a lawyer outside a parking lot in Jeronimo Carrion street. The victim was taken to hospital with gunshot wounds to the neck, shoulder and chest, his health condition remains undisclosed. The car used for the attack was abandoned in Guapulo and one of the suspects of Venezuelan origin was arrested. Police forces investigate whether the attack was linked to the victim's work as an attorney. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

On 24 June 2023, in Jipijapa (Manabi), two armed individuals on a motorcycle opened fire on a man in a drive-by shooting in front of a house in the Alberto Heredia neighborhood. In the midst of the attack, a child in the area was wounded by two bullets to his neck and right shoulder. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators of the attack. There were no fatalities.

On 24 June 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting outside his home in the El Rocio sector of the San Pablo parish. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 24 June 2023, in Daule (Guayas), unidentified assailants threw a grenade on a parked car outside of the Community Police Unit in La Yolita neighborhood. The car belonged to a high-ranking police officer and the motive is suspected to be due to retaliation for dismantling the gangs operating in Daule. No arrests were made. There were no casualties.

On 24 June 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed two men who were parked in their car at a gas station (drive-by). One of the victims had a criminal record for unauthorized firearms, ammunition and explosives. No arrests were made and the motives are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals opened fire on a group of citizens inside a residence in the Las Canas sector, Monte Sinai. At least four people were killed, and two more were injured. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. This incident occurred a week after the dismembered bodies of three men, including a minor, were found in the same neighborhood (coded separately). At least 4 fatalities.

Around 25 June 2023 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), a man was killed, and his body was found wrapped in a sheet in the El Macho canal. The victim's body showed signs of violence (unspecified) and had been missing since 23 June. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified individuals opened fire from a taxi on a group of people in a drive-by shooting in the El Porvenir neighborhood, killing one man and injuring another. On the same night, in another drive-by shooting, unidentified individuals opened fire from a vehicle on another group of people in the Florestal 1 neighborhood of the Eloy Alfaro parish. In this attack, three people were killed and five were injured. The perpetrators shot more than 50 times at the citizens. Authorities are investigating if a burned vehicle found later in the Santa Isabel sector was used by the perpetrators. The reasons and motivations behind the attacks are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 25 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a transit agent was shot and killed by an unknown number of armed assailants on Bolivar street. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 25 June 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a group of people beat and injured two individuals accused of attempting to rob passengers on a city bus in the downtown area around Martha Bucaram de Roldos. One of the suspects jumped from the moving vehicle in an attempt to escape the mob. It is unknown if the individuals were arrested by the police. There were no fatalities.

On 26 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals in a vehicle opened fire on the occupants of another vehicle in a drive-by shooting on Consolata Avenue, causing the car to crash into a property. One of the occupants died, and the other two were injured. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

source: El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 26 June 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals in two vehicles intercepted the car of a businessman in the Panorama Industrial sector and kidnapped him. The victim owns a shrimp packing company. The victim's car was abandoned in the Hector Cobos cooperative and found hours after the kidnapping. The police rescued the man on 28 June, and suspect that the kidnapping may be linked to extortion demands as companies in that area have been targeted by extortionists seeking 'collaboration' for 'security'. No arrests were made.

On 26 June 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), a group of unidentified individuals opened fire on four people inside a commercial establishment in the 6 de Enero neighborhood. Three of the victims died, and one was injured. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 3 fatalities.

Around 26 June 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least three unidentified suspects abducted five men and took them to a residence in the Juan Montalvo neighborhood. Police forces carried out an operation three days later and rescued the unharmed victims. According to the officers, the victims came to Guayaquil from Los Rios and Manabi provinces tricked into receiving loans. After the kidnap, the suspects were demanding USD 5,000 for ransom to the victim's relatives for their release. Three suspects were arrested during the operation.

On 26 June 2023, in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed an engineer from the National Corporation of Electricity (CNEL) in Los Corales neighborhood. The assailants fled and the motive remains unclear. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), during the inauguration of a Citizen Revolution Movement (MRC) local office, unidentified assailants threw an crude explosive, that was later activated and exploded. Dozens of people were present, however no one was injured and no material damage was reported.

On 27 June 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), residents of El Pisque sector captured and beat up a man that they say had robbed and assaulted an elderly citizen. The man was later turned to police officers and taken to a police station.

On 27 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified individuals who arrived on a motorcycle shot and killed a man inside a car wash in front of the Folke Anderson stadium. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 27 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), several members of the Los Tiguerones Gang opened fire on a group of people in the Balerio Estacio sector, resulting in five deaths. According to local residents, the victims were motorcycle taxi drivers who had been previously threatened due to a territorial dispute related to their work. The perpetrators fired at least 40 shots at the scene. Police arrested a member of Los Tiguerones Gang. 5 fatalities.
Around 27 June 2023 (as reported), in Posorja (Guayas), a man was killed and his dismembered body found on a street in Las Penas. No arrests were made and the motive remains unclear. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two armed individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed a person in a drive-by shooting on Casuarina Avenue, near the Entrada de la Ocho sector. The perpetrators fired eight times at the victim. The perpetrators behind the attacks are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), in the Santiaguito de Roldos Cooperative, unidentified individuals on a tricycle taxi killed a man and his wife in a drive-by shooting. The attack is suspected to be related to drug trafficking gangs operating in the area (unspecified). The perpetrators behind the attacks are unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 28 June 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), residents of Augusto N. Martinez parish captured and beat up a man that had been robbing a house. The man was later turned to the police.

Defusal: On 28 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police forces destroyed explosives (unspecified) that were left by members of the Los Tiguerones Gang in front of a grocery store in the Trinitaria sector. Local residents stated that days earlier, individuals claiming to be members of the Los Tiguerones Gang threatened several business and homeowners in the area, demanding $500 monthly extortion payments.

Around 28 June 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was killed and his dismembered body was found beside the Prosperina viaduct. There is no further information on the motives and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals opened fire from a car and killed two people in a drive-by shooting between Colon and La Septima streets. The armed individuals fired more than 20 times at the victims. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 28 June 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), a group of taxi drivers captured and beat a man accused of robbing and threatening a taxi driver with a firearm minutes earlier around Paccha and Tiwintza streets. The man was later handed over to the police. There were no fatalities.

Around 28 June 2023 (as reported), in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified individuals who arrived on a motorcycle, described as hitmen, shot and killed a man near the Municipal Traffic Unit. The victim tried to escape from the assailants but died due to the severity of the injuries. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 June 2023, in Pedernales (Manabi), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed a Colombian citizen in a drive-by shooting in the Los Ceibos sector. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 1 fatality.

On 29 June 2023, in La Mana (Cotopaxi), residents captured and beat up a man that was known as an extortionist in the sector, and who had threatened to kill a local shop owner that refused to pay. There were no fatalities.

On 29 June 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Colorados (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), residents captured and beat up two men that had attempted to rob a local business. The residents cut them with broken glass. Police officers took the two men to a hospital.
On 29 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), residents of Suburbio sector captured, tied up and beat up a man that allegedly robbed rearside mirrors of cars.

On 29 June 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Cooperativa Valparaiso 2 complex. Police stated the victim did not have criminal records, but the location where the attack took place, was a drug use site. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 29 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police forces arrested the leader of the Los Lobos Gang operating in the province of Esmeraldas.
Defusal: On 29 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces safely detonated an explosive that had been thrown by unidentified individuals inside a building in the Kennedy sector.

Defusal: On 29 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces safely removed a dynamite stick that was found in a house in Lomas de la Florida. There is no further information on the motives and the actors who planted the explosive.

Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in San Jacinto del Bua (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), the body of a minor who was kidnapped was found on the road Chone-San Jacinto de Bua. The body was found with signs of torture. No arrests were made and the motives are unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 29 June 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), authorities found human remains in an advanced state of decomposition in the neighborhoods of Familias Unidad and San Jorge Bajo. They discovered a head, an arm and a leg inside several bags. No arrests have been made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 30 June 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), at least three members of the Tiguerones gang in a vehicle shot and killed a worker from the Petroecuador oil company outside the premises of the company in a drive-by shooting. The victim was killed right after voting for the state's workers' union. Days later police forces carried out an operation at La Guacharaca sector, in the city center, during which three of the suspected perpetrators of the attack were arrested and a security operations center used to track movements of police officers was dismantled. One of the arrested suspects was the leader of the gang, according to police forces. The motivation behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 June 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), several unidentified individuals in a car (drive-by shooting) shot at a woman and a man who were riding a motorcycle on San Ignacio and Primero de Mayo streets, in the Andres de Vera parish. The woman died, and the injured man was taken to a hospital. On the same day, in the Picoaza parish, several unidentified armed individuals in a car shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 3 de Mayo sector. There is no further information on the reasons and perpetrators behind the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 30 June 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a motorized tricycle driver (tricimoto) in a drive-by shooting in El Fortin. According to the authorities, the victim had refused to pay extortion money. On 27 June, armed individuals opened fire on a group of people, killing several mototaxi drivers who had also been threatened for refusing to pay extortion money (coded separately). No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 30 June 2023 (as reported), in El Carmen (Manabi), a man was killed and his body was found inside black bags on a bike path. The number of perpetrators, authorship and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 30 June 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), at least 10 unidentified armed suspects, according to witnesses, arrived in a car and opened fire inside a pool bar at la Union parish, killing six men and injuring at least 10 people with stray bullets. The wounded victims were taken to a hospital. Police linked the attack with an act of revenge between local gangs over a drug trafficking territory dispute. 6 fatalities.

Defusal: On 1 July 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (Machala, El Oro), national police agents defused an explosive left on the parking lot of the Yilport sea port. The port's manager had been receiving threats asking him to allow unauthorized persons to access the facilities.

On 1 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed gang members who arrived in a car opened fire against a group of workers of a refrigeration containers company during their break killing 5 of them. Police forces suspect the attack was linked to drug trafficking gangs after the workers had allegedly refused to let the gang members use the loads they worked with to smuggle cocaine from Guayaquil and if it was, therefore, a revenge. 5 fatalities.

On 1 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects shot and injured a taxi driver in the Las Orquideas complex. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

Around 2 July 2023 (as reported), in Caspicorral (Azuay), a man was killed and his body was found at Caspicorral community, in the Quingeo parish. The victim was found tied hand and foot, with signs of violence and wrapped in plastic and in a blanket. Witnesses stated the victim did not live in the area. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot and killed an adolescent inside a car after a hearing he attended for illegal possession of weapons in a court house in the San Pablo parish. The taxi driver and the victim's pregnant girlfriend, who was in the car with him, were shot and injured. Police stated the attack was linked to a drug trafficking territory dispute between Los Choneros and Los Lobos gangs. The perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects described as delinquent in a car opened fire against a group of people outside a local hospital in a drive-by shooting at Medardo Cevallos street while the group was visiting relatives. Two civilians and a security guard of the hospital were shot and injured. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 2 July 2023, in Jaramijo (Manabi), and unknown number of unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen on two motorcycles chased after a car from Manta to Jaramijo municipality and opened fire in a drive-by shooting against the occupants of the car, after the vehicle had crashed into a tree. Three people managed to get off the car, one was killed and one was injured and later assisted by firefighters. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
Property destruction: On 3 July 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), military officers seized over 7,500 gallons of smuggled gas on the Arenillas-Las Lajas highway. The cargo was on its way to Peru.

On 3 July 2023, in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), four unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen shot and killed two men inside a dating night establishment. Police suspect the attack was linked with drug trafficking territory dispute between Los Choneros and Los Lobos gangs and with the killing of a minor the day before in the San Pablo parish (coded separately). Police arrested four suspects of being involved with the deceased after a clash took place (coded separately). Perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 3 July 2023, in Duran (Guayas), unknown armed suspects in cars and motorcycles opened fire against locals in a drive-by shooting in the El Recreo neighborhood. A female and two male civilians were shot and killed by stray bullets and two were injured. 3 fatalities.

source: El Mercurio (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 3 July 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was killed and his body was found on the 24th May Street, in the Villas del Seguro sector. The victim was found wrapped in plastic, with signs of torture and with hands and feet tied. Locals stated an unknown number of suspects in a car abandoned the body in the location and fled. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 3 July 2023 (as reported), in Portovelo municipality (El Oro), a man was found beaten, tied up, and with gunshot wounds on the road to Salati after a group of individuals had abducted him the day before and had beaten and shot him. The victim was taken to hospital by a group of locals. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 3 July 2023, between Pedernales and Cojimies cantons (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects in a car shot and killed a moto-taxi driver in a drive-by shooting in the road between the two municipalities, while the victim was working and fled after the attack. Police stated the victim did not have criminal records. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 3 July 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two unidentified armed suspects broke into a house in the La Loreto Alto sector and opened fire against a man killing him and injuring a woman who was also inside the house and taken to hospital. Police stated the attack was linked with drug trafficking and rival gangs dispute. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, near Vuelta Larga (Esmeraldas), dozens of residents of 50 Casas and Los Mangos neighborhoods demonstrated and lit tires and other objects on fire to block the highway that connects Esmeraldas and Atacames near La Tolita neighborhood, to demand local and national authorities deliver the aid promised to them since the previous month to help reconstruct after major flooding in the region.

On 4 July 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects forced a man out of a vehicle and beat, tied his hands and feet, and shot him to death in the Primavera 2 sector. Hours later a car was set on fire in the Ferroviaria 1 sector, and it was suspected the same individuals were involved in the attack since the car was the property of the deceased victim. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 4 July 2023 (as reported), in Macara (Loja), three men were killed and their bodies were found in a roadside of the El Limon - La Bocana road, La Victoria parish. The victims were found tied up and with gunshot wounds. Police suspect the attack was linked with settlement of scores or with illegal mining in the zone. Six people were later arrested accused of being involved in the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

Defusal: On 4 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an explosive device was abandoned outside a building in Kennedy Norte. The device, consisting of two differently coloured packages, was thrown from a passing vehicle by unidentified individuals. Police evacuated the building and cordoned off the surrounding area to prevent harm to civilians. Anti-explosive units removed the device, which did not detonate. This was the second explosive device abandoned at the same location within a week (coded separately).

On 4 July 2023, in Puerto Inca (Guayas), a man was shot and killed by two unidentified armed individuals while parking his motorcycle. The victim, who provided transportation services on his motorcycle, was killed during his working hours. Several others were injured in the incident. Approximately ten minutes away, the body of another victim was found on the street and police are investigating a possible connection between the two incidents. No arrests have been made, and the motive remains unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), a group of locals from Callejon Parra and 40th streets held a suspect accused of participating in a homicide short after having opened fire against police officers on 38th Street. The locals beat the man up and police intervened arresting the individual. With the suspect police found a firearm. There were no fatalities.

Around 5 July 2023 (as reported), in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), two men were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture in a banana plantation in the Buenavista road. Witnesses stated the night before the bodies were found, firearm noises were heard in the locality. Police suspect the victims were taken to the plantations alive and then killed. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects, described as hitmen, in a car shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Juan Montalvo sector. The victim was shot at least 11 times. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 July 2023, in El Naranjo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects (described as hitmen) on a motorcycle shot and killed a merchant inside his car on the Portoviejo - Santa Ana road in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 6 July 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Cayo (Jipijapa, Manabi), a man was killed and his body was found strangled and with tied hands inside his house. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 July 2023, in Balao (Guayas), two unidentified suspects on a motorcycle killed an off-duty police officer and injured another in a drive-by shooting. A third officer was with them but was not injured. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects in a car shot and killed two people inside a car in a drive-by shooting at 25 de Julio Av., in the south area of the city. The victims were shot at least 20 times. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 6 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed suspects who arrived in a car and a motorcycle shot and killed at least 3 people and injured one inside a house at Aeropuerto road, in the San Jose citadel, Los Esteros parish. The wounded victim was taken to hospital but did not survive the injuries. Police found at least 25 bullet casings and suspect that the initial targets of the attack were the two killed residents, and the other victims, who were air conditioning technicians, were collateral victims. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. At least 4 fatalities.

On 6 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unidentified armed suspect described as hitmen on a bicycle shot and killed a man in the intersection of J-6 and J-11 streets, Jocay neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The victim was shot at least 7 times in the back. The motivation behind the attack and the perpetrator are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 July 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed suspects shot and killed a man in El Bosque complex. The victim was in a wheelchair due to injuries sustained during a previous attempt on his life. Police stated the victim had an arrest warrant for homicide. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 7 July 2023, near the Coast of Manta (Manta, Manabi), the navy intercepted and apprehended a floating gas station on the sea. On the gas station navy officers found 1m080 gallons of petrol. Three suspects were arrested.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), unidentified assailants threw a grenade at the municipal Judicial Unit offices during a homicide trial happening in the city. Four people, among them a girl and a woman were injured. This incident is part of a broader series of violent events involving explosives and attacks, including prior bomb threats and attacks on Judicial Units in Quito (coded separately), Esmeraldas, and Santo Domingo. There were no casualties.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects who arrived in a car opened fire against a group of at least 20 people who were carrying out a celebration at Siete Lagos sector, in the south part of the city. Four people died after the attack and 11 others, including three minors, were injured and taken to a hospital. Some cars parked near the attack's location were also damaged during the attack. The motivation behind the attack or the identity of its perpetrators are unknown. 4 fatalities.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Santa Marta (Los Rios), two people were killed and their bodies found wrapped in plastic in the Las Rosas sector. It is suspected that the victims were killed somewhere else, and their bodies dumped in that location. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.
Defusal: On 8 July 2023, in La Joya de los Sachas (Orellana), police agents defused a hand grenade left on the doorstep of a house. The motivation and those responsible for the explosive are unknown.

On 8 July 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), unidentified suspects on a motorcycle opened fire on a hair salon in a drive-by shooting in the La Ciudadela el Paraiso neighbourhood. Two people were injured. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), three unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed a person inside a car and set the vehicle on fire, in the Simon Bolivar Av. Treboles del Sur sector. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown, but there is criminal group activity in the area. 1 fatality.

Around 8 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a woman was killed and her body was found in the Monte Sinai sector wrapped in plastic. The body was in an advanced state of decomposition. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 8 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police forces arrested the suspected leader of the Los Gangsters Gang during a police operation in the Cuatro Esquinas sector, Isla Piedad neighborhood. The individual had three arrest warrants for homicide and possession of stolen goods.

On 9 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), at least eight residents of the Los Esteros sector at the south of the city captured, stripped of his clothes and beat up a man who was captured after he stole from a woman.

Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in Cuca (Arenillas, El Oro), a man was killed and his body was found in the San Augustin sector. His body had marks of violence and a deep cut on his throat, beheading him. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 9 July 2023 (as reported), in El Rodeo, Portoviejo (Manabi), four inmates at El Rodeo prison were found hanging dead. Two of the victims were arrested days before linked to a grenade attack in a Judicial Unit (coded separately) in the same municipality. The other two victims were serving time for homicide. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), several unidentified armed men arrived in cars and on motorcycles and opened fire on a group of people gathered for a family reunion in the Siete Lagos neighborhood. Two men were killed, and twelve others, including three minors, were injured in the attack. Police suspect the incident was related to territorial disputes between two criminal organizations. No arrests were reported. 2 fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Colorados (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), residents of the Santa Martha sector entered the house of a man that was accused of sexually assaulting a person with disabilities, took out his belongings to the street and burned them. Police officers intervened and dispersed them.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 10 July 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), two unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman and a man that were also travelling on a motorcycle, in a drive-by shooting outside a local school in the city center. The male victim had served two months in prison for drug trafficking, although there is no indication of his belonging to a criminal group and relatives of the victims stated the deceased had received two death threats in the past. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 10 July 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two armed suspects on a motorcycle opened fire against a local public bus after one of the suspects got off the motorbike and shot the bus at least three times at Teniente Cordovez Av., in a parking area. Workers and drivers of the bus company have received threats by alleged extortionists. There were no casualties.

On 10 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed men shot and killed a man in the La Florita neighborhood. The victim was shot at least 20 times. Relatives of the victim stated the victim was mistakenly attacked. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Flavio Alfaro (Manabi), two unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen on a motorcycle opened fire against a man in the Carlos Alberto Aray Av., after one of the suspects got off the vehicle and shot the victim, who was taken to hospital, where he was pronounced death. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 11 July 2023, in Jaramijo (Manabi), pirates threatened, robbed, and injured three fishers on the sea, leaving them adrift. They were rescued after 27 hours. There were no fatalities.

Around 11 July 2023 (as reported), in El Cambio (Machala, El Oro), a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in a sheet on a banana plantation in the Patera sector. His head and one arm had been removed. His body had cuts and shooting wounds. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 11 July 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), unidentified crime group suspects on motorcycles shot and killed a CTE transit commission agent, in a drive-by shooting in the Homero Castro Av.. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 July 2023, in Loja (Loja), suspected members of Los Lobos gang threw an explosive device outside the anti-drug judicial office of the municipality. Its detonation caused significant property damage to the front door and vehicles parked nearby, but there were no injuries. Police stated the attack could be linked to several police operations the unit had been carrying out against the gang. The day after, the police carried out another operation where 12 suspected gang members were arrested in the city center and the Miraflores Alto sector. With them police seized portions of different drugs, cell phones, cash, and explosive material. There were no casualties.

Around 11 July 2023 (as reported), in Duran (Guayas), a person was killed and the dismembered body was found by police forces in the Abel Gilbert complex, near Guayas river. Police suspect the attack could be linked to a dispute between the Latin Kings and Los Chone Killers gangs. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), three unknown armed suspects opened fire against a man in the Prado Vicente Maldonado and Vicente Piedrahita streets, in the city center, killing the victim and injuring 4 other people, one of whom was taken to hospital. Police investigates if the injured victims were hit by stray bullets. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 July 2023, in Bahia de Caraquez (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects on a car shot and killed a man in a service station at km 8 in a drive-by shooting. Police stated the victim was arrested two weeks earlier for unspecified charges and was under provisional relief measures. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed assailants on motorized vehicles shot and killed two men that were talking to each other in the neighborhood Nueva Esperanza in a drive-by shooting. The victims were taken to the hospital and one was pronounced dead. Shortly after, another armed attack led to one death (coded separately). No arrests were made and the motives are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 11 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of armed assailants shot and killed a Venezuelan national, abandoned a car and were picked up by accomplices in the neighborhood La Florita, Los Esteros. No arrests were made and the motives remain unknown. 1 fatality.

On 12 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed men in a car and on a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting inside a house in the La Florita neighbourhood. The victim's sister-in-law was hit by a stray bullet and killed. The attack was motivated by drug trafficking disputes in the region. The perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 12 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects in a vehicle (described as hitmen) shot and killed two lawyers inside their car in a drive-by shooting. The victims had just left the Machala prison facility after completing legal proceedings. Two suspects were arrested during a police operation the following day. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 12 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified armed assailants (described as delinquents) on two motorcycles arrived at a store in the Carlos Magno cooperative, Juan Montalvo sector. Before stealing $2,300 in cash, the suspects fired at the storefront and broke the glass with stones and kicks to gain entry. Inside, they subdued the owner and carried out the robbery. The victim reported receiving extortion messages, phone calls, and threats over the past three months demanding payment to avoid harm to his life and business. Police responded to the scene and conducted a controlled detonation of an explosive device left by the perpetrators. No arrests were made.

On 13 July 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), two unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the intersection of Juan Cabrera and Rodrigo Triana streets in a drive-by shooting. A minor who was with the victim was injured during the attack and taken to hospital. Police suspect the attack was linked with a revenge. The deceased victim had unspecified criminal records and suffered a homicide attempt days before (coded separately), in which other four people resulted injured. Nevertheless, the motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 13 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified armed individuals described as extortionist on two motorcycles broke into a commercial establishment in the Juan Montalvo complex and damaged part of the infrastructure of the local business and stole some cash. According to witnesses, the suspects threatened the business owners for not paying the monthly extortion payment and opened fire against the establishment, before fleeing.

Around 13 July 2023 (as reported), in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed suspects on a motorbike shot and killed a man inside a car wash establishment in the Nuevo Puertoviejo neighborhood, after one of the suspects got off the vehicle. The victim was taken to hospital, but did not survive the injuries. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 13 July 2023 (as reported), in Riobamba (Chimborazo), three male bodies showing signs of torture were discovered in the Gallo Rumi neighbourhood. One victim was identified as a Colombian national, another as an Ecuadorian national, while the third victim remains unidentified. Authorities detained four suspects linked to the Los Lobos criminal organization. The motives behind the incident remain unclear. 3 fatalities.

On 14 July 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), merchants blocked the Cuenca - Pasaje highway near Control Sur bus stop with burning tires and woods as a demonstration to voice their grievance about the prohibition of interparish, canton and provincial buses to take passengers in the sector.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), in Manta (Manabi), three men were killed and their bodies were found with tied hands and shooting wounds. Two of them, including a fisher, were found near the Los Sauces street while the third one was found behind the Metropolitano stadium of the Anibal San Andres de Montecristi parish. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 3 fatalities.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), near Balosa (Machala, El Oro), two men were killed and their bodies were found on the km 18 of the highway leading to Balosa. They had feet and hands tied up, and shooting wounds around the body. One of them was found dead, while the other had been shot and injured in the neck but was still breathing. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: CONAIE: Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador; Indigenous Group (Ecuador)
source: Deutsche Welle; El Telegrafo; Machala Movil; Wambra Medio Comunitario
notes: On 14 July 2023, in Las Naves (Bolivar), a group of anti-mining residents and members of the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE) provoked unrest during a demonstration against the celebration of an environmental consultation on mining activities in the region. Police forces stated that a police station was attacked and set on fire by some of the demonstrators. Members of CONAIE denounced police violence against demonstrators and that at least 10 demonstrators were injured. Three police officers were also injured, and two demonstrators were arrested. There were no fatalities.

On 14 July 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals shot at least 15 times and killed a taxi driver inside his vehicle in Las Lomas sector. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 July 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals in a motorbike shot and injured a man in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Familia sector. The victim was taken to hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), near Naranjal canton (Guayas), police forces found the decapitated and mutilated body of a taxi driver in a banana plantation near La Previsora sector. A video recorded by the victim before his death, in which he explained why he was executed, went viral. The number of perpetrators remains unknown, and the motives unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), in Winchele (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects (described as victimizers) shot and killed the manager of a sex night club establishment after breaking into the premises on the road to San Mateo municipality. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), in Manta (Manabi), two unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen on a motorbike shot and killed two men outside a convenience store in Las Cumbres neighborhood, near Interbarrial road, after one of the suspects got off the vehicle and opened fire against the victims at least 10 times from behind. One of the victims was the owner of the store. Another man was shot and injured by a stray bullet and was taken to hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), near Montecristi (Manabi), a man was killed and his body was found in the Montecristi-Colisa road. The victim was found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 July 2023, in Naranjal (Guayas), two unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a taxi driver. Authorities are probing a possible connection to the killing of another taxi driver in Naranjal on the same day (coded separately). The motives remain unclear, and no arrests have been made. 1 fatality.

Around 14 July 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was killed by an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects (described as hitmen) and the dismembered body and head were found on the bank of Esmeralda River, Isla Piedad sector by police forces. According to witnesses, the head of the victim had been thrown from a vehicle at night. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 July 2023, in Santa Rosa (Tungurahua), Indigenous residents from the Pucara Grande sector captured a man that was found robbing a house, beat him up with nettle and sprayed cold water in accordance of Indigenous punishment norms. He was later turned to the police.

On 15 July 2023, in Las Naves (Bolivar), residents staged a demonstration to voice their grievance about the celebration of the results of a referendum of the mining project of Curipamba - El Domo by Curimining company. The residents later threw rocks, sticks, gasoline, Molotov bombs, firecrackers and shot artisan guns at the police officers on the information table placed by the Environmental Ministry to inform residents of the referendum. The officers and the residents clashed. At least 13 civilians were injured and two were arrested. Three officers were also injured.

source: El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 15 July 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), three unidentified armed suspects on motorcycle opened fire on the Prosecutor's Office Flagrancy Unit, in a drive-by shooting at Patria Av., and threw an explosive device. Police suspect the targets of the attack were five prisoners inside the facility. The explosive device did not detonate and was neutralized shortly after by police forces. A minor was slightly injured by a stray bullet and taken to hospital. The three perpetrators were arrested. There were no fatalities.

Around 15 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified armed men in a motorcycle opened fire against 6 people in a drive-by shooting in the Cooperativa 17 de Septiembre sector. A woman died later in hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed suspects shot and killed an off-duty civil traffic agent (ACT) and shot and injured another person between the 5th and 6th sector. Witnesses stated the suspects opened fire shooting the agent in the head and fled after the attack. Both victims were taken to hospital, but the agent did not survive the injuries. Police found 10 cartridges. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 15 July 2023 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), two people were killed and their bodies were found on La Primavera Avenue, wrapped in plastic, with signs of torture and with gunshot wounds. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News; Machala Movil
notes: Around 15 July 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was decapitated and killed. His dismembered body and head were found in plastic bags in the city centre. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: SUMA: United Society More Action Party; Avanza (Ecuador)
notes: On 16 July 2023, in La Union (Esmeraldas), an armed suspect shot and killed a candidate for assembly member of the Actuemos coalition, conformed of SUMA and Avanza political parties. The reason behind the attack is assumed to be a robbery, however it has not been confirmed. 1 fatality.

On 16 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified suspects opened fire against the crowd during a party on the Delfin Amaya and Nestor Nieto streets. Two people were killed and two others were injured. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 16 July 2023, in Chanduy (Santa Elena), unknown armed suspects opened fire against a group of people in the Las Acacias sector. The victims tried to escape the attack breaking into a house, but they were shot and killed. Five people were killed. The attack was reported as a massacre. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 5 fatalities.

Around 16 July 2023 (as reported), in Nulti (Azuay), a man was killed and his body was found in a road to Nulti parish. The victim was found with his hands tied up, with a threatening message toward extortionists in the area (extortionists caught will end up like this), with knife wounds and his head was wrapped in plastic. It could not be confirmed if the victim was an extortionist. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 16 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the intersection of 201 and 305 streets, in the La Paz neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso
notes: On 16 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), police forces arrested between six and ten individuals, including the leader of the Los Choneros criminal gang in Manta during an operation in the San Mateo neighbourhood. Police also recovered a stolen vehicle and seized a rifle, cartridges, 18 cel phones, communication radios, and counterfeit currency.

On 17 July 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators shot at two men who worked as informal, trimotor taxi drivers in the Oramas Gonzalez citadel. One of the victims died and the other was hospitalized. The authorship and motivations are unknown, but informal taxi drivers are often targeted for extortion attacks in the area by criminal gangs. 1 fatality.

On 17 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed suspects shot and killed a man inside his house after breaking into a victim's house in the Carmen Bautista neighborhood, Puerto Bolivar parish. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 17 July 2023 (as reported), near Puerto Baquerizo Moreno (Galapagos), police and military forces seized 1,1 tons (1,125 kg) of cocaine in a fast boat destined to Central America, during an operation. Two suspects were arrested.

On 17 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three unidentified armed assailants opened fire on a group of people in La Carpa park, located in the Floresta 1 neighborhood near Domingo Comin Avenue. The attack left four people dead and three others injured, who were transported to the hospital. Among the deadly victims was a pregnant woman, and a man with a criminal record. Two of the injured also had criminal records. The assailants fled in two cars. No arrests were made, and the motives remain unclear. 4 fatalities.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 18 July 2023, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), six unidentified armed group suspects, described as delinquents, on two vehicles shot and killed three people, and injured a fourth person, inside a hair salon at Julio Andrade street, in the Nueva Aurora sector, Guamani parish. Witnesses stated, gunmen shot at least 30 times to the victims and that two of the deceased, of Venezuelan origin, were the target of the attack. Locals carried out a demonstration the day after the attack demanding more security in the sector (coded separately). One suspect linked to the attack, with theft and extortion records, was later arrested. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 18 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects in a vehicle opened fire against a group of men inside a soccer field in a drive-by shooting in the San Alejo complex. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 18 July 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen shot and killed a local business owner inside his commercial establishment in the intersection of Ejercito Av., and Vicente Mendoza street, in the San Alejo parish. The suspects fled on a motorbike after the attack. The victim was taken to hospital, where he was pronounced dead. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 19 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects (likely gang members due to connection with previous attack) broke into a house in the Guasmo Norte sector and opened fire against a group of people killing three people and injuring two others who were taken to a hospital, where they later died. Police stated the attack was linked with the killing of three people the day before in the La Floresta neighborhood, including a drug trafficker (coded separately) and suspect it was a settling of scores. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 5 fatalities.

Around 19 July 2023 (as reported), in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects (described as hitmen) in two cars ambushed a group of men in a car in the Piedra Larga sector and opened fire against the ambushed car at least 32 times after stepping off the vehicle, killing one man and severely injuring another, who was taken to hospital. The fatal victim had criminal records for criminal association. One of the cars used by the armed suspects was found later burned in the Circunvalacion sector. The perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 20 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), unidentified armed shooters inside a car opened fire in a football camp and killed five people in the Guasmo Norte neighbourhood. Four of the fatal victims had unspecified criminal records. The motivation and perpetrators of the crime are unknown. 5 fatalities.

On 20 July 2023, in Duran (Guayas), two unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man, in a drive-by shooting in the Los Helechos sector. The victim was shot at least six times. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 20 July 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), three unknown armed suspects described as hitmen on a motorcycle shot and killed a man at Sector 1, in the Che Guevara complex, in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 20 July 2023 (as reported), in Los Quemados (Guayas), a woman was killed by unidentified assailants. Her body was found with signs of torture, shots in the head and with her hands tied with duct tape. Authorities suspect that the incident occurred due to settling of scores which is linked to a double homicide that happened 20 minutes away in Cascol (coded separately). No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 20 July 2023 (as reported), in Cascol (Manabi), two men were killed by unidentified assailants and their bodies were found. One victim was a Colombian national, and the other was a taxi driver. Their bodies were discovered with gunshot wounds to the head and their hands tied with tape. In Los Quemados, approximately 20 minutes away, the body of a woman displaying similar signs of torture was found (coded separately). Authorities believe the incidents are connected and likely the result of a settling of scores. No arrests have been made. 2 fatalities.

On 21 July 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), a woman was killed with two shots to the head and her body was found in a creek at Puerto Honda sector. Police stated the victim had criminal records for criminal association. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 21 July 2023, in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas canton (Esmeralda), military forces dismantled and destroyed two cocaine processing laboratories and chemical precursors for the manufacture of the drug at El Derrumbe sector.

On 21 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified suspects threw an explosive device at a truck in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. Police stated there were other three attacks with explosive devices in the sector and suspected the perpetrators were extortion gang members, who were threatening locals and business owners. There were no fatalities.

Around 21 July 2023 (as reported), in Montecristi (Manabi), two men were shot and killed and their bodies were found on the Colorado-El Aromo road, or the Pacific Refinery Road. Relatives of the victims stated the victims were abducted at least 10 days earlier (coded separately). The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 21 July 2023 (as reported), in Manta canton (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified suspects abducted two men, who used to live in Santa Elena municipality. The victims were found dead 10 days later in Montecristi (coded separately).

Around 22 July 2023 (as reported), in San Miguel de Ibarra (Imbabura), two brothers were killed and their hanged bodies were found inside the Imbabura prison. The cause of their death is unknown but it says they were likely hanged by a criminal group controlling the prison. 2 fatalities.

On 22 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified suspects shot and killed a woman in the Guasmo Sur neighbourhood. They pretended to have a conversation with her before shooting her several times. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed suspects (described as gunmen) on a motorcycle shot and killed two men who were also on a motorcycle in the intersection of Tacito Ortiz and Franklin Tello streets in a drive-by shooting. Witnesses stated at least 10 gunshots were heard. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 22 July 2023, in the rural area of La Union municipality (Quininde, Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed suspects (described as gunmen) on a motorcycle shot and killed two people who were inside a moto-taxi in the La Union parish, La Marin sector, in the road to El Silencio locality in a drive-by shooting. The driver of the moto-taxi was injured and taken to hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 22 July 2023 (as reported), in Riobamba (Chimborazo), a man was killed and his dismembered body was found. The man was accused of having participated in the femicide of three women in April 2023 in a river in the Quininde region. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 22 July 2023 (as reported), in Manta (Manabi), an unidentified armed suspect, described as a hitman, on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the 102 street and 4 de Noviembre Av., intersection in a drive-by shooting, while the victim was working. The motivation behind the attack and the perpetrator are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 July 2023, in Montecristi (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects described as hitmen on a motorcycle and a car shot and killed three people at Victor Veliz street, Leonidas Proano parish in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 22 July 2023, in Picoaza (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed men described as delinquents in a car opened fire against a group of people at Chimborazo Street, Picoaza parish, in a drive-by shooting. Three people were shot, one died and the other were taken to a hospital. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 July 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), residents of Calera Baja neighborhood, in Narancay parish, burned down objects to block a highway as a demonstration to voice their concerns about the planned use of the land in their sector as a bus station or a control station.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 23 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), prisoners at the local prison captured and held 15 prison guards hostage for two days. Authorities believe that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 23 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unidentified armed assailant, described as hitmen, shot and injured the mayor of Manta (Independent), while he was in the 15 de Septiembre neighborhood for the inauguration of works in the sector. The mayor was accompanied by a police escort and other civilians. Police forces who were present fired against the suspect's vehicle after they tried to escape and the vehicle crashed injuring the driver, the other suspect managed to flee. During the attack, a female football player was also killed and three other people were injured. The mayor died later in the hospital. Police seized with the suspect a machine gun, a cell phone, and some objects suspected to be used to set the mayor's car on fire. Following the incident, a foreign national was arrested on suspicion of participating in the attack and was transferred to a prison under strict security measures. 2 fatalities.

Around 23 July 2023 (as reported), in El Guabo (El Oro), a man was killed and his body was found hanged and with tied hands in a banana plantation in the La Maravilla sector. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 July 2023, in Canaquemadas (Pasaje, El Oro), unidentified suspects kidnapped a couple on the Pasaje-Canaquemadas highway. They were taken to a banana plantation and the woman, who was a police officer, was raped. Both victims were also robbed, had their hands tied, and were abandoned on a grass field. The perpetrators of the attack are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 23 July 2023 (as reported), in Ventanas (Los Rios), four unidentified armed suspects had abducted a person for unknown reasons. Police forces carried out an operation on July 23 and the suspects were arrested and the victim released. Police seized a machine gun, a previously stolen car and two motorcycles.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 23 July 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), prisoners of the CRS Ambato prison captured and held 3 prison guard inside of the prison wings. Authorities believe that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 24 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), prisoners of the local prison captured and held 15 prison guards and two administrative workers. Authorities believe that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

On 24 July 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), for the second consecutive day, residents of Calera Baja neighborhood, in Narancay parish, burned down objects to block a highway as a demonstration to voice their concerns about the panned use of the land in their sector as a bus station or a control station.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 24 July 2023, in Turi (Azuay), prisoners of the local prison captured and held at least 53 prison guards.
