Authorities believe that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 24 July 2023, in Canar (Canar), prisoners of the local prison captured and held at least 5 prison guards. Authorities believe that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 24 July 2023, in Santa Elena (Napo), prisoners of the local prison captured and held at least 12 prison guards. Authorities believe that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 24 July 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), prisoners of the local prison captured and held three prison guards and started a hunger strike. Authorities suspect that the retentions at multiple prisons in the country this day are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).
On 24 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), a group of people captured, beat up, and handed over to the police after he robbed a local resident.

On 24 July 2023, in Tonchigue (Esmeraldas), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a teenage boy that was playing football at the local school's sports complex, and injured two others. A day later, an armed clash was reported outside that same school (coded separately). Classes were suspended due to the lack of security. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); Military Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023)
notes: Other: On 25 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), prisoners of Litoral prison clashed with prison guards. Military officers and police officers supported the officers to control the situation and after three days the prison was taken back by the officers. During the clashes, a total of 18 prisoners were killed, six of them were killed on the first day of the prison riot on 22 July (coded separately). Additionally ten prisoners and a police officer were injured. The prison riots have been pointed at disputes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs, that are both allies of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel. The two gangs were allied, but authorities have pointed an alleged rupture between both groups that escaladed to these prison riots.

On 25 July 2023, in Guayaquil canton (Guayas), unknown armed individuals threw an explosive device to a Communitarian Police Unit, injuring a police officer who was taken to hospital. Police suspect the attacks are linked to the clashes between Los Lobos and Los Tiguerones gangs due to the transfer of members from both gangs in the Litoral prison (coded separately).

Property destruction: On 25 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), unknown armed individuals set fire to at least two public service buses in the Lomas de Florida and La Prosperina sectors (coded separately). A private vehicle was also set on fire on Daule Avenue (coded separately), and a appliance store was looted, a motorcycle set on fire and an explosive device was thrown, but it was not activated, at a motorcycle store by an extortion gang retaliating against the shop for refusing to pay protection money on Perimetral Avenue, in the Isla Trinitaria sector (Guayaquil - Ximena).

Property destruction: On 25 July 2023, in Guayaquil canton (Guayas),a private vehicle was also set on fire on Daule Avenue, and a appliance store was looted, a motorcycle set on fire and an explosive device was thrown, but it was not activated, at a motorcycle store by an extortion gang retaliating against the shop for refusing to pay protection money on Perimetral Avenue, in the Isla Trinitaria sector (Coded separately).

source: El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Wambra Medio Comunitario
notes: Defusal: On 25 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeralda), military forces deactivated explosive devices left by unidentified suspects in gas stations in different parts of the city. School classes were canceled due to the violent events taking place in the city.

Property destruction: On 25 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unknown armed individuals set fire to at least two public service buses in the Lomas de Florida and La Prosperina sectors. A private vehicle was also set on fire on Daule Avenue (coded separately), and a appliance store was looted, a motorcycle set on fire and an explosive device was thrown, but it was not activated, at a motorcycle store by an extortion gang retaliating against the shop for refusing to pay protection money on Perimetral Avenue, in the Isla Trinitaria sector (coded separately).

On 25 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a police officer was kidnapped in La Guacharaca sector, and his gun was stolen. Perpetrators placed a grenade in his neck to intimidate him. Four suspected members of a criminal group have been arrested for this kidnapping.

On 25 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), unidentified suspects threw a Molotov explosive device at the prosecutor's office of the municipality injuring a woman. The identity of the victim is unknown and is unclear if she worked at the municipality. The building was evacuated after the attack. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 25 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas) a group of prisoners from the local prison facility captured and held 15 prison guards and two administrative workers. Police believe the retentions at multiple prisons facilities are retaliations for the deaths of 6 prisoners at the Litoral prison in Guayaquil on 22 July during a military intervention to contain clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs (coded separately).

On 25 July 2023, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), an unknown armed suspect on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting at Felipe Alvarez and Gabriel Rivera intersection, Buena Fe canton. The victim was taken to hospital, but did not survive the injuries. Police stated the deceased did not have criminal records. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: Around 25 July 2023 (as reported), in Azogues (Canar), a group of prisoners at Azogues rehabilitation center held 45 prison guards and started a hunger strike. Authorities believe the demonstration was part of the wave of unrest in the country's prisons due to the clashes between Los Tiguerones and Los Lobos gangs in some prisons of the country.

On 25 July 2023, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified suspected gang members threw an explosive device to the vehicle of a female judicial worker. It was not reported if the judicial worker was inside the vehicle at the moment of the attack. Authorities suspect this violence is linked to disputes between the Los Lobos and the Los Tiguerones gangs. There were no fatalities.

On 25 July 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects (described as delinquents) abducted a bus driver after setting private and public services vehicles on fire in different parts of the city. One of the attacks took place in Las Palmas locality, where the suspects attacked the bus, while the vehicle was in service. The passengers managed to get off the bus but the driver was abducted. Police suspects the attacks are linked to the clashes between Los Lobos and Los Tiguerones gangs. The suspects set fire to at least eight vehicles, including public transportation buses in the EL Coral sector and private cars. Lootings and shootouts were reported in different parts of the city, although the latter could not be confirmed. There were no casualties.

On 25 July 2023, near Daule (Guayas), a suspect in a motorized tricycle (tricimoto), threw an explosive device to a Communitarian Police Unit (UPC) in the road to Daule municipality, Km. 26, near Lucia bridge. A police officer was injured and taken to hospital. Police suspect the attack was linked to the clashes between Los Lobos and Los Tiguerones gangs due to the transfer of members from both gangs in the Litoral prison (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 26 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified assailants in two vehicles kidnapped three officials of the General Comptrollership of the Los Rios Province as they were headed to Mocache canton to carry out a control operation. The motivation behind the abduction is unknown. The victims were later rescued by the police.

On 26 July 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (Pasaje, El Oro), unidentified suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 11 de Julio neighbourhood. He was talking with friends in front of his house when the suspects arrived and opened fire. He tried to escape but was caught. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 July 2023, in Duran (Guayas), two unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Recreo apartment complex. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 26 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), a group of locals beat up a man accused of theft in public transportation. Police forces intervened arresting the individual. There were no fatalities.

On 26 July 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), unidentified suspects threw Molotov bombs to a public transport bus, while the vehicle was in service. The suspects were later arrested and with them police seized handcrafted explosive devices and a firearm. There were no fatalities.

On 26 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), police forces arrested the leader of Los Choneros gang in Manta municipality, and six other members during a police operation. Police forces seized with the suspects one machine gun, ammunition, 18 cell phones, radio communicator, and counterfeit money. The leader of the gang had criminal records for theft and illegal possession of weapons.

Around 26 July 2023 (as reported), in Santa Ana (Manabi), a man was killed and his body was found in an advanced state of decomposition in the Poza Honda sector. The victim was wrapped in plastic and tied up with a rope. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 26 July 2023, in El Carmen (Manabi), residents captured, tied to a post, and beat up a man that was accused to be a robber. There were no fatalities.

On 26 July 2023, in El Carmen (Manabi), residents captured two men who were accused of robbery, and burned them alive inside a car. Police officers found the car with one of the men still alive, but died later in a hospital due to the burns in his body. 2 fatalities.

Around 26 July 2023 (as reported), in Mocache (Los Rios), a man was killed and his dismembered and beheaded body was found in plastic bags. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 July 2023, in Mocache (Los Rios), three government auditors were kidnapped by unidentified assailants while on their way to conduct a control operations. The victims were held for over 30 hours and were later released in Quevedo, in the same vehicle they were abducted in. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of the abduction, but no arrests have been made. No casualties were reported.

On 27 July 2023, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified suspects inside a car shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the La Sapera sector. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 27 July 2023, in Ventanas (Los Rios), two unknown armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed an off-duty police officer while he was on his way to work, in a drive-by shooting at E-25 street, at the entrance of Los Girasoles complex. The officer was shot at least 15 times. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Property destruction: On 27 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police forces and the National Ports and Airports Research (UIPA) and National Maritime (UNAC) units seized over 4 tons (4,150 kg) of cocaine hidden in containers in the Guasmo sector during a police operation destined to Germany. One person was arrested during the operation.

Around 27 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Sucre (Guayas), two unidentified armed men shot and killed a Venezuelan man in the nightclub he owned, located at Brasil and Seis de Marzo streets. The perpetrators stepped out of a white vehicle, subdued the security guard and shot at the victim inside the establishment. Police sources revealed that the victim had received threats prior to the attack, though the motive remains unclear. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuavisa; El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Weapons seizure: On 28 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), military and police forces concluded a four-day special operation inside the Penitenciaria del Litoral prison launched following the declaration of a state of emergency by the government inside Ecuadorian prisons, due to clashes between Los Lobos and Los Tiguerones gangs. The seizures included at least 14 machine guns, 23 pistols, two revolvers, a grenade launcher, hand-crafted explosive devices, six hand grenades, 65 sticks of gel explosives, two gas grenades, thousands of rounds of ammunition, cell phones, cash and portions of drugs.

On 28 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), two unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle and a car shot and injured a man at Augusto Gonzalez and El Oro intersection in a drive-by shooting. The victim was severely injured and taken to hospital. Police stated the victim had criminal records for theft and possession of illegal substances. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 28 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), four unidentified armed suspects in two cars (described as hitmen) opened fire against a group of people at Portete district after getting off the vehicles. Two people were shot and killed and a civilian was run over and killed as the suspects were trying to flee. The perpetrators shot at the victims 10 times. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. Police stated that the two first victims were the target of the attack and had criminal records for theft. 3 fatalities.

On 28 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), one unidentified armed suspect described as a delinquent on a motorcycle opened fire against a commercial establishment in the El Palmar complex in a drive-by shooting. A boy was shot and injured by a stray bullet and was taken to hospital but did not survive the injuries. 1 fatality.

On 28 July 2023, in Manta (Manabi), three suspects abducted a Moroccan national and business owner, and demanded a 500,000 USD ransom for his liberation from his family. The victim, who lived in Colombia, had been lured into Manta city with the promise of meeting a woman. He was abducted in a hotel in the Barbasquillo sector, and held captive during four days. He was liberated during a police operation on 1 August. The three suspects were arrested.

On 29 July 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified suspects shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting on the Pinas and Juan Jose Flores streets. The man was eating at a restaurant when the attack took place. The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 29 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), four hooded and heavily armed suspects opened fire against a group of people at Patria Nueva complex, Isla Trinitaria sector, targeting a man who was in the area. Five people, including three minors were shot and injured by stray bullets. The minor and three other people, did not survive the attack. The other victims were taken to hospital. It is unknown if the target of the attack was also injured. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 29 July 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects in a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting at Barreiro parish, Barreiro sector. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 July 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), indigenous residents of the Venezuela neighborhood in Santa Rosa parish captured a man that had attempted to rob a house with an accomplice, and carried out indigenous justice ritual, which involves hitting him with nettle and throwing cold water. Police officers later took the man to a health center.

Property destruction: Around 30 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police officers seized over four tons (4,300 KG) of cocaine in the port of Guayaquil, hidden in containers destined for Germany.

On 30 July 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a sex worker woman of Venezuelan origin in a drive-by shooting at the intersection of 19 de Octubre and Teniente Cordovez streets. The suspects shot the woman to the head and fled after the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects on a car opened fire against a group of people in the Trinitaria sector killing a man in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), five policemen sexually assaulted and tortured a male detainee inside a Unidad de Vigilancia Comunitaria (UVC), while in custody. The policemen were prosecuted. There were no fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Telegrafo
notes: On 31 July 2023, in Pucara Grande (Tungurahua), 500 indigenous residents captured and beat up a man who was accused of scamming a resident in the sale of a car. The residents carried out an indigenous justice ritual as part of the punishment. Shortly after, he was handed over to the police for custody. There were no fatalities.

source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 31 July 2023, in Ventanas (Los Rios), four unidentified assailants on a motorcycle shot at the house of the governor of Los Rios region in a drive-by shooting after she took part in an operation to verify the fulfillment of the curfew enforced in the municipality. The individuals left after having shot the house several times. Another reported mentioned only two perpetrators being involved in the attack. There were no casualties.

On 31 July 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), three unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at residents of Jambeli neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. Two men and one woman were killed during the attack. 3 fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 31 July 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police forces seized approximately 1.5 (1,451) tons of cocaine concealed inside a tuna and a banana container in a port of Guayaquil municipality. Police forces stated the drug was destined for The United Kingdom. Five individuals, including a port guard, were arrested.

On 31 July 2023, in Catarama (Urdaneta, Los Rios), a couple was shot and killed by unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by) while working at their arepas stand. One of the victims had a criminal record for robbery and rape. No arrests were made. 2 fatalities.

On 31 July 2023, in Guayaquil - Urdaneta (Guayas), a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by). The motives remain unclear and no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 1 August 2023 (as reported), in San Placido (Manabi), two men, brothers, were killed and their bodies found burnt in the Roncon sector. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

On 1 August 2023, in Bahia de Caraquez (Sucre, Manabi), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at people in Bellavista sector in a drive-by shooting, injuring a boy. Minutes later, the perpetrators shot and killed one person, and injured another, in a drive-by shooting in Fanca sector. The perpetrators and motives are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 1 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle described as hitmen shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting on Domingo Comin Avenue, in the Cuba neighborhood. Another person was injured in the attack. The reasons and perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 1 August 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), three people were killed and their bodies were found naked, with signs of torture and tied up in the Flor de Bastion sector. A note was left next to the bodies threatening anyone who commits robberies in the Balerio Estacio cooperative. There is no further information on the motives and the number of perpetrators behind the attack. 3 fatalities.

Security measures: On 1 August 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), a 60-day state of emergency was declared by the Mayor and the Cantonal Emergency Operations Committee (COE), in response to rising violence and insecurity. Measures include reallocating municipal funds to address the emergency, requesting permanent tactical police units, increasing prosecutors for investigations, and urging the national government to declare a national state of exception.
On 1 August 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), a woman was shot in the head and killed by two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by) that fled towards the Peruvian border. 1 fatality.

On 1 August 2023, in Carchi (Tulcan), around 2,000 people, including productive unions representing milk, potato, coffee, panela producers, and motorists blocked the passage of the Rumichaca International Bridge in a demonstration against the economic and agricultural policies of Colombian President Gustavo Petro and to demand the reconstruction of the Pan-American Highway, destroyed by a landslide.

On 1 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a motorcycle taxi (tricimoto) driver was kidnapped, and his vehicle stolen by three unidentified armed assailants (described as extortionists) in Bastion Popular, near Pascuales area. The police quickly recovered the vehicle and rescued the driver, arresting two minors and one adult. According to the victim, the motorcycle taxi was used by the perpetrators to rob a food truck. 3 arrests.

Property destruction: Around 2 August 2023 (as reported), in a location 202 nautical miles off the coast of San Cristobal island (coded to Coast of Puerto Velasco Ibarra, Galapagos), the Ecuadorian navy intercepted a ship transporting 1.44 tons of cocaine and 10 tanks of fuel. Two Colombian and one Ecuadorian crew member were arrested. The destination of the vessel is unknown.

Around 2 August 2023 (as reported), in Manta (Manabi), police authorities rescued a foreign man that was kidnapped by three men who demanded half a million dollars for his release. The three men, with criminal records for homicide and drug trafficking, were arrested. There were no casualties.

On 2 August 2023, in Anconcito (Santa Elena), four unidentified armed assailants on two motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 2 de Enero neighbourhood in Anconcito parish. 1 fatality.
On 2 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in Ursela 3 neighborhood (drive-by). 1 fatality.

Around 2 August 2023 (as reported), in La Victoria (Santa Rosa, El Oro), a man was killed and his body found with signs of torture and his arms tied in a banana plantation. He had gone missing three days before. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Former Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Labor Group (Ecuador); Lawyers (Ecuador); Private Security Forces (Ecuador)
notes: On 3 August 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number perpetrators (described as hitmen) shot and killed a lawyer and municipality worker traveling in a taxi. The victim was the director of Planning, Ordering and Lands. Other two people, who were his bodyguard and the taxi driver transporting him, were killed in the attack. This happened while there was an emergency state declared in the province. The lawyer was a former councilmember and mayoral candidate. Authorship and motivations unknown. 3 fatalities.
On 3 August 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle killed a man in the Los Cerezos 3 sector (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 3 August 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed assailants entered Verdi Cevallso Balda hospital, and shot and killed a man who was recuperating from an attack of which he had been victim the previous month (coded separately). The assailants were able to enter the hospital faking they were patients and they needed urgent attention. The victim had faked his identity, changing his name and claiming he was from Venezuela, to escape the police for having a criminal record for evasion. 1 fatality.

On 4 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed suspects travelling in a car opened fire on a man driving a motorcycle, in a suspected drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela La Revancha sector. The man was taken to hospital for treatment. The attackers abandoned their vehicle in a nearby location. Eight bullet casings were found at the scene. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the perpetrators. There were no fatalities.

Around 5 August 2023 (as reported), in Manta (Manabi), three men were killed and their bodies were found with their faces down and several shots on the back at a failed refinery project near Colorado roundabout. 3 fatalities.

On 5 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a fish merchant in Santa Rita sector at the north of the city (drive-by). During the attack the fisher's niece was injured. 1 fatality.

On 5 August 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed two men that were in car in the center of the city. Police officers claimed that the killing is linked to criminal groups dispute of territory. 2 fatalities.

Around 5 August 2023 (as reported), in Loja district (Loja), a police officer was killed and his body was found on the Loja - Catamayo highway. The body was found with several hits and in an advanced state of decomposition. The officer was missing for more than 15 days. The victim was off-duty when he went missing. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 5 August 2023, in San Jacinto de Yaguachi (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants shot a pregnant woman in the head multiple times, killing her. A bottle of gasoline and matches were found beside her body, suggesting the attackers intended to set it on fire but fled the scene. The motive remains unclear, and no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 6 August 2023, in El Cambio (Machala, El Oro), two unidentified armed assailants kidnapped a retired Army non-commissioned officer, while on his way to buy breakfast from a local store. The perpetrators fled with the victim in a white car. No further information has been disclosed.

On 6 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man that was having breakfast at a restaurant, in a drive-by shooting at 4 de Marzo Cooperative. The victim's companion was also injured in the attack. None of the two victims had a prior criminal record. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 6 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants carried out a drive-by shooting from a tricycle, killing a girl with a shot to the head and injuring four adults in the Pascuales sector. The motive remains unclear, and no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 6 August 2023, in Puyo (Pastaza), three men were shot and killed in the Obrero neighborhood near Azuay and Esmeraldas streets. Police found no ballistic evidence at the scene, suggesting a revolver may have been used. No arrests have been made. 3 fatalities.

Around 6 August 2023 (as reported), in Portovelo (El Oro), a man was killed and his body was found with his hands and feet tied up and signs of torture. Unidentified suspects had abducted the man at a bus stop in the vicinity of the 24 de junio transport company premises on 3 August. They forced him into a car and fled. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 6 August 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), armed suspects (described as delinquents) abducted an unlicensed taxi driver and stole his car. The man was tied up and kept in a house for a few hours, until he was released. Later, the perpetrators would carry out a suspected drug-related drive-by shooting the day after with the stolen vehicle, killing three people (coded separately).

On 6 August 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), five suspected members of the Los Lobos gang shot and killed two adolescent boys, and injured a third person, in an attack in the early hours in the Guapulo neighborhood, Itchimbia parish. The perpetrators intercepted their victims at a night club, forced them onto two vehicles, and then shot them in the street in a nearby location. The survivor pretended to be dead until the attackers left the area. Two of the five perpetrators would be arrested two days later. There is no further information on their motive. 2 fatalities.

On 7 August 2023, in Guaranda (Bolivar), indigenous residents of San Francisco captured and carried out an indigenous justice punishment to a man that was accused of several robberies in the sector. There were no fatalities.

On 7 August 2023, in Tena (Napo), six members of Los Lobos gang shot and killed a man and his underage daughter inside the Rio Sogas public spa. They later escaped on three motorcycles but were arrested shortly after. The reasons behind the attack are unknown. Los Lobos are linked to the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) from Mexico. 2 fatalities.

On 7 August 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at three men who were outside a house on Juan Montalvo and Baquerizo Moreno streets (drive-by). Two men were injured and the other was killed. 1 fatality.

Around 7 August 2023 (as reported), in Portoviejo (Manabi), a man was killed and his body was dismembered and placed in different plastic bags. The parts of the man were found in Lomas de Los Vientos sector in the Portoviejo - Manta highway. 1 fatality.

On 7 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants on a tri-motorcycle shot at people in a drive-by shooting in Bastion Popular sector. One girl was shot and killed, two men and two women were injured. 1 fatality.

On 7 August 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed two students that were going back home from night school in Miramar neighborhood (drive-by). 2 fatalities.
On 7 August 2023, in Abdon Calderon (Manabi), an unidentified armed individual on a motorbike shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 August 2023, in El Salitre (Guayas), the police captured three armed members of Los Aguilas Gang, including one of the leaders, while three others escaped on a motorcycle. The leader had a history of multiple arrests and pending legal cases for organized crime, robbery, and attempted murder. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 7 August 2023, in Manta (Manta), armed suspects (described as hitmen) opened fire at a vehicle fair, killing a man and injuring another person. Police reported that the hitmen burned their vehicle in the Ciudadela Montalvan sector, in Montecristi town, during their escape. 1 fatality.

On 8 August 2023, in Llactapamba (Chimborazo), indigenous residents captured, beat up and carried out indigenous justice punishments to four men that were accused of robbery and the mother of one of them. They punished them for 12 days.

On 8 August 2023, in Santa Marta (Azuay), nine unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed a mining businessman and leader, inside his car, as he was travelling down the San Alfonso - Santa Marta highway. The assailants had been following the victim down that road in a truck. He was shot at least 40 times; his car was burned down. Authorities suspect that the attackers had also hurled explosives at the car, and that the killing took place after the business owner refused to pay them an extortion fee. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 8 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants burned down a bus on the entrance of Tenguel parish. This was carried out because of an ongoing territory dispute between gangs.

On 8 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Garcia Moreno (Guayas), four unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at a group of residents in the Cristo del Consuelo sector (drive-by). The assailants shot more than 40 times. One of the people shot was killed and two were injured. 1 fatality.

On 8 August 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), a man was shot eight times and killed by unidentified armed assailants (described as criminals) on a motorcycle in a drive-by. A few blocks down the road, the assailants' motorcycle broke down and they fled on foot. The police continued the search for them, but no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 8 August 2023, in Zaruma canton (El Oro), police forces seized 244 sticks of dynamite and 77 detonating capsules during the search of three houses. There is no further information at this point in time.

Security measures: On 9 August 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), the president met with his Security Cabinet members in Carondolet Palace to sign presidential decree 841, which places the country in an emergency state for 60 days. This allows military officers to move into the cities to enforce security. This was determined after a presidential candidate was shot and killed after a political rally (coded separately).

source: Ecuavisa; El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 9 August 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), a candidate for president for Construye movement was shot and killed by armed assailants. Prior to his assassination, he had officially reported death threats from Los Choneros to the Machala Prosecutor's Office. The candidate was ending a political rally in the intersection of Gaspar de Villaroel and Amazonas avenues. During the attack, two police officers, an assembly candidate, and six political sympathizers were injured. A suspect who sustained nine gunshot wounds at the scene was taken to a nearby hospital, where he was later pronounced dead. Right afterwards, unidentified armed assailants shot at the headquarters used by Construye Movement. At least six suspects of Colombian nationality were detained. 2 fatalities.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 9 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), three unidentified armed assailants described as delinquents kidnapped the female Dean of the School of Medicine at Guayaquil University in the La Alborada sector. The perpetrators withdrew USD 400 from the victim's bank account and stole cell phones and a computer. Four hours later, after a police operative, the victim was found in a house in Trinitaria Island and an assailant was arrested. The detained individual is suspected to be a member of an organized criminal organization (unspecified) and has a criminal record for drug trafficking and robbery. No one was injured.

Around 9 August 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Tenguel (Guayas), unidentified armed assailant decapitated two women in a banana farm in Tenguel parish. Both victims had been missing for an unknown time. The act was recorded and has been sent in social media. 2 fatalities.

On 9 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), armed suspects passing by in a car and a motorcycle hurled a stick of dynamite at a bakery, in an extortion-related attack in the Rayito de Sol sector. The explosive detonated seconds after, damaging the premises. The attackers left a threatening letter advising the owner of the bakery to pay an extortion fee. The owner was in the building at the time, but he came out unscathed. There were no casualties.

On 9 August 2023, in La Peana (El Oro), an explosive detonated in the path of a car being driven by an off-duty Pasaje canton police inspector, on the Pasaje - Machala road. The man was returning home after an operation in Pasaje canton; he had received death threats in the past due to the closures of nightclubs. He came out of the attack unscathed; his vehicle was burned down. There were no casualties.

On 9 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), two armed suspects (described as hitmen) shot and killed three men who were working at the Crista Gril car shop, located in the Jocay neighborhood. The suspects arrived at the scene in a car, and impersonated customers to get in the premises. During their escape, they abandoned their car in the nearby Montecristi town. Two victims were brothers. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

On 9 August 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), a married couple was abducted by several unidentified assailants. The woman was forced into a car, while her husband was kidnapped in his own car. The victims claim that the perpetrators were asking them for their family members' phone numbers, which they did not know my heart. The satellite tracking device on the couple's car enabled the police to save them around 11 August with another man that had been kidnapped on 8 August. No arrests were made.

Other: On 10 August 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), President Guillermo Lasso declared a nationwide state of emergency for 60 days following the assassination of a presidential candidate in Quito (coded separately). The decree mobilizes the National Police and Armed Forces to restore public order and restricts freedom of assembly and home inviolability. It replaces a previous emergency decree focused on specific provinces.

assoc_actor_2: Of Course We Can Alliance; Women (Ecuador)
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 10 August 2023, in Quevedo (Quevedo, Los Rios), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle carried out a drive-by shooting targeting the vehicle of an assembly candidate from the Of Course We Can Alliance in the Galo Plaza area. She was in the car with her father and another person. The female candidate had received several death threats prior to this attack. No arrests were made. There were no casualties.
On 10 August 2023, in Paccha (El Oro), four unidentified armed assailants entered a house in Palto sector and shot and killed a man that was hiding inside. 1 fatality.

On 10 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), on Avenida Guillermo Pareja Rolando, near the intersection with Avenida Agustin Freire in La Garzota, several unidentified armed assailants, described as delinquents, exited a vehicle and fired multiple shots at a car, killing the passenger and injuring two bystanders. One of the injured later died from their injuries. The motives remain unclear. 2 fatalities.

Around 10 August 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two armed suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed an adolescent inside a tricycle in Paquita Guillen cooperative, Guasmo Central (drive-by). Hours earlier, police had detained and released the victim during a raid. The assailants also shot and destroyed the victim's phone to erase evidence, raising suspicions of a gang dispute. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 11 August 2023 (as reported), in La Independencia (Camilo Ponce Enriquez, Azuay), Ecuadorian soldiers from the Artillery Group N1 Bolivar, in coordination with the National Police, seized explosive materials in an illegal mining site. The confiscated items include 1100 of slow fuse, 500 detonators, 757 explosive charges and 165 gallons of diesel fuel. No further information on this case is available.

On 11 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), several heavily armed assailants shot at a group of men drinking on the streets, killing three and injuring an infant, a child, and two women that were in their homes in Guasmo Sur. The perpetrators fled in two cars, and no arrests were made. 3 fatalities.

On 11 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of armed assailants in a car shot at several people on the intersection of street 35 and Avenue 16, injuring two people and killing a teenager (drive-by). Shortly after, a vehicle suspected to be linked to the attack was incinerated in Ceibo Renacer sector. No arrests were made and the motives are unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 11 August 2023, in Pedro Alto (Montufar, Carchi), military forces and local police forces seized 1,075 blocks of cocaine that were hidden in several black plastic bags in two homes of San Pedro Alto sector. Six cell phones, two homemade shotguns, five cartridges and a laptop were also seized. No arrests were made.

Property destruction: On 11 August 2023, near Zaruma (Zaruma, El Oro), military personnel seized explosive materials in an illegal mining site in El Calvario sector. They seized 26 artisanal dynamite sticks and several meters of slow fuse. No arrests were made. There were no casualties.
On 11 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), armed assailants on a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Clara neighborhood. 1 fatality.
On 11 August 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), a taxi cab driver was kidnapped by unidentified armed assailants, who demanded a ransom to release him.

On 11 August 2023, in El Salitre (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants on two motorcycles shot at three men doing construction work near Santa Marianita beach (drive-by). One man was killed, and the other two were severely injured. 1 fatality.

On 11 August 2023, in San Jacinto de Yaguachi (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants shot and killed three men and injured two men near the train lines. They shot the victims close to 100 times. 3 fatalities.

On 12 August 2023, in Daule (Guayas), residents of La Joya citadel captured and beat up a man who was accused of being a robber. The man was later rescued by police officers and taken to a health center, where he died the next day. 1 fatality.

Security measures: Around 12 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), more than 4,000 police officers and military personnel carried out an operation at the regional prison to organize the transfer of a high-profile leader of Los Choneros criminal gang. The transfer triggered several prison riots (coded separately), violent demonstrations (coded separately), armed clashes (coded separately) and car explosions (coded separately) in several cities.

On 12 August 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), a woman was kidnapped outside a tunnel by at least five unidentified armed assailants. The woman is the daughter of the former mayor of Quito. She was released after hours in the Cumbaya sector without any injuries.
tags: local administrators; women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

notes: Around 12 August 2023 (as reported), in La Libertad (Santa Elena), a man was killed and his decapitated body was found. Authorities launched a search for the missing head. There were no arrests. The motive is suspected to be related to gang disputes. 1 fatality.

On 13 August 2023, in Pinas (Pinas, El Oro), the Lieutenant of the National Police sexually abused two policewomen within the Community Police Unit. The perpetrator was arrested and is currently under investigation. There were no fatalities.

Defusal: On 13 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed assailants threw a grenade around La Paz neighborhood, where a police community surveillance unit (UVC) operates. The grenade did not explode. Police offices claimed that this was related to a dispute between gangs. It is presumed that the grenade was defused.

On 13 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Garcia Moreno (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at two men that were outside their house, in a drive-by shooting in the Cristo del Consuelo sector. One of them was slightly injured. A child of one of the victims was killed by a stray bullet. There is no further information on the identity of motive of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 13 August 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at a group of citizens that were outside a house in Manuel Aguirre citadel (drive-by). One person was killed. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 13 August 2023, in Quito - Eloy Alfaro (Pichincha), the police dismantled a clandestine drug laboratory belonging to an unidentified gang in the La Mena 2 sector. Authorities seized 11 sacks containing calcium chloride, baking soda, and sodium carbonate, as well as a gas cylinder used for drug production.

On 13 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three men were killed, and four others, including an infant and a child, were injured in El Guasmo district. Several unidentified armed assailants arrived in a taxi and a white car and fired over 20 shots at the family with a rifle and a pistol before fleeing the scene. Police suspect one of the victims, who had a criminal record, was the target of the attack. Also, a man driving his motorcycle on the Domingo Comin Avenue was killed after he crashed after two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot him (drive-by). No arrests were made and the motive remains unclear. 4 fatalities.

On 14 August 2023, in San Mateo (Esmeraldas), two unidentified assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed the leader of the Citizen Revolution Movement in Esmeraldas, near his home (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 14 August 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), a group of demonstrators set fire to a trailer truck during a demonstration against the transfer of a leader of the Los Choneros Gang to the La Roca maximum security prison, carried out in previous days. Some reports claim that part of the demonstrators were members of the Los Choneros Gang themselves, but this couldn't be confirmed. Two people were later arrested, and three submachine guns, two guns, and two motorcycles were seized from them. There were no casualties.

On 14 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in Guerrero Valenzuela and Portete streets (drive-by). The man was a Judicature Council public worker, and had received dead threats previously. 1 fatality.

On 14 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), a Venezuelan woman was killed with at least four gunshot wounds to the head near the neighborhood Mar Azul. Initial investigations link her to an organized crime group. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 15 August 2023 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), a Venezuelan man was killed and his body was found in La Primavera sector with his hands and feet tied, he had torture signs and was only wearing pants. The man had been missing for three days. 1 fatality.

Around 15 August 2023 (as reported), in Naranjito (Guayas), a man was killed and his dismembered head was left in a plastic bag in a gas station close to a Community Police Unit offices (UPC). There was a note left saying that this happened because he was a thief and was involved in extorsion. 1 fatality.

Around 15 August 2023 (month of), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least ten men on motorcycles, suspected Los Choneros gang members, abducted a merchant in the Monte Sinai neighborhood. The victim was blindfolded and taken to a house in the sector, where he was held for several hours. The suspects requested USD 500 dollars from the victim's family for his release, indicating an express kidnapping, and released the victim after receiving part of the money.

On 15 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), a man was shot and killed by an unknown number of armed assailants, described as hitmen, on a motorcycle and in a car (drive-by). The victim, with two prior criminal records, was chased and killed on Roberto Serrano y Domingo Comin streets, in la Floresta neighborhood. The motives are unclear, no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 15 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), a student was shot in the head and killed by at least two armed assailants. The incident took place outside of the victims educational institution on Avenida 25 de Julio. The motive is unclear, and no arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 16 August 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unidentified armed assailant shot and killed the owner of a store in Ayacucho street. The man had refused to pay the extorsion money demanded by gang members. 1 fatality.
On 16 August 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man and at the Aire Libre sector (drive-by). 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 16 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), the police dismantled an illegal workshop used to manufacture weapons in the Pascuales sector. It is suspected that the weapons were supplied to criminal groups within the Litoral Penitentiary, located near the site. Two people were arrested.

Defusal: On 16 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Carbo (Guayas), police forces dismantled six gas cylinders left inside a car at the intersection of Panama and Victor Manuel Rendon streets, near a Community Police Unit (UPC). Unidentified individuals, described as members of a criminal group, fired several shots at the car in an attempt to detonate the cylinders; however, the explosion did not occur. According to the authorities, the cylinders were intended to be detonated against the police as retaliation for operations carried out at the Litoral Penitentiary.

assoc_actor_2: Los Lobos Gang (Ecuador); Private Security Forces (Ecuador)
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 16 August 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), two armed assailants (described as a hitmen) on a stolen motorcycle shot and killed a municipal security guard and son of a councilman outside the central market (drive-by). Police suspect the victim had ties to Los Lobos, and the assailants were linked to Los Choneros. A pedestrian was also injured by a ricochet bullet. The victim had received threats from criminal groups in recent weeks, he also was arrested once for hiding stolen objects. 1 fatality.
On 17 August 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), merchants of the wholesale market captured and beat up a man that was accused of stealing clothes.

On 17 August 2023, in Jaramijo (Manabi), a retired military officer was shot and killed by several suspected unidentified armed assailants when he was in his small shop, adjacent to his house. The victim was shot at least 10 times, likely indicating an execution. There is no information on the identity or motive of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

Around 17 August 2023 (as reported), around Guayaquil District (coded to Posorja, Guayas), two men were shot and killed and their bodies were found in El Morro - Posorja highway. One of the bodies had his hands and feet tied up, and the other had gunshot wounds and was burned. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Private Security Forces (Ecuador)
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News
notes: On 17 August 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), unidentified armed and hooded individuals set fire to a local government property on the Viche-El Albe Road. Two security guards died in the fire. The attack occurred after contractors refused to pay extortion fees. Authorship unknown. 2 fatalities.
Around 17 August 2023 (as reported), in Posorja (Guayas), the tied up and decapitated body of a man was found. 1 fatality.

On 17 August 2023, in Puebloviejo (Los Rios), four unidentified armed assailants on motorcycles shot and killed a man near the Prosecutor's Office. The assailants' passenger dismounted and shot the victim in the head. 1 fatality.

On 17 August 2023, in Puebloviejo, Los Rios, unidentified armed assailants entered a home, shot and killed a man. His brother was injured and taken to the hospital. Police suspect the incident may be linked to threats from a criminal organization. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); MRC: Citizen Revolution Movement
notes: On 18 August 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), police officers fired at the vehicle transporting the local mayor (Citizen Revolution Movement) and his wife during a police checkpoint. According to the mayor, two plainclothes individuals who got out of a police car opened fire on his vehicle without warning. However, according to the police, the mayor's car refused to stop at the checkpoint after an alert was issued regarding three armored vehicles traveling at high speed without license plates. There were no casualties.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Private Security Forces (Ecuador)
notes: Around 18 August 2023 (between 17 - 18 November), near Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), unidentified individuals detonated explosives at a camp full of construction machinery owned by Esmeraldas municipality along the Viche - El Albe road. One private security guard was inside the gatehouse and died from the fire. This is suspected to be part of a series of extortion-related attacks by criminal groups against the Prefect of Esmeraldas after the public release of her net worth. 1 fatality.
On 18 August 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), three unidentified armed assailants kidnapped the director of the San Carlos Health Center. No further information is available at the time.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 18 August 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police officers arrested one of the heads of Los Tiguerones gang. The head was also a former prison guard.

On 18 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), six unidentified armed assailants came in a car and on a motorcycle to a wake in Mariuxi Febres Cordero sector and shot at the attendees. Three people were killed and two minors were injured. Two of the killed had a criminal record. The assailants also shot at the deceased inside his coffin, who had a criminal record, and was killed the previous day (coded separately). One of the deceased victims had criminal for different charges (unspecified). 3 fatalities.

On 18 August 2023, in Palestina (Esmeraldas), residents blocked the highway that enters the city with burning tires as a demonstration to reject the arrest of two gang members after the members left explosives outside the Esmeraldas province government (coded separately).

Around 18 August 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), the restrained body of a man was found at the San Francisco Cooperative, in the north-east of the city. According to authorities, the body had been decomposing for several hours. There were no arrests. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 18 August 2023, in San Mateo (Esmeraldas), unknown number armed individuals set fire to three vehicles at the entrance of a mechanic's workshop linked to the Prefecture of Esmeraldas. This is suspected to be part of a series of extortion-related attacks by criminal groups against the Prefect of Esmeraldas after the public release of her net worth. There were no casualties.

On 19 August 2023, in Cascol (Manabi), unidentified armed assailants shot at the members of a family that were having a gathering at the city. Three people died and four were injured. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

On 19 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), at least two unidentified armed assailants shot and killed a man in Divino Nino alley, in Los Esteros parish. The assailants came on a pick-up truck, got out of it and shot the man multiple times. After the attack they abandoned the truck. The identity and motive of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 19 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed two men and injured another in a drive-by shooting inside a car wash in Nuevo Pilo neighbourhood. Two other men were injured. Authorship and motivations unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 19 August 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in San Rafael citadel close to a football pitch (drive-by). The assailants left a note that threatened people calling themselves parts of Los Lobos gang. 1 fatality.

On 19 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed four civilians that were on road number 63, in the Balerio Estacio sector (drive-by). The civilians were afro Ecuadorian. 4 fatalities.

On 19 August 2023, in Catarama (Urdaneta, Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle and carrying rifles (described as hitmen) shot and killed two men (drive-by). No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 2 fatalities.

On 19 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Garcia Moreno (Guayas), a heavy machinery operator was shot multiple times and killed while at work by an unidentified armed assailant that fled towards a motorcycle driven by an accomplice on Argentina Street. Police suspect the killing was a targeted attack. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 19 August 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (Machala, El Oro), a taxi driver was shot and killed by an unknown number of armed assailants. Authorities suspect the incident may be a retaliation by an organized criminal group. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

Around 19 August 2023 (as reported), in Babahoyo (Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants in a car shot and killed a man riding a motorcycle (drive-by). The assailants recorded the incident, and the video went viral on social media. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 20 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), two men were shot, and one was killed, by two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting in the Las Cumbres neighborhood. The other man was injured and was taken to a hospital. 1 fatality.

On 20 August 2023, in Sucre (Manabi), three men were killed and five were injured after being shot by unidentified armed assailants, when they came to a rooster fight house and shot at people inside. The identity and motive of the perpetrators are unknown. 3 fatalities.

Around 21 August 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four Venezuelan transgender women kidnapped a man after luring him in. They held him hostage in a car and demanded ransom from his family. Police rescued the victim and arrested the suspects. Authorities suspect that the perpetrators had carried out this scheme multiple times before. There were no casualties.

Property destruction: On 21 August 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), police forces seized more than 2 tons of cocaine hidden in an export container that was headed to Spain. The container was found in one of the maritime ports of the city during a narcotics control operation.

On 21 August 2023, in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), a man was shot and killed at a cemetery by two unidentified armed assailants. The victim was shot multiple times. The reason behind the attack or identity of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 21 August 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man and at Parada 11 sector (drive-by). 1 fatality.
Around 21 August 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was killed and his body was found covered with a bed sheet in an empty lot in the Santa Martha neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 22 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle opened fire on a man who was in a store, in a drive-by shooting in the Los Esteros sector. The targeted man hid behind an elderly man, a retired military officer, who was killed in the gunfire; the targeted man was injured. Police forces suspect that the targeted man had been lured by the assailants to go to the store. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

Around 22 August 2023 (as reported), in Salitre canton (coded to El Salitre, Guayas), a man was killed and his body was found dismembered inside a bag in an empty land on Salitre - Samborondon highway. 1 fatality.

On 22 August 2023, in Playas (Guayas), two men on a motorcycle were shot and killed by unidentified armed assailants in a car and on another motorcycle (drive-by). The victims fled toward nearby bushes, where their bodies were later discovered by the police. The motives remain unclear, and no arrests were made. 2 fatalities.

On 23 August 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), a vigilante group of residents of the Juan B. Vela and the Quito streets attempted to lynch a man who they accused of trying to rob a pedestrian. The man was immobilized and beaten by the crowd. Pictures of the event showed him bruised. The man was later handed over to police custody.

On 23 August 2023, in Balao (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a man for ransom. The victim's body was discovered on 14 September 2023, having been killed despite the family paying the ransom (coded separately).

On 23 August 2023, in La Concordia (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), four hooded suspects on motorcycles shot and killed three people, two men and a woman, that were sitting inside a tricycle taxi, in a drive-by shooting in the Nueva Concordia neighborhood. The original target of the attack was suspected to be the woman. The two men, the driver and his son, were collateral victims. There is no further information on the identity or motive of the perpetrators. 3 fatalities.

On 23 August 2023, in Abdon Calderon (Portoviejo, Manabi), several unidentified armed assailants shot at a group of friends, killing a disabled man. The perpetrators fled on a motorcycle, and no arrests were made. The motives of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 August 2023, in Huaquillas (Huaquillas, El Oro), an unknown number of armed assailants entered a home and shot at a group of people in the Union Lojana neighborhood. Three people were killed, and two were injured. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 3 fatalities.

On 23 August 2023, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), a man was kidnapped by three unidentified armed assailants while he was in Gualo sector. They attacked him and recorded videos to send to his wife demanding money for ransom.

On 23 August 2023, in Duran (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants shot at the pharmaceutical laboratory offices around 90 times while they were inside their cars (drive-by). No one was injured. The previous day, the daughter of the owner of the pharmaceutical laboratory suffered from an abduction attempt that was repelled by her private security (coded separately). There were no casualties.

On 23 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), a man driving his car in Eloy Alfaro parish was shot and killed by at least two unidentified armed assailants, in a suspected drive-by shooting. The man was with his wife in his car, who was injured during the attack. The reason behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 23 August 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man that worked at a car repair shop in Las Brisas citadel (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 23 August 2023, in Chongon (Guayas), a taxi cab driver was kidnapped and tied by the hands and feet by two unidentified armed assailants who pretended to be customers in the Via a la Costa road, at the west of the city. The driver was rescued the next day and three assailants were arrested.
On 23 August 2023, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed three people on a motorcycle taxi cab (drive-by). 3 fatalities.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: Around 23 August 2023 (as reported), in Cuenca (Azuay), a man was killed and his body found in a state of decomposition inside a concreted bathtub in the El Cebollar sector. The victim's body had signs of torture (unspecified) and injuries to the head. A suspect was arrested on 23 June in the Tena canton, Napo province. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 23 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces seized almost three tons of cocaine that were hidden inside a property in the Los Ceibos neighborhood. Two people were arrested.

On 23 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), several unidentified armed assailants (described as extortionists), fired shots and detonated explosives at Circo Rolex and Discovery amusement park. They demanded $15,000 to allow operations and later reduced the demand to $3,000 for safe departure from the city. There were no casualties.

On 23 August 2023, in Playas (Guayas), a local coordinator in the public works directorate was shot and killed by unidentified armed assailants (described as hitmen) in a restaurant. His computer was also stolen in the incident. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.
On 24 August 2023, in Jipijapa (Manabi), residents burned down tires as a demonstration to voice their grievances about the lack of potable water services in the city.

Around 24 August 2023 (as reported), off the coast of Crucita (Portoviejo, Manabi), fishers found four floating bodies. After the initial investigations, authorities suspect that the victims were fishermen that were attacked at sea. No further information is available at the time. 4 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 24 August 2023, in Shushufindi (Sucumbios), military forces discovered and dismantled a larger pool used for the production of cocaine, 14 meters long and 3 meters wide, along with 2,500 gallons of gasoline, two firearms, and 200 meters of hose. Reports indicate that these types of pools are used for storing white gasoline, which is a precursor in the production of cocaine by criminal groups.

Property destruction: Around 24 August 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil canton (Guayas), police authorities decommissioned 2.6 tons of illicit substances in a car and a house on Route to the Coast. Authorities suspect that the house was used as a drug collection center for later exporting the substances abroad. Two suspects were arrested.

Property destruction: On 24 August 2023, in Duran (Guayas), several unidentified armed assailants shot at the installations of a pharmacy over 90 times at night, before fleeing. Days prior, the daughter of the pharmacy owner was the victim of an attempted kidnap (coded separately). No arrests were made. There were no casualties.

On 24 August 2023, in Huaquillas (Huaquillas, El Oro), several armed assailants on a motorcycle carried out a drive-by shooting in Los Pitufos Park, targeting a man walking with a woman. The victim was shot in the ankle but survived and was taken to the hospital. He had a criminal record for robbery. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Farc Dissident - Oliver Sinisterra Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces Of Colombia Dissident Faction (Oliver Sinisterra Front)
notes: On 24 August 2023, in San Lorenzo municipality (coded to San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas, Esmeraldas), military officers arrested six members of the Oliver Sinisterra Front FARC Dissident group, including their leader, in a camp located in a rural sector known as Pichangal, by the border with Colombia. The security forces collected five M16 rifles, explosives, a grenade, and ammunition.

On 24 August 2023, in Canoa (Manabi), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed a beer delivery driver as he was waiting to collect an order at a pool bar, in a drive-by shooting in the Agua Fria sector. The workers and owners of the bar came out unscathed. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

On 24 August 2023, in Duran (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants shot at a couple and a newborn girl in an alley at Primavera 2 citadel. Both man and woman were injured, but the newborn was killed in the attack. 1 fatality.

On 24 August 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), in the neighborhood Virgen del Carmen, a man talking to a friend was shot at by a group of unidentified armed assailants. The victim was taken to the hospital where his death was confirmed. His friend also sustained gunshot injuries and is slowly recovering from them. No arrests were made and the motive is suspected to be linked to drug trade. 1 fatality.

On 25 August 2023, in Jipijapa (Manabi), residents of Colon and Tungurahua streets, and 24 de Mayo citadel, burned down tires as a demonstration to voice their grievances about the lack of potable water services in the city.

On 25 August 2023, in Jipijapa (Jipijapa, Manabi), residents burned tires and disrupted vehicular traffic on several streets of the city to express their dissatisfaction with the lack of potable water in the canton. Although authorities had promised to supply water through tankers, this commitment has not been fully met. There were no casualties.

Around 25 August 2023 (as reported), in San Jacinto del Bua (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a man was shot, killed and dismembered in six parts, and his remains found in a sack and several bin bags, on the side of the road that leads to El Carmen. The remains were found significantly decayed. 1 fatality.

On 25 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants on motorcycles shot and killed three men just outside a church, in a drive-by shooting in the Guayas y Quil 2 sector. The three men had no criminal record. 3 fatalities.

On 25 August 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a motorcycle cab driver while he was driving, in a drive-by shooting in the Brisas del Mar citadel. The victim had been lured out of his home after receiving a phone call from an unspecified caller demanding a taxi trip. There is no further information on the identity or motives of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 25 August 2023, in Lomas de Sargentillo (Guayas), a man driving his car was shot and killed by two unidentified armed assailants (described as hitmen) on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 26 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two men on a motorcycle shot and killed the private security guard that was escorting the workers of a hydro-vacuum company in Block 6 of Flor de Bastion (drive-by). The perpetrators also stole the security company's armored vehicle, which was later found eight blocks away. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

On 26 August 2023, in San Pedro de Suma (Manabi), two unidentified crime group suspects on a motorcycle shot and killed two men, in a drive-by shooting by a locksmith's shop. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

Around 26 August 2023 (as reported), in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), two men were shot and killed by unidentified armed assailants and their bodies were left at different locations. One was left at Nueva Buena Fe residence cooperative, and the other close to Holger Montenegro school. Both bodies were found with their hands tied and gunshot wounds on their heads. Witnesses claimed to have seen suspects on a motorcycle dumping one of the corpses. There is no further information at this point in time. 2 fatalities.

On 26 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), several unidentified armed individuals, described as hitmen, on a motorcycle shot and injured three people in Guasmo Sur (drive-by). The motives are unclear. There were no fatalities.

On 26 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man who was assisting the driver by collecting fares on a bus in Mapasingue Oeste was shot and killed in what the police calls a targeted attack. The bus driver was injured in the incident. No arrests were made. 1 fatality.

On 27 August 2023, in Bajo Alto (El Guabo, El Oro), four unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle fatally shot a man that was walking home after a football game. No arrests were made and the motives remain unclear. 1 fatality.

Around 27 August 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of Los Angeles parish (Los Rios), an unknown number of armed assailants tortured and killed two men, leaving their tied bodies near El Pailon farm. Authorities are investigating whether the victims were among a list of 30 men that an unidentified gang in Ventanas had threatened to do a social cleansing. 2 fatalities.

On 27 August 2023, in Tachina (Esmeraldas), police and military offices captured and arrested a local leader of Los Tiguerones gang, who managed extortion and other criminal activities in the province.

On 27 August 2023, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), residents of Los Naranjos neighborhood captured and beat up a Peruvian man that was robbing a house. The neighbors later called the police and arrested the man. There is no further information on the injuries suffered by the arrested. There were no fatalities.
On 28 August 2023, in Guayaquil (Ecuador), a group of people beat up two man who attempted to steal from a woman in a bus of public service. There is no further information. There were no fatalities.

On 28 August 2023, in Manta (Manabi), several unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed a man inside his house, during his sleep, in an attack in the early hours in the 10 de Agosto sector, Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. The man was shot 23 times, and had been threatened for unknown reasons in the weeks prior. There is no further information at this point in time. 1 fatality.

On 28 August 2023, in Samborondon (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man sitting on a bench at a square (drive-by). The victim was talking to a friend in the square who was injured during the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 28 August 2023 (as reported), in La Concordia (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas) an armed man tied up and locked a woman's son inside their house before kidnapping her on a motorcycle. The perpetrator took the woman to another location and demanded a $10,000 ransom for her release. Police rescued her and detained four suspects.

On 29 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), a prominent lawyer and local political tv journalist was targeted by two armed men driving on a motorcycle (drive-by) while he was eating in a restaurant along Las Palmeras avenue. The lawyer and the owner of the restaurant were both shot and were taken to the hospital, but the owner recovered from his wounds while the lawyer did not. 1 fatality.

On 29 August 2023, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), three unidentified armed assailants kidnapped the son of the owner of a store. Police forces later rescued the man after a chase until the Nanegal sector.

On 29 August 2023, in Duran (Guayas), two unidentified armed assailants, described as hitmen in a car, shot and killed four people and injured three others in a parking area near a gas station on Nicolas Lapentti Avenue, 28 de Agosto neighborhood, near a local shopping center. The assailants targeted informal motorcycle and tricycle taxi drivers in a drive-by shooting, suspectedly in retaliation for refusing to pay extortion fees demanded by local gangs. Two of the fatalities were unrelated collateral victims. The perpetrators behind the attack are unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 29 August 2023, in Las Lojas (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants shot and killed a man in the residential area Beata Mercedes Molina. The victim had posted a song allusive to Los Tiguerones gang. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 30 August 2023, in Machala (El Oro), prisoners took control of the Velones Machala prison and detained 15 prisoner guards of the Security and Surveillance Corps. Authorities report that this was in support of the Cotopaxi prisoners who were raided by police on 30 August 2023. The prisoners at first conducted a hunger strike, but took control of the prison in the evening change of prison guards.

On 30 August 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), residents in El Guasmo sector, in the south of the city, threw rocks and sticks at two men who were being arrested by the police after killing a man during a robbery. There were no fatalities.

On 30 August 2023, in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), four suspects armed with high-powered weapons abducted the son of the owners of a winery at the premises, in the Atucucho neighborhood. According to witnesses, the suspects dragged the man out of the shop, forced him into a car, and drove off. Due to pressure from the security forces, they released him shortly after and abandoned the car in which they were fleeing. The abduction was suspectedly related to extortion.

On 30 August 2023, in Manta (Manta, Manabi), an unknown number of armed assailants on a motorcycle shot at two men that were walking down a street in 2 of August neighborhood, killing one and injuring the other (drive-by). Authorship and motivation remain unknown. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023); Police Forces of Ecuador (2021-2023)
notes: On 30 August 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), prisoners of the CPL Tungurahua Number 1 prison provoked unrest, took control of the correctional facility, initiated a hunger strike, and took three prison guards hostage. This action was in support of the Cotopaxi prison inmates who were raided by police on the same day. Police and military forces surrounded the prison.
