The remains were found in an advanced state of decomposition. Six suspected drug traffickers were arrested (but there were no reports on their involvement). Police seized a pistol, three ammo chargers, two dynamite sticks and 1kg of narcotics. At least 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 25 October 2023, in Malacatos (Loja), police forces dismantled a drug trafficking group during operation 'Via Lactea'. Raids were carried out in seven private properties, 10 suspects were arrested, and seized 30,446 portions of narcotics (cocaine, marijuana), seven cell phones, U$128.25 and a digital precision scale.

On 25 October 2023, in Quito - Los Chillos (Pichincha), local residents beat up with sticks and stones and attempted to set four men on fire in the San Alonzo neighborhood. About 20 police officers prevented the killings. The victims were allegedly attacking premises in the sector. The police vehicle was damaged. There were no fatalities.

On 25 October 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed a man at the intersection of 11th and Jose Laborde streets. According to the victim's relatives, the man was a drug user and had received death threats days before the attack. The police suspect that the killing is related to a territorial dispute. The perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); MRC: Citizen Revolution Movement
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 26 October 2023, in Puerto Lopez (Manabi), approximately seven unidentified armed men in a car and a motorbike shot and killed a man with several gunshots in a drive-by shooting inside his private residence. The victim was the president of the Salango Parish Board (Citizen Revolution Movement). Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 October 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a group of residents and merchants beat up a suspected extortionist during an attempted lynching in the Nueva Prosperina neighborhood. The victim was arrested and the police seized narcotics. There were no fatalities.

Around 26 October 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of the El Carmen canton (Manabi), a man was shot and killed and his body was found on the road to San Luis de Cajones. The victim had three gunshots to the head and was a drug user. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), taxi cab drivers captured, beat up and burned a man that had robbed and assaulted a taxi driver moments before in Bolivariana sector. Police officers later took the man and the injured taxi driver to a hospital. There were no fatalities.

Around 27 October 2023 (as reported), in Naranjal (Guayas), a man was shot and killed with several gunshots to the head and his body found in the bushes. The body was found with a note suggesting the victim was a criminal and the killing was out of revenge. According to the police the victim was shot dead elsewhere and his body was dumped where it was found. Authorship unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed individuals in a car shot and killed a man with at least 10 gunshots (likely execution) in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Martha neighborhood. A woman was shot and injured and the suspects were carrying long-range rifles. The victim was shot multiple times at close range. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man between 41st and Francisco Segura Streets. The victim was a former drug user. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals with long-range weapons abducted a man on Luis Vargas Torres Island. The suspects were in a truck (which was set on fire after the abduction) and the victim was later moved to a boat. Authorship and motivations unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Former Government of Ecuador (2021-2023); Private Security Forces (Ecuador); PSC: Social Christian Party (Ecuador)
source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Primicias
notes: On 28 October 2023, in Daule (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants shot at the former mayor of Duran (Social Christian Party) while he was at the Guayas Lawyers Club sports complex. One of his body guards was shot and killed, and the rest of the guards repelled the attack. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 28 October 2023 (as reported), in Ayampe (Manabi), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed four people with over 20 gunshots (likely execution) and their bodies were found near the Paso del Colibri. The bodies had signs of torture and were partially set on fire. Authorship and motivations unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 28 October 2023, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a taxi driver in a drive-by shooting in the Teniente Hugo Ortiz neighborhood. The victim was shot more than 15 times (likely execution) mostly in the head. The victim's cousin was shot dead hours earlier on Loja and Los Rios Streets, Ciudadela Las Palmeras. Authorship and motivations are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 28 October 2023, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), four unidentified armed individuals in a car shot and killed a woman in a drive-by shooting inside a nightclub on Via Holandesa. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 October 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), four unidentified armed individuals on two motorbikes shot and killed two men with at least 20 gunshots in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Catalina neighborhood. The authorship and motivations are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 29 October 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), a group of residents captured and beat up two thieves after they stabbed a man to steal his cellphone in the La Legarda sector. Later on in the day, the two thieves who were beaten responded by breaking the windows of a local house and setting the owner's motorcycle on fire. There were no arrests. There were no fatalities.

On 29 October 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man with several gunshots to the head in the Ciudadela La Pradera 2. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 29 October 2023, in San Pablo (Santa Elena), three unidentified individuals who arrived on a motorcycle, described as hitmen, shot and killed four people with more than 20 gunshots inside a resort. One of the victims was a woman and two of them had gunshot wounds to their heads. Four more people were injured. The authorship and the motivations are unknown. 4 fatalities.

Around 29 October 2023 (as reported), in Santa Lucia de las Penas (Esmeraldas), unidentified armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed two men. One of the victims was an off-duty Army soldier and his body was found inside a bar. One burnt vehicle was found nearby and police suspect it was the one used by the perpetrators. Authorship and motivations are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 29 October 2023, in Santa Lucia de las Penas (Esmeraldas), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in front of an entertainment center. According to relatives, the suspects took the victim's car to the El Rompido sector where they burned the vehicle. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 29 October 2023, in Puerto Bolivar (Machala, El Oro), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the 4 de Abril neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The suspects fired about 29 gunshots. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.
Property destruction: On 29 October 2023, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), unidentified individuals set fire to the Quininde Traffic Directorate offices. Authorship and motivations unknown.

On 30 October 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), a person was shot and killed by armed assailants on a motorbike in a drive-by shooting in the Cordillera del Condor sector, behind a church. A civilian was shot and injured. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 October 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a man with at least five gunshots in a drive-by shooting in the Ecuador neighborhood. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 30 October 2023 (between 28 - 30 November), near San Jacinto de Yaguachi (Guayas), a man was shot and killed and his body was found with its hands tied in the Yaguachi River in the Blanca Nieves sector. 1 fatality.

On 31 October 2023, in Pedernales (Manabi), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed an assistant to the Pedernales Attorney of the General Attorney's office while he was driving his car in a drive-by shooting along Mario Cedeno Avenue. The man was driving with a woman passenger, who was not harmed. The victim was shot multiple times. The motivation and identity of the perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 31 October 2023 (as reported), near Quevedo (Los Rios), unidentified perpetrators killed two people and left their bodies in the trunk of a burned vehicle at the Buena Fe-El Empalme section of the ring road around the city. The vehicle was discovered near the military outpost of the N. 26 Cenepa Special Forces unit. The bodies were found charred as a result of the vehicle fire. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 31 October 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), unidentified armed perpetrators traveling on motorcycles attacked and injured two men in a drive-by shooting in the 7 de Marzo sector, El Guayacan parish. The two men were taken to a local hospital. Police suspect that the attack was due to a territorial dispute between criminal gangs, but there is no further information available. Also on 31 October, in Quevedo, unidentified masked men shot and injured two people attending a private birthday party in a drive-by shooting along Los Alamos avenue, in the Galo Plaza sector, 24 de Mayo parish. The victims were a man and a woman. The armed men arrived on two motorcycles and opened fire on the party goers inside a house. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. There were no fatalities.

On 31 October 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), a group of residents captured a male thief that had broken into a local home in the La Legarda sector and whipped him with nettles. The man was turned over to police but was released later on the same day. The residents of the area formed a local emergency group that promised to crack down on criminals in the area. There were no fatalities.

Around 31 October 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of criminal gang members (coded as/likely to be Los Choneros Gang members due to threats made by the group against the victim in previous days) killed a man and left his dismembered body inside various bags along a sidewalk in block 966 of the Guayas y Quil housing cooperative, in the Guasmo Sur sector, Buenos Aires parish. The perpetrators cut the man's body into 6 different parts, leaving behind a head, torso, two arms, and two legs. The victim used to belong to the Los Lagartos Gang. The victim sold brooms and had attempted to erase his tattoo indicating that he was an ex-Lagartos Gang member. 1 fatality.

On 31 October 2023, in El Salitre (Guayas), four armed individuals riding two motorcycles killed two men in a drive-by shooting in the Virgen del Carmen housing cooperative. One of the two men had an unspecified criminal record and died at the site of the attack, while the other died later at a local hospital and had no criminal record. 2 fatalities.

On 31 October 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of armed individuals intercepted, shot and killed two men traveling by car near 318 street and 214 avenue, in the Cuba neighborhood. The armed men were also traveling by vehicle, stopped in front of the victims' car to block their way, after which one stepped out of the vehicle to open fire on the victims. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

On 31 October 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), several unidentified armed individuals in a vehicle abducted a man between Augusto Martinez and Camino al Oriente streets. Authorship and motivations unknown. There were no casualties.

On 31 October 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), unidentified armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed two men with more than 15 gunshots (likely execution) in a drive-by shooting between Leonidas Plaza and Chambers Streets. One of the victims was a pedestrian who was hit by a stray bullet. Authorship and motivations unknown. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: On 31 October 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of armed assailants on motorbikes fired shots at the headquarters of the Esmeraldas Municipal Public Worker's Union and the Provincial Council in a drive-by shooting. This is suspected to be part of a series of extortion-related attacks by criminal groups against the Prefect of Esmeraldas after the public release of her net worth. Authorship and motivations unknown.

On 31 October 2023, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Venecia neighborhood. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 October 2023, in Playas (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting while he walked in the center of the city. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 October 2023, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), at least six unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a man for extortion. Police authorities liberated the victim on 2 November during a police operation in the Batallon del Suburbio sector. During the operation, police detained one suspect. Separately, police forces arrested five other individuals for extortion after police tracked the initial payment of $25,000 that the victim had sent to them.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 1 November 2023, in Guaytacama (Cotopaxi), prisoners captured by force 32 prison guards to keep them as hostages as a demonstration to repudiate the transfer of prisoners from the Machala prison to their prison.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 1 November 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), prisoners who were scheduled to be transferred to another prison by the National Service of Integral Attention to Adults Deprived of their Liberty and Adolescent Offenders (SNAI) captured by force 11 prison guards as a demonstration to demand they remain in the prison.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 1 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), prisoners took control of the Litoral Penitentiary as a demonstration to pressure authorities on the transfers of prisoners from a gang to the prison. They took prison guards as hostages.

On 1 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle chased down and killed a man on a motorcycle in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Primavera 2 neighborhood, near the Ecological Park. 1 fatality.

On 1 November 2023, in Machala (El Oro), various armed individuals approached, shot, and killed a man in the Las Tinas neighborhood. The armed individuals, traveling together in one vehicle, arrived at the home 15 minutes earlier and broke in through the front door, but did not find anyone inside and left. When the man arrived, the same group intercepted him outside and shot him. The man was injured but died shortly after arriving at a local hospital. The identity or motivation of the attackers is unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 1 November 2023, in Ventanas (Los Rios), at least two armed men traveling on motorcycles attacked a family of three in their home in the Bellavista sector, shooting and killing the mother and daughter and leaving the father injured. The perpetrators first opened fire on the family's teenage daughter who was in front of the house, killing her immediately with shots to the head and thorax. The perpetrators fired over 20 times at the house. One of the perpetrators then entered the house and shot the mother of the family, who was injured. Both mother and daughter were the targets of the attack. The perpetrators then left the scene on their motorcycles. The father of the family was injured in the initial attack at the house, as he was hit in the arm while seeking cover. The mother was severely injured and died later at a hospital. The motivation or identity of the perpetrator is unknown. 2 fatalities.

Arrests: On 1 November 2023, in Loja (Loja), a high-ranking Tren de Aragua gang member was arrested by Ecuadorian police forces. The man was wanted in Colombia, Chile, and Peru for various crimes, including grenade attacks on motels in Colombia, and various acts of extortion, abductions, homicides, and armed attacks on civilians in all three countries (unspecified).

On 1 November 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), armed individuals traveling by vehicle shot and killed a male teenager in a drive-by shooting as he walked along Espejo and 17 de Diciembre streets in San Pablo parish. The perpetrators shot the victim multiple times from their vehicle and left a piece of paper next to his body, accusing him of being an information leaker ('sapo', snitch) working for Los Choneros. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 1 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), four armed perpetrators shot and killed a man at a woodworking shop in the Ciudadela Primavera 2 neighborhood. Sources indicate that the attack was intended for someone else, as the perpetrators were chasing a different man who ran past the shop. The perpetrators arrived at the scene in a vehicle and stepped out to chase their target. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 1 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), unidentified armed individuals riding a vehicle killed a male car washer, in a drive-by shooting, as the victim was working at a street corner in the Ciudadela El Recreo neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 1 November 2023, in Daule (Guayas), two armed individuals intercepted, shot, and killed a man while he was riding his motorcycle along San Francisco avenue in the south of the city. The perpetrators were also on a motorcycle and blocked the victim's way on the road, stepping off their motorcycle as they opened fire on him. The man was injured and taken to a hospital, where he died from his wounds. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2021-2023) Prison Guards
notes: On 2 November 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), for a second consecutive day, prisoners who were scheduled to be transferred to another prison by the National Service of Integral Attention to Adults Deprived of their Liberty and Adolescent Offenders (SNAI) continued to keep 11 prison guards as hostages as a demonstration to demand they remain in the prison.

Property destruction: Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), off the Coast of Puerto Baquerizo Moreno (Galapagos), the Ecuadorian navy confiscated 1 ton of cocaine they discovered on a speed boat they intercepted 180 miles (289 kilometers) to the south of San Cristobal island. One other source indicates that half a ton was confiscated instead of 1 ton. Two Ecuadorian nationals were arrested.

Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed at least one person and their dismembered torso and leg were found in the Santa Cruz neighborhood. Police also discovered a dismembered head near Sucre and Homero Lopez streets on the same day. There is no confirmation on whether they belong to the same victim. No further information is available. At least 1 fatality.

Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), in Daule (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a woman her body was found under the old bridge in Benife parish, in the center of the city. She was shot three times in the head and thorax. The woman was killed while she was consuming drugs. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), between Rocafuerte and Manta cantons (coded to Manta, Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot, stabbed, and killed a man and his decapitated body was found along the Rocafuerte-Manta highway. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 2 November 2023, in Puebloviejo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators (coded as/likely criminal gang members) shot and killed a man outside of a tire shop. The perpetrators shot at the victim seven times. The man had been threatened by a local criminal gang since three months before the attack, with the man's face being circulated in a local, anonymous newsletter. Also on 2 November, in Puebloviejo, an unknown number of armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man outside his home in a drive-by shooting along 7 de Febrero and Sucre streets. The victim had been threatened by a criminal gang and his face had been circulated in a local, anonymous newsletter. One male bystander was injured by stray bullets. There is no further information available for both events. 2 fatalities.

Around 2 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of armed perpetrators killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Las Malvinas sector of the city. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 2 November 2023, in Anconcito (Santa Elena), four unidentified armed individuals riding on two motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting as he walked with friends during Day of the Dead festivities in the city. The perpetrators shot at the victim repeatedly. The victim was a well-known local fisherman and had no criminal record. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle intercepted and killed two men in a drive-by shooting in the Cerro Redondo sector. The victims were riding a motorcycle when the perpetrators shot them multiple times. Local witnesses reported that the perpetrators circled the area in a vehicle multiple times waiting for their targets. 2 fatalities.

Around 3 November 2023 (as reported), in Arenillas (El Oro), unidentified armed individuals killed a man and left his dismembered head, with a blindfold on, in a box of bananas along 8 de Septiembre and La Libertad streets. Local residents reported seeing armed men leaving the banana box along the street before speeding away on a vehicle. The armed individuals also left a threatening note. The note threatened members of the Los Lobos and Los Box gangs, stating that anyone who would rob and kill innocent people would find a similar fate as the victim. The armed men later sent a video to the victim's relatives, in which they recorded his beheading. The man was seen with his hands tied as the perpetrators forced him to confess to an unspecified crime before killing him. The remainder of the man's body was discovered on 6 November 2023 in the Colinas de Santa Fe sector. 1 fatality.

On 3 November 2023, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), two armed men shot and killed a man after they intercepted him at the entrance of Clemente Bravo Bay. One of the two armed men got off the motorcycle to shoot the victim. He then got back on the motorcycle and fled in an unknown direction with his accomplice. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 3 November 2023, in El Salitre (Guayas), armed individuals riding on motorcycles attacked a group of people walking along the Vinces River in a drive-by shooting in the Duran Chiquito neighborhood, killing four and injuring one other. The victims, attending a party, were walking onto a bridge crossing the river when they were intercepted by the armed perpetrators, who shot 9 mm bullets and rode away. Four of the victims died at the scene, while the fifth victim was injured critically and taken to a local hospital. Police later reported a motorcycle chase with the same suspects, but were unable to arrest the perpetrators. 4 fatalities.

On 3 November 2023, in Manta (Manabi), two armed men shot at the front of a school building in the Los Gavilanes sector. The two men arrived on a motorcycle, after which one stepped off and opened fire at the school multiple times. There is security footage of the event. There were no students or teachers in the building as it was a holiday, but construction workers were present doing renovations. They were not harmed by the shots. Also on 3 November, in Manta, an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a man as he was sitting outside an auto mechanic shop along 109 street and 109 avenue, in Tarqui parish. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers of both events. 1 fatality.

On 3 November 2023, in Playas (Guayas), two hooded armed men shot and killed an off-duty soldier along Roldos Aguilera and Aurelio Yepez streets in the center of the city. The attackers approached the victim on foot and ran back to their motorcycle after the attack. 1 fatality.

Around 3 November 2023 (as reported), near Valle del Sade (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a person and their mutilated body was found in the Esmeralda river near the Valle del Sade village in the Malimipia parish. The body was discovered without a head, arms, and lower legs. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 3 November 2023, in Rocafuerte (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as hitmen traveling by motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting. The man was a Rioverde municipal administrative worker and served as former president of the Parish Council and former political lieutenant of Rocafuerte. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 3 November 2023 (as reported), near Playas (Guayas), an unknown number of armed perpetrators killed a person and their dismembered body was found along the Playas-Posorja road. There is no further information. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 4 November 2023, in the rural area of Zaruma canton (El Oro), military forces confiscated various explosives used for illegal mining in a control operation near the rural San Antonio and El Calvario sectors. Authorities confiscated 3 drills, 4 drill bits, 1 light motor, 5 blocks of explogel, 2 blocks of ammonium nitrate, 2 half bags of ammonium nitrate, 6 detonating capsules, 17 armed fuminant capsules and 300 meters of fuse slow. There were no arrests.
Around 4 November 2023 (as reported), near Posorja (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators killed a man and his dismembered body was found near the Posorja - El Morro road. 1 fatality.

Around 4 November 2023 (as reported), in Tres Bocas (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed two unidentified persons and their bodies were found, with their hands tied and showing signs of torture, in the Tres Bocas sector bridge along the Perimetral road. The dead bodies were thrown from a moving vehicle. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 4 November 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of armed perpetrators aboard a vehicle attacked a group of people in a drive-by shooting in the El Chaparral football field of the Cuba neighborhood, in the Eloy Alfaro parish, killing one man and injuring four other people. The perpetrators opened fire on the crowd watching the game, causing the spectators and players to disperse. The target of the attack was a man who attempted to run away into a nearby house but was shot by the attackers before entering. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 4 November 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a taxi driver in a drive-by shooting at a taxi stop in the city. The victim was standing at the stop with his brother and various friends when the attackers approached and shot him four times. None of the bystanders were injured. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 4 November 2023, in Santa Ana (Manabi), an unknown number of armed men riding a motorcycle killed a woman in the passenger seat of a Taxi in a drive-by shooting in the Los Malavales neighborhood. The woman was the target of the attack, but the male taxi driver was injured by stray bullets. There is no further information on the motivation or identity of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 4 November 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), a group of unidentified perpetrators armed with assault rifles kidnapped two people and later released them after two hours in the Ucubamba municipal forest park along 24 de Mayo Avenue. The perpetrators physically assaulted the victims and stole part of their vehicle. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

On 4 November 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting near a soccer field in the San Vicente neighborhood. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 4 November 2023, in Banos de Agua Santa (Tungurahua), two unidentified armed individuals wearing hoods killed a Venezuelan woman and injured her two daughters in a shooting at their residence in the El Recreo neighborhood. The attackers shot the mother in the living room, while one daughter was also shot and the other was stabbed. The victims were in a shared residence with other immigrants. Authorities suspect the attack may be linked to drug distribution, but it is unknown whether a criminal gang was involved. One of the daughters died later at a hospital. 2 fatalities.

Around 5 November 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), unidentified perpetrators killed a man and his decapitated head was found in a bag near a gas station near the El Leon roundabout. The man was kidnapped on 4 November by various armed men while he was riding his motorcycle in El Cabezon sector. The identity or motivation of the perpetrators is unknown, but authorities suspect that the attack is related to activity by the Los Lobos or Los Tiguerones gangs, who often commit similar attacks in the south of Esmeraldas. The rest of the man's body is still missing. 1 fatality.

On 5 November 2023, in San Vicente (Manabi), an unknown number of armed perpetrators traveling in a vehicle killed two men in a drive-by shooting outside of a night club in the Santa Martha neighborhood in the Los Perales sector. One of the victims was shot while inside the car he was driving while the other victim was shot outside of the car. Both men were leaving the local nightclub when they were attacked. 2 fatalities.

On 5 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle attacked four men gathered outside of a house in a drive-by shooting along Nicolas Segovia and Claro Jose Blacio streets, killing one and injuring the other three. One of the three injured men was an off-duty police officer. The man who was killed was likely the target of the attack as he attempted to run away from the perpetrators but was chased down and shot at point-blank range. All four victims were initially injured and taken to a local hospital, but the man who was shot at point-blank range died from his wounds. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 5 November 2023, in the rural area of Shumiral parish (Azuay), Ecuadorian military forces confiscated various explosives used for illegal mining in the area. They confiscated 253 explosives, 300 meters of slow fuse, and 5 dynamite blocks armed with ammonium nitrate. Authorities also confiscated various small arms and munitions as well as excavation machinery. Four people were arrested.

On 5 November 2023, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), three armed men riding a motorcycle opened fire on a family in their home in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela San Marcos neighborhood, injuring two men. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

Around 6 November 2023 (as reported), near San Pablo (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a man and his tortured body was found, with his eyes gouged out, on a highway between the towns of San Pablo and San Miguel. The man was an owner of a bar in San Pablo. The body was discovered with a note indicating that he was killed for being a spy/traitor. Police indicate that the method of this attack reflect those used by Mexican and Colombian cartels. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 6 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals riding a motorcycle attacked various people, killing three and injuring one other, at an auto mechanic shop in a drive-by shooting in the 5 de Junio housing cooperative. The armed individuals opened fire over 10 times at an unspecified number of people outside of the shop. One of the victims was the male owner of the shop. Reports indicate that the attackers were targeting a different man who ran into the shop. It is unknown whether the targeted man was among the victims. 3 fatalities.

On 6 November 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a merchant worker along Atahualpa avenue for an extortion fee (express kidnapping). The victim was carrying American dollars to buy merchandise for his boss when he was kidnapped. The boss received a phone call from the kidnappers demanding additional fees be paid for the release of his worker. The victim's motorcycle was discovered later on the same day along Primera Imprentra and Eugenio Espejo avenues. The whereabouts of the victim remain unknown.

On 6 November 2023, in Guayas province (coded to Guayaquil), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped an unspecified number of day laborers. The group of laborers responded to a fake work advertisement through social media, after which they were kidnapped by unknown perpetrators who demanded extortion from their families to release them. The laborers were released two days later. There is no further information available.

On 6 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an active-duty soldier shot and killed a male teenager during a security operation in an area known as Parque de la Mafia in the La Floresta sector. The victim attempted to flee the soldiers, who stated that the victim mimicked drawing a weapon by placing his hands on his waist, prompting a soldier to shoot him in the right shoulder to immobilize him. The teenager was injured but died later at a hospital from his wounds. 1 fatality.

On 7 November 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man driving his car in a drive-by shooting along 309 Street and 215 Avenue, near a school in the San Pedro or San Antonio neighborhood. The man was shot around 8 times and died in the driver's seat of his vehicle. There is no further information available. Also on 7 November 2023, in Manta, an unknown number of unidentified individuals shot and killed a man and injured one other along 323 street of the Jipijapa neighborhood. The victim was driving a vehicle, but had gotten off and attempted to run away from the attackers when he was shot nearly 80 times. Another person was injured by a stray bullet. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 7 November 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed an owner of a paint shop in a drive-by shooting along San Jose Obrero and Colon streets. The male victim was opening his shop when attacked. The shop owner had received various threats in the past related to extortion by an unidentified criminal gang. 1 fatality.

Around 7 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of armed perpetrators killed a man and his body was found, with arms tied, in the back of a car along Galo Plaza street in the Urbasur sector of Guasmo Norte. Witnesses report that unidentified individuals traveling in two cars had arrived at the scene and abandoned one of their vehicles with the victim inside. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 7 November 2023 (as reported), near Playas (Guayas), an unknown number of armed perpetrators killed a person and their decapitated body was found in a package along the road to the port of Aguas Profundas, 5 kilometers from the Playas ring road. The victim's head was located near their feet. Also around 7 November, near Playas, an unknown number of armed perpetrators killed a person and left their body in a bag, without a head and tied at the hand and feet, along kilometer 5 of the Playas-San Antonia road. There is no further information. 2 fatalities.

On 7 November 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two men riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the San Camilo parish of the city. Also 7 November, in Quevedo, an unknown number of armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle attacked a man in a drive-by shooting in the Los Chapulos sector. The man was injured in the shooting and taken to a local hospital, where he died from his wounds. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 7 November 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), a group of Indigenous community members burned a vehicle used by two robbers along the Paso Lateral road toward Pillaro. Earlier, the two robbers assaulted an Indigenous savings cooperative, hitting the clerk and stealing 50,000 USD. The workers of the savings cooperative alerted police and nearby community members, who both gave chase to the robbers as they escaped on two motorcycles while firing shots at the group. Once reaching the Paso Lateral road, the robbers dumped their motorcycles and boarded an escape vehicle waiting for them, which then crashed into an oncoming truck. As police arrested the two robbers, the community members burned the crashed vehicle.

On 7 November 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), four individuals (likely members of Los Tiguerones gang due to pamphlet on the scene) traveling by vehicle fired at the front of a private business (likely there were people inside given the time of the attack) and left their vehicle in front of it, which then detonated as a car bomb. After the explosion, the perpetrators were picked up by some accomplices riding motorcycles and left the scene. Authorities discovered a pamphlet with extortion threats signed by Los Tiguerones Gang near the burning vehicle. There were no casualties.

On 7 November 2023, near Progreso (El Oro), unidentified armed individuals traveling by motorcycle opened fire at the front door of a shop located along the Chaguana River in a drive-by shooting. One of the armed individuals shot at the front door of the building several times. The female shop owner had received various WhatsApp messages threatening her if she did not pay an extortion fee. There were no casualties.

Defusal: On 7 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police authorities confiscated an explosive device in front of a shrimp store placed by an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as extortionists traveling by vehicle. The shrimp store was owned by a prominent reality TV persona that received extortion threats of up to 300 thousand dollars. The same person owned a nightclub in La Garzota sector that was likely targeted by the same individuals who exploded a vehicle in front of it (coded separately).

On 7 November 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators stabbed and killed a man, decapitated him, and set his body on fire in the Barreiro parish within the city. The man was at a car lot owned by the Transit and Mobility Agency (ATM), who had confiscated his vehicle due to a traffic violation. While retrieving his vehicle, the man was kidnapped by various men traveling on motorcycles who entered the lot owned by the ATM. The perpetrators sent threatening messages to the victim's family. The man was likely kidnapped for extortion, but he was only missing for a few hours before his body was discovered. Police arrested six people, including ATM officials, on charges of kidnapping and murder. Police suspect that ATM officials collaborated in the attack. The victim had a criminal record for drugs and weapon possession. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Property destruction: Around 8 November 2023 (as reported), off the Coast of Puerto Baquerizo Moreno (Galapagos), the Ecuadorian navy confiscated 2 tons of cocaine after intercepting two vessels 270 miles (435 kilometers) southeast off the coast of San Cristobal island. The perpetrators sunk one of their two vessels and threw multiple bags of cocaine into the ocean before being intercepted by Ecuadorian authorities. Three Ecuadorian nationals were arrested.

On 8 November 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unknown number of armed perpetrators traveling on motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Medardo Cevallos street, in the Ciudadela Pompilio Galarza neighborhood. The perpetrators shot around 20 times and motivation is unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil
notes: Around 8 November 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Francisco de Orellana (Orellana), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot, tortured, and killed two men and left their half-naked bodies hanging from their necks off the bridge crossing the Payamino River. One victim was Ecuadorian, while the other was a Colombian national. Both men had been arrested on 1 November for stealing a motorcycle. On 7 November the men were kidnapped on their way back from a meeting with their parole officer by unidentified perpetrators who held them for extortion and sent threatening messages to their families. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 8 November 2023, in Daule (Guayas), an unknown number of criminal gang members shot and killed a man in the Ciudadela Los Alamos neighborhood. The victim was shot three times in the head. The attackers uploaded the attack to social media. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Weapons seizure: On 8 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), 815 police officers and military personnel confiscated various arms and munitions after raiding the Litoral Penitentiary. Authorities confiscated five weapons, 4,179 pieces of ammunition, a fragmented explosive grenade, and various other items, such as cellphones, money, and drugs illegally acquired by prisoners. Authorities used an armored vehicle during the raid. This operation was conducted in response to an armed clash that occurred between gangs in the prison on 6 November (coded separately).

On 8 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unidentified armed man (described as a hitman) shot and killed a man in the municipal market in block 2 of the Bastion Popular neighborhood. The perpetrator approached the victim on foot and shot him once in the head. The perpetrator then walked out of the market and fled with an individual waiting on a motorcycle. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 8 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding on a motorcycle (described as hitmen) opened fire on various men in a drive-by shooting in block 2 of the Bastion Popular neighborhood, killing two and injuring one. One of the victims was a father who was shot by a stray bullet. He was walking to pick up his daughter from school. It is unclear whether the other male victim was the target of the attack. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 8 November 2023, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators (described as hitmen) intercepted, shot, and injured a mototaxi driver in the Ciudadela Las Mercedes neighborhood. The perpetrators gave chase to the victim but abandoned their pursuit as he drove toward a police station. They left the scene before police officers could intercept them. There were no fatalities.

On 8 November 2023, in Quito - Tumbaco (Pichincha), a group of local residents burned a motorcycle used by two robbers in the San Juan Alto neighborhood. The robbers had stolen a cellphone from a girl and were escaping on their motorcycle before a driver purposefully crashed into them. The robbers got off their motorcycle in time and escaped on foot. A few residents attempted to catch the robbers but failed. After witnessing the scene, a group of nearby residents gathered around the left-behind motorcycle and set it on fire.

On 8 November 2023, in Petrillo (Guayas), an unknown number of criminal gang members shot and killed a man. The victim was shot five times in the head. The attackers uploaded the attack to social media. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 9 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators riding a motorcycle shot and killed an Albanian man while he was in his parked car in a drive-by shooting near the Luis Vernaza hospital. The man's wife was also in the car but was unharmed. The victim was shot 9 times. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 9 November 2023 (as reported), in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a man and left his decapitated body near the Jambeli point. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News; Machala Movil
notes: On 9 November 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), at least two unidentified armed men riding on two motorcycles killed a former police sergeant in a drive-by shooting in the Los Almendros neighborhood. The victim had retired two months prior and was driving his private vehicle at the time of the attack. He was injured and taken to a local hospital, where he died from his wounds. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 9 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four armed men riding motorcycles, described as hitmen, kidnapped and killed an adolescent male in the El Cerro housing cooperative in the Mapasingue sector. The perpetrators kidnapped the teenager from a market near his home in the Mapasingue sector and took him to El Cerro, where they shot him around 10 times before leaving the scene on their motorcycles. Authorities responded to the kidnapping and later arrested two of the armed men. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 9 November 2023 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators tortured, shot, and killed an unidentified man and his dead body was found on the road behind the Alpino stadium, in the Garzon Chapon sector of El Cambio parish. The man's body was discovered with its hands tied and with a red bag over the head. The body also had bullet wounds to the head. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 9 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), for the second day in a row, police officers and military personnel raided pavilions 1, 10, and 12 of the Litoral Penitentiary and confiscated various arms and munitions from prisoners. Authorities confiscated 430 munitions of different calibers, a firing mechanism used for a rifle, among various other illicit items, like radios. Authorities also confiscated around 1.000 grams of cocaine and marijuana. This operation was conducted in the following days of an armed clash that occurred between gangs in the prison on 6 November (coded separately).

On 10 November 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), neighbors of Ayllon and Bolivar streets captured and beat up a man that had been involved in the robbery of a cellphone. Police officers later rescued the man and took him to a police station.

On 10 November 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), a group of local residents captured and beat two men they caught stealing from a local store and attempted to set them on fire. Police intervened as the mob was dousing the robbers with gasoline. There was a third robber who had escaped being captured by the crowd. There were no fatalities.

On 10 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Garcia Moreno (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed men shot and killed two brothers in a drive-by shooting along Lizardo Garcia and F streets in the Cristo del Consuelo sector. The perpetrators fired around 10 shots. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

On 10 November 2023, near La Esperanza (Los Rios), various unidentified armed individuals opened fire on three men driving a fuel truck as they stopped on the side of a local road, killing one and injuring the other two. The fuel truck driver was accompanied by his brother and a friend while on the job. They stopped at the side of the road to fix a flat tire when the perpetrators attacked them. The driver's brother was shot and killed while the other two were injured. Reports indicate that the perpetrators attempted to steal the truck but left it behind as they could not drive it away. There is no further information on the identity of the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Policia Ecuador
notes: On 10 November 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), at least three unidentified armed individuals (described as members of a criminal group/group of delinquents) traveling by vehicle kidnapped a man in the San Camilo parish for extortion. The perpetrators intercepted the man's vehicle as he drove home with his family, whom they threatened during the kidnapping. The victim was a doctor, and the kidnappers demanded a USD 50,000 extortion fee for his release. The victim was rescued on 14 November 2024 during a police raid in Venus del Rios Quevedo parish. Authorities raided two houses and arrested three or four individuals connected to the kidnapping.

Around 10 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a man while in his vehicle in the Isla Trinitaria Sur sector. Authorities arrested the three perpetrators on 10 November as they transported the victim in his stolen vehicle. Also around 10 November, in Guayaquil, at least two unidentified perpetrators kidnapped two people in the Suburbio neighborhood. Authorities rescued the two victims on 10 November as they were being transported in either one or two vehicles. Authorities arrested one perpetrator and confiscated two vehicles.

Property destruction: On 11 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators (coded as / likely to be criminal gang members) set a car on fire in front of a business in the Bastion Popular neighborhood. There is no further information available, but criminal gangs have set vehicles on fire in similar events in the region to demand extortion fees from local businesses.

Around 11 November 2023 (between 10 - 11 November), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of perpetrators traveling by motorcycle shot and killed a fuel tanker driver while he was working in a drive-by shooting along the E20 Esmeraldas-Quininde highway, in the El Roto-Cube sector. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 11 November 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of criminal gang members set a car on fire near a business along the Perimetral road. This was the same business that was targeted by a remote explosive on 9 November (coded separately). The business owner had received threats from criminal gang members to pay an extortion fee.

On 11 November 2023, in Playas (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed two men who were at the spectator stands of a football field in a drive-by shooting along Jaime Roldos Aguilera avenue. One of the victims died at the stands while the other, who attempted to run away, was shot while running. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 2 fatalities.

On 11 November 2023, in Portoviejo (Manabi), various unidentified armed individuals traveling by vehicle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting at a gas station along 15 de Abril Avenue. The man was working at the gas station at the time of the attack. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 11 November 2023, near Viche (Esmeraldas), three unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle shot and killed a male truck driver in a drive-by shooting along the E20 highway in the El Roto-Cube sector. The victim attempted to drive away from his attackers but was shot while in the driver's seat. The truck crashed into a parked vehicle. There is no further information available on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

Around 11 November 2023 (as reported), in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed and burned a man and his burned body was found along a street in the Santa Rita sector. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 11 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), four Sectel employees were abducted by extorsionists kidnappers (no further info). On 11 November all victims were rescued by the police and two perpetrators were arrested during a raid in the San Francisco neighborhood.

On 11 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (described as hitmen) shot and killed an off-duty serviceman of the Ecuadorian navy along 25 de Julio avenue. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 11 November 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unidentified individual apprehended a man, tied his hands, and set him on fire near the Replica Eugenio Espejo school. The man survived the burning but later died at a hospital from his wounds. Reports indicate that the victim was a drug user. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 12 November 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), more than 30 residents attacked police officers who attempted to search a man that they identified had a gun during a wake in Walter Andrade avenue near the cemetery. The residents attacked the officers and threw rocks at them. One officer was injured.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 12 November 2023, in Saquisili (Cotopaxi), over 2,000 indigenous residents took to the streets as they captured, beat up, and carried out a traditional indigenous justice punishment on a mother and son who were accused of robbing houses. They marched through the city before they punished them as a demonstration to warn criminals in the sector. They also burned the pick-up truck that was used by two of the people that were accused of being robbers.

Weapons seizure: On 12 November 2023, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), the police raided two properties in the Tumbaco and Eugenio Espejo sectors, where they arrested a man and seized 16 firearms, eight magazines, a firearm suppressor, over 2,000 rounds of various calibers, among other items, which were intended to be delivered to different criminal organizations.

Around 12 November 2023 (as reported), in El Cascabel (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed a man and his dead body was found near a farm in the rural Cascabel sector. The victim was shot around 14 times. The man also had an arrest warrant for various undisclosed crimes. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 12 November 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a truck driver while he was refueling at a gas station along the road leading to the Esmeraldas refinery. One of the attackers got off the motorcycle to shoot the victim. There is no further information available on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 12 November 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), four unidentified armed individuals traveling on motorcycles shot and injured a man after entering his home in the San Martin de Porres neighborhood. The perpetrators shot at the man various times, but only hit him once in the leg. The man worked for the Esmeraldas asphalt refinery plant. Reports indicate that a local criminal gang has targeted employees of the same refinery in various attacks to demand extortion fees from the refinery owners. This attack took place after a criminal gang had placed explosives within the property of the plant in the San Mateo parish on 10 November (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

Around 12 November 2023 (between 11 - 12 November), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed three people and left their bodies inside two cars in the Victoria Club housing complex, in the Mucho Lote 2 neighborhood. Reports indicate that residents hear various shots in the night of 11 November. The three bodies were discovered in the morning across three vehicles. One of the vehicles had a body inside and was shot 9 times. The other two victims were in a small vehicle. Reports indicate that they attempted to escape after the first victim was shot, but were chased down and shot themselves. The perpetrators shot around 15 times in total. There is no further information available. 3 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 12 November 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (described as hitmen) shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting along a street in the Santa Lucia neighborhood. The attackers fired 5 times with 9-milimiter caliber weapons. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 12 November 2023, in Quito - Tumbaco (Pichincha), the police raided two properties in the Tumbaco and Eugenio Espejo sectors, where they arrested a man and seized 16 firearms, eight magazines, a firearm suppressor, over 2,000 rounds of various calibers, among other items, which were intended to be delivered to different criminal organizations.

On 12 November 2023, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), at least four armed individuals riding two motorcycles (described as hitmen) shot and killed two men, and injured at least two other men, while they were celebrating a birthday in a drive-by shooting along Vargas Machuca avenue and H street in the Barrio Lindo sector. One of the injured victims later died from his wounds. There is no further information available. 3 fatalities.

Around 13 November 2023 (as reported), near Atahualpa (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed and set a man's body on fire, leaving his body in a burned vehicle along the Ancon - Anconcito road. Authorities indicate that the perpetrators had killed the man before burning his body. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 13 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators killed a man and his dismembered head and foot were found in a white sack in the Assab Bucaram housing cooperative, in Pascuales parish. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 13 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed individuals traveling by vehicle (described as hitmen) killed three people in a drive-by shooting in the Mucho Lote neighborhood. The attackers were chasing down one of the victims, who was attempting to escape from them in a moving vehicle. Two other people, who were driving in a nearby vehicle, were collateral victims. The perpetrators fired at least ten shots. There is no further information available. 3 fatalities.

On 13 November 2023, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a male driver a drive-by shooting along 10 de Agosto and 13 North avenues in the Alborada 2 sector. The man was accompanied by a female passenger, who was injured in the attack. The man was shot various times in the head. Reports indicate that the man was also armed, but it is unclear whether he fired back at the attackers. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 13 November 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), a group of local residents used brooms to beat up a man who was forcefully demanding loaned money from residents in the San Pedro neighborhood, El Cebollar sector. The mob also burned the man's motorcycle. Police arrived to arrest the man. The man was released later on the same day and drove around the neighborhood, threatening the residents who had beaten him. There were no fatalities.

On 13 November 2023, in Loja (Loja), a group of family members of female prisoners gathered outside of the walls of the Loja Social Rehabilitation Center to demonstrate against the transfer of 60 female prisoners from the Santa Martha pavilion to a prison in El Oro. The demonstrators held signs and set some tires on fire outside the prison's walls to demand that the prisoners not be taken far away from their families.

On 13 November 2023, in Coronel Marcelino Mariduena (Guayas), a group of around 200 people captured, beat, killed, and burned the bodies of two men they identified as extortionists. The two men were part of a group of four suspects who shot at a local house to demand extortion money. This caused a large crowd to gather to capture the armed men, who attempted to flee on two motorcycles. The crowd managed to apprehend two of the suspects, who crashed the motorcycle they were on. Four police officers arrived at the scene to disperse the crowd and arrest the suspects, but instead, the crowd beat the officers, doused them with gasoline, and destroyed part of their police car. This group of residents retreated, but another group of residents then grabbed the two men out of the patrol car to beat and kill them and set their bodies on fire. Many in the crowd declared that they were tired of extortionists. 2 fatalities.

Around 13 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least two unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a person. Authorities rescued the person on 14 November and arrested two perpetrators after a police raid in the La Atarazana neighborhood. Authorities also confiscated one stolen vehicle and loose cash.

On 14 November 2023, in Cuenca (Azuay), residents captured, tied up, and beat up a man that was accused of giving out shark loans and an extortionist in the El Cebollar sector. They also burned the motorcycle that belonged to the man. He was later turned to police.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 14 November 2023 (between 13 - 14 November), in Santa Rosa (El Oro), at least three armed individuals traveling by vehicle kidnapped and tortured an off-duty police sergeant in the Calderon neighborhood. The officer was walking into a gym along Loja and Guillermina Unda streets when the perpetrators intercepted him and forced him into their vehicle. Local security footage captured the kidnapping. The officer was discovered alive on 14 November, in El Guabo canton. The victim was found walking naked, with visible marks of violence from blunt objects on his body. There is no further information on the identity or motivation of the perpetrators, but authorities are investigating if the attack is connected to the killing of two other officers from Guayaquil, whose bodies were found in Babahoyo and Petrillo (both coded separately). There were no fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Around 14 November 2023 (between 13 - 14 November), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators tortured and killed two men and left their dead bodies, with hands and feet tied, along the Narcisa de Jesus highway, in front of the Samanes Park. One (or both) of the bodies also had a black sack over its head. Both victims were strangled. Authorities indicate that the victims were likely kidnapped sometime on 13 November and that their bodies were left behind on 14 November by suspects traveling in a pick-up truck. There is no further information available. 2 fatalities.

On 14 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of armed men traveling by vehicle killed two men in a drive-by shooting at a store in the Oramas Gonzalez housing cooperative. The perpetrators intercepted the two victims as they were stepping off their motorcycle and opened fire at least 10 times, killing them instantly. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 14 November 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a Prefecture of Esmeraldas government worker in front of his home along Colon street. The male victim was shot five times as he left his home to go to work. Reports indicate that this attack is related to a long-standing act of extortion from a criminal gang toward the Prefect of Esmeraldas. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

On 14 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an armed man shot and killed a man near the City Mall along Benjamin Carrion Avenue. The victim was walking along the street when the perpetrator approached him and shot him seven times before escaping in a vehicle with an accomplice. 1 fatality.

On 14 November 2023, in Montecristi (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators traveling by vehicle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Tierra Santa sector. The victim was shot at least seven times. Two bystanders were injured in the attack. Authorities later discovered an abandoned and burned vehicle in the Bajos de la Palma sector, which the perpetrators had likely used for the attack. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 14 November 2023 (as reported), in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), national police pulled over a truck and confiscated over three million doses of cocaine hidden in various sacks. The driver was arrested.

Around 14 November 2023 (as reported), in Duran (Guayas), at least two unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a person. Authorities rescued the person on 14 November and arrested two perpetrators after a police raid in the El Arbolito sector.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 14 November 2023, in Pelileo (Tungurahua), hundreds of local residents took to the streets in response to the killing of a police officer during an intervention with criminal gang members on the same day (coded separately). A group of residents attempted to take the arrested suspects from the police car to execute vigilante justice. They also threw rocks at the police to demand that they hand over the arrested suspects. The rioters demanded justice and the expulsion of criminal gangs and foreign nationals, particularly Venezuelans. There were no casualties.

Around 14 November 2023 (as reported), in Pelileo (Tungurahua), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (coded as criminal gang members due to their involvement in weapons trafficking) described as delinquents kidnapped a person. Authorities liberated the person during a police raid on 14 November, where they clashed with at least five perpetrators, arresting them. A police officer was killed in the clash (coded separately).

Around 14 November 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), 13 perpetrators described as suspected Los Choneros gang members kidnapped three male truck drivers from their trucks and held them captive in the Bastion Popular sector. Police authorities liberated the three victims on 14 November during a raid in the same neighborhood in which they arrested the 13 perpetrators and confiscated a pistol, three unfired cartridges, two motorized tricycles, and recovered two stolen trucks.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Around 14 November 2023 (between 13 - 14 November), in Babahoyo (Los Rios), several armed individuals (also described as criminals/delinquents) kidnapped, tortured, and killed an off-duty police officer and left his body in the La Virginia sector, El Salto parish. The body was discovered half-naked and had signs of torture, asphyxiation, and being hit with blunt objects. The officer was kidnapped the previous night on 13 November from his home in the Simon Bolivar canton by armed perpetrators dressed in bullet-proof vests, who broke into his home and dragged him into their vehicle. A narco-message was placed on top of the body that linked the attack to a score settlement by the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG). Reports indicate that the attack was due to the officer stealing money from the gang along with another police officer in Guayaquil, whose body was found in Petrillo (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 15 November 2023, in Aloag (Pichincha), transportation drivers blocked the Aloag - Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas highway with burning tires, rocks and logs as a demonstration to demand more security in the highways by the police. This demonstration was held after three drivers were killed in different provinces during the last week.
On 15 November 2023, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Colorados), residents captured, tied the hands, and beat up a man that had attempted to rob students.

Defusal: Around 15 November 2023 (month of), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants placed an explosive beside the door of a construction materials shop located at Balerio Estacio sector. Police officers came and carried out a controlled explosion successfully. The explosive was left by Los Tiguerones gang members in an attempt to force the shop owner to pay for protection money (extorsion).

On 15 November 2023, in Picoaza (Portoviejo, Manabi), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News
notes: On 15 November 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of perpetrators (described as delinquents) shot and injured a fuel tanker driver while he was working in the El Roto-Cube sector along the E20 Esmeraldas-Quininde highway. Authorship and motivations are unknown. The victim was taken to a hospital, where he was reported to be in stable condition. There were no fatalities.

Around 15 November 2023 (month of), near San Antonio de Pasa (Tungurahua), unidentified perpetrators killed a man and left his body in a plastic bag along the river in the Manzanahuayco-Aguajan sector. The man was reported missing on 3 November 2023. It is unclear whether the man was kidnapped. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 15 November 2023 (as reported), in Daule (Guayas), a man was shot and killed and his dead body was found with its hands tied and with signs of also being beaten. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen and extortionists injured a father and son in a drive-by shooting at a store in the Ciudadela Primavera 2 neighborhood. The perpetrators opened fire four times, hitting the father in the thorax and the son in the leg. The perpetrators are suspected to have opened fire on the store due to extortion. There were no fatalities.

On 15 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), at least two men kidnapped a baby in the Guayas y Quil neighborhood in the Guasmo Sur sector for extortion. The baby and its mother were traveling together in a trimotor when the two perpetrators intercepted them with their own vehicle and forcefully took the baby. Police authorities suspect that the kidnapping was due to extortion, as the father of the baby, who was in prison, received a call demanding money. Police also indicated that multiple perpetrators traveling by vehicle and a trimotor participated in the kidnapping. One of the two kidnappers was killed on 16 November by unknown perpetrators in response to the kidnapping (coded separately). The baby was found on 17 November abandoned in a stroller at the Stella Maris park in the same sector.

Around 15 November 2023 (as reported), near Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators tortured and killed a man and dumped his decapitated body, with hands and feet tied, near a cacao plantation along the Babahoyo-Montalvo road. The victim was reported missing the night of 14 November and his body was discovered the morning of 15 November by a group of agricultural workers. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 16 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), unidentified perpetrators placed an explosive device at the front of a business in the Paraiso de la Flor sector, which did not detonate. Authorities (coded as police forces) retrieved the device and disposed of it safely.

On 16 November 2023, in San Juan (Los Rios), a Venezuelan man was kidnapped and then killed, and his dismembered head was discovered inside a black bag near the entrance to Hacienda San Francisco. The victim's additional body parts were located 400 meters away in a banana plantation. The victim had been kidnapped earlier that same day while traveling to work. Police authorities suspect the killing was related to a dispute between criminal groups. The victim had been kidnapped by an unknown number of unidentified armed men in a pickup truck. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 17 November 2023, off the Coast of Puerto Baquerizo Moreno (Galapagos), the Ecuadorian navy confiscated 122 assault rifles, 48 pistols, and 124 magazines from a package that was thrown away by three men on a speedboat 150 miles (or around 280 kilometers) to the south of San Cristobal island. When they saw authorities, the three men threw the package overboard and managed to escape arrest. Among the 122 assault rifles were AKs, M4s, and R15s. There were no arrests.

On 17 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting on Alberto Spencer Avenue, between the Floresta 1 and Granada neighborhoods. The victim was shot multiple times in the chest. Authorship and motivation unknown for each event. 1 fatality.

On 17 November 2023, in Manta (Manabi), various armed perpetrators (coded as / likely criminal gang members due to past extortion threats) shot and killed a male carpenter in front of his shop along 309 street and 226 avenue in the Ciudadela Circunvalacion neighborhood. According to reports, the victim owed a Colombian national some money, and local residents had seen two armed men circling the area on a motorcycle since the day before. It is unclear whether these two armed men were the same who shot and killed the victim, or if the money owed was due to extortion from a local criminal gang. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 17 November 2023, off the Coast of Manabi province, the Ecuadorian navy confiscated between 1.5 ton and 2 tons of cocaine they discovered on a raft they intercepted 290 miles (460 kilometers) from the coast of Manta. The shipment was headed to Central America, and three Ecuadorian nationals were arrested.

On 17 November 2023, in Puyo (Pastaza), two armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a person. There is security footage of the attack. On 20 November, authorities arrested two men at a hotel in Banos canton for the attack. There is no further information available on the identity or motivation of the attackers. 1 fatality.

On 17 November 2023, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), at least four Los Tiguerones gang members attacked a man in the Pascuales district. The victim was injured and taken to a hospital. Authorities arrested four members of Los Tiguerones gang after the attack. There is no further information available. There were no fatalities.

On 17 November 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man walking home in a drive-by shooting in the 7 de Septiembre neighborhood. Authorities suspect the killing to be connected to gang-related violence. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 November 2023, in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man and injured one other in a drive-by shooting near the Santa Elena market. The perpetrators fired over 20 shots. Both the killed and injured victims had unspecified criminal records. Authorities suspect the killing to be connected to gang-related violence. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 November 2023, in Duran (Guayas), at least two unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen shot and killed two men at the door of the supply center at the Mariana de Jesus food market (Mercado de Viveres) in the El Recreo sector. The perpetrators approached the target on foot and ran toward motorcycles waiting for them at the end of the street to get away after the attack. One of the victims worked as a porter (loader) at the location. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 17 November 2023, in Guayaquil (Guayas), one unidentified armed perpetrator described as a hitman riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting near a gas station at kilometer 11.5 of the road to Daule. The perpetrator used a gun with a silencer. 1 fatality.

On 18 November 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), neighbors of Los Atis avenue captured and beat up two men that had stolen from a woman. The two men had several cuts on their faces, arms and legs. Police officers later rescued the men.

Property destruction: Around 18 November 2023 (weekend of), in Jaramijo (Manabi), Ecuadorian police confiscated close to 4 tons of cocaine during a police raid on a house in the Jaramisol sector. Authorities arrested three criminal gang members, two Ecuadorian nationals and one Colombian, and further confiscated a motorcycle, three vehicles, a jet ski and mobile phones. Different reports indicate that between 3.3 and 4 tons of cocaine were confiscated.
