Around 27 December 2023 (as reported), in the rural area of the Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas municipality (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), a suspected vigilante group killed and burned two suspected cattle thieves and their bodies were found next to two burned-out vehicles on a road. The farm had a warning from a local group directed to those committing crimes in the region, announcing that they will burn criminals who arrive at the area. 2 fatalities.

On 27 December 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed men in a car and a motorbike shot and killed a man with eight gunshots in a drive-by shooting (likely execution) in the Los Geranios neighborhood. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 December 2023, in Playas (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a male municipality worker with eight gunshots in a drive-by shooting (likely execution) in the Los Angelitos neighborhood. The attack motivation might be related to extortion threats the victim was receiving. Authorship unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Al Dia (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 27 December 2023, in Quevedo (Los Rios), four unidentified armed group members abducted a man in the San Camilo neighborhood. The police released the victim unharmed in less than 24 hours. The victim was a local business owner and cousin of the former president of the national assembly. Authorship and motivations unknown.

Around 27 December 2023 (week of), in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), an unknown number of Los Lobos gang members kidnapped a man and held him captive in a house in the Nono neighborhood. Police liberated the victim around 5 January 2024 during an operation in which they also arrested a prominent Los Lobos gang member and seized large sums of money, ammunition of 2.24 caliber bullets, and three high-end vehicles, including a bulletproof car. The Los Lobos gang member arrested was connected with the killing of presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio (coded separately) and suspected of planning a suspected attack on the prosecutor-general of Ecuador.

On 27 December 2023, in Chongon (Guayaquil), two Colombian women selling rice were kidnapped for extortion while selling their product in the area. The perpetrators, three individuals, intercepted and abducted the women in a vehicle, heading toward the southern part of the city. Police rescued the victims hours later near the Tres Bocas area on the Perimetral highway after a pursuit that ended without force. The kidnappers had demanded $2,000 for each victim's release. Three suspects, including two men with criminal records and a woman without prior offenses, were apprehended.

On 27 December 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), various unidentified perpetrators traveling by vehicle kidnapped an Evangelical Christian pastor in the 12 de Octubre neighborhood of La Libertad. The pastor had just concluded a religious service at the time of his kidnapping. The whereabouts of the victim remain unknown.

On 27 December 2023, in La Libertad (Santa Elena), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting between 14 and 15 streets in the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood. The victim was also riding a motorcycle at the time. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 28 December 2023 (as reported), in the Viche parish (Los Rios), three dismembered bodies were found buried in a clandestine grave near the Esmeraldas River. The remains belonged to two men and a woman who had been kidnapped and tortured. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 3 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 December 2023, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a father and his infant son during a funeral mass with over 20 gunshots (likely an execution) inside the Maria Auxiliadora church, in the parroquia Los Esteros. The killing happened eight days after the victim's stepdaughter was shot dead (coded separately). According to the police the victim had a police record and he was the target of the shooting. Authorship and motivations unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 28 December 2023 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), a man was killed and his beheaded body found floating in the Esmeraldas River. Another person was killed and his head found inside a trash bag in a park in the Brisas del Rio sector, parroquia San Mateo. Authorship and motivations unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 28 December 2023, in Daule (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a man with seven gunshots to the head, chest and back in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Marianita Cuatro. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 December 2023, in Posorja (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot at least 10 times and killed a man inside a bus in a drive-by shooting (likely execution) in the Playas-Posorja route. The victim had a police record for robbery in 2021 and his killing was commissioned. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.
Around 28 December 2023 (as reported), in Portoviejo (Manabi), a man was tortured and killed and his body found in the parroquia Leonidas Proano. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 28 December 2023, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators traveling by vehicle shot and killed a man attending a wake in a drive-by shooting in the Eloy Alfaro parish. One other person was shot and injured at the wake. The wake was being held for a man who had been shot and killed two days earlier in the Santa Lucia neighborhood (coded separately). Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 29 December 2023, in Apatug Alto (Tungurahua), Indigenous residents captured and decided to carry out an Indigenous punishment to a man that was accused of robbery. He was beat up with nettle and later taken to a police station. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 29 December 2023, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), suspected Los Tiguerones members set fire to eight parked vehicles in seven sectors in the south and center of the city, completely destroying six of them and damaging the other two. Police authorities suspect that the same group of perpetrators set fire to these vehicles to distract police from an attack they perpetrated in the Bellavista Norte neighborhood (coded separately). There were no casualties.

On 29 December 2023, in Daule (Guayas), various unidentified armed perpetrators traveling on three motorcycles opened fire (drive-by) at the private vehicle of an Ecuadorian Transit Commission (CTE) corporal traveling with his family in the Ciudadela Marianita Cuatro neighborhood. The transit official escaped the attackers by driving into the entrance of a crowded shopping center. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

On 29 December 2023, in La Tola (Esmeraldas), several armed men in a car fired shots at a house during a wake in a drive-by shooting in the Santa Lucia neighborhood. A man sitting in his car was shot and killed. The victim and several other people were watching over a victim who was shot and killed on 26 December (coded separately). Authorship and motivations are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 30 December 2023, in Duran (Guayas), unidentified armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a man sitting inside his work van in a drive-by shooting in the Ciudadela Maldonado. The driver was shot and injured. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 30 December 2023, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), at least four unidentified armed individuals riding two motorcycles killed two off-duty police officers in a drive-by shooting in the 26 de Abril housing cooperative, Guasmo Sur neighborhood, inside a vehicle where the officers were. The officers were taken to hospital but did not survive the injuries. One of the armed individuals, a Venezuelan national, was later apprehended by police. Authorship and motivations are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 30 December 2023, in Arenillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals in a motorbike shot and killed two men with at least 10 gunshots in a drive-by shooting (likely execution) in the parroquia Chacras. Another person was injured. According to the police the killings were related to a settling of scores since at least one of the victims had a police record. 2 fatalities.

On 30 December 2023, in Los Cuatro Mangas (Buena Fe, Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators abducted and killed a male merchant and dumped his body with multiple signs of violence, including head wounds and a gunshot to the leg. The abductors demanded a ransom of $1,000 to release his body. The authorship and motivation remain under investigation. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 30 December 2023, in Manta (Manabi), police forces confiscated 1.3 tons of cocaine during an operation at a private residence. The narcotics were hidden inside jute sacks inside a truck at the residence.

On 30 December 2023, in Pimocha (Los Rios), four unidentified armed men shot and killed a male security guard in the El Porvenir sector. The man worked as a security guard at a brothel and was briefly abducted by the same perpetrators who arrived at the establishment looking for a different target. The perpetrators released the security guard after failing to find their target. The perpetrators returned afterward on two motorcycles and shot the victim five times as he walked up to them. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 December 2023, in Ambato (Tungurahua), pedestrians going through Atahualpa and Ramon Salazar avenues captured and beat up a man that they say had attempted to steal from a woman. Police forces intervened and saved the man, and took him to a hospital, but he refused to go. There were no fatalities.

Around 31 December 2023 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), a man was shot and killed and his dismembered body found inside black plastic bags tied with packing tape between 11th and D streets, in the Cisne 2 sector. Authorship and motivations unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 December 2023, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 12 de Agosto sector. A neighbour was also injured during the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 31 December 2023, in Santa Rosa de Sucumbios (Sucumbios), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed three men who were local mine workers. The victims were targeted while celebrating New Year's Eve. Authorship and motivation unknown. 3 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo
notes: On 1 January 2024, in Duran (Guayas), at least four unidentified armed individuals described as members of an organized criminal group shot and killed five people inside a house in the Ciudadela Abel Gilbert 1 neighborhood. The perpetrators were traveling in a vehicle, but it is unspecified whether they entered the house to shoot the victims or conducted a drive-by shooting. The perpetrators were later arrested on the same day by police after a brief clash in Duran (coded separately). 5 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: On 1 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Garcia Moreno (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed two men while they were bathing in an inflatable pool in a drive-by shooting at the intersection of Guerrero Valenzuela and Oriente streets in the Cristo del Consuelo sector. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 1 January 2024, in Portoviejo (Manabi), four armed individuals traveling on two motorcycles killed a man in a drive-by shooting on San Ignacio Street in the Andres de Vera parish. The victim was outside celebrating the New Year with family and friends when the attackers rode past and opened fire. The victim was shot various times and died at the scene. Another person was shot and injured by a stray bullet and taken to a local hospital. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 1 January 2024, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), two armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Venecia del Mar neighborhood. The victim was outside his home celebrating the New Year with friends and family when the two armed individuals arrived on a motorcycle and fired at him. The victim's family identified one of the attackers by name. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 1 January 2024, in Rocafuerte (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Tabacales sector. The victim was shot various times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Diario (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 2 January 2024, in El Empalme (Guayas), various unidentified armed individuals traveling by truck kidnapped and killed a man. The victim was intercepted while walking with his young son, who was left behind unharmed. Hours later, the victim's dead body was found abandoned and shot over 30 times, mostly in the head, in the Lucia sector of Mocache canton. Authorities suspect that the armed individuals killed the victim elsewhere and placed his body at the location where it was discovered. The victim had a criminal record for weapons possession. Police authorities also suspect that the attackers are members of an unspecified delinquent group from Quevedo that extends their criminal activities to nearby cantons. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

Around 2 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), a person was shot and killed and his dismembered body was found with a sign stating that the same thing would happen to sexual offenders. The number of perpetrators and authorship is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2024, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed three men in the El Caucho sector. The attackers, wearing hoods, arrived on a motorcycle and entered a house where the victims had gathered with friends and family. The attackers shot the victims over ten times before leaving the scene. Police authorities stated that they were investigating whether the attack was in retribution for the killing of a man in the Paraiso sector on 30 December 2023 (coded separately). Authorship and motivation unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 2 January 2024, in San Vicente (Manabi), various unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. The man was inside his home when the perpetrators arrived in a car and stepped out to shoot him before leaving the scene. Later, on 5 January 2024, an unknown number of individuals desecrated the victim's grave at the General Cemetery by digging out his dead body and burning it (coded separately). There is no further information available about whether this was done by the same perpetrators of the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 2 January 2024, in Playas (Guayas), two armed men shot and killed a man. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle and inquired the man on whether his relatives were involved in drug activities. When they did not receive an answer, the perpetrators shot him multiple times. A video circulated on social media attributed the killing to a group called the 'Death Squad' that announced that it was targeting extortionists and thieves. There is no further information available. 1 fatality.

source: El Telegrafo; Esmeraldas News; Machala Movil
notes: On 3 January 2024, near Muisne (Esmeraldas), six unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a male taxi driver for ransom as he worked in the Tres Cruces sector. The victim was abducted after picking up one of the perpetrators, who pretended to be a passenger from the Esmeraldas bus terminal and directed him to drive toward Atacames. On the way there, the victim was intercepted by five other perpetrators in the Tres Cruces area. The perpetrators forcibly blindfolded and restrained the driver, demanding USD 5,000 for his release and an additional USD 10,000 for the vehicle. They also sent a threatening video to the victim's family. Police forces liberated the victim on 4 January. The victim identified one of the perpetrators, who was subsequently arrested.

On 4 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a teenage boy in a drive-by shooting in the Nueva Esperanza Norte neighborhood, near the Esmeraldas River. The victim died at the scene after being struck by various bullets. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 4 January 2024 (as reported), in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), around five unidentified individuals kidnapped a male taxi driver for extortion. They sent the victim's family members threatening videos demanding USD 5,000 for the taxi driver and USD 10,000 for the taxi. Police authorities liberated the victim on 4 January during a police operation in which they also arrested one perpetrator.

On 4 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed an elderly man in a drive-by shooting while he was walking with his wife along 25 de Julio Avenue, near the Nueva Guayaquil housing cooperative. The attackers shot the victim at least five times. Police authorities released preliminary reports in which they suspect that the attack might be linked to a robbery, but sources indicate that no attempted theft took place. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals killed a man in a riding a motorcycle near the main bridge of the Divino Nino neighborhood. Police authorities discovered a burned and abandoned vehicle nearby, which they suspected was used by the perpetrators during the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2024, in Naranjal (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a teenage boy in a drive-by shooting at a motorcycle repair shop in the Cristo del Consuelo neighborhood. The victim attempted to flee but was shot various times, including in the head and chest, and died at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 4 January 2024, in Puerto Bolivar (El Oro), a group of local residents physically confronted police officers who were conducting a police operation in the El Pampon sector. The officers approached to check a group of individuals in the area, who fled immediately. One of the individuals was caught by police and was arrested for possessing USD $355 in cash. At this point, local residents intervened in an attempt to prevent the arrest, leading to a confrontation with the police. Police officers dispersed the crowd and detained the individual, who was later released.

On 4 January 2024, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators (likely gang members due to the later decapitation of the victim) kidnapped a man. The perpetrators were traveling in a vehicle. The victim's family reported that the victim had been kidnapped for five hours over a month prior (unspecified) but refused to identify the perpetrators. The victim was later killed, and his decapitated body was discovered on 9 January 2024 (coded separately).

Defusal: On 5 January 2024, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), police forces removed an explosive device from a former police officer's house in the Antonio Almeida and Eugenio de Santa Cruz intersection, La Marin sector. The device was delivered by unidentified suspects. There were no fatalities.

On 5 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals (likely traveling by vehicle due to the circumstance of the event) killed a man driving his vehicle in a drive-by shooting in the Union de Bananeros neighborhood. The victim tried to flee the attackers by stepping out of his vehicle on foot, but was shot around 10 times and died at the scene. The victim had a criminal record for homicide and robbery. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Defusal: On 5 January 2024, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), police forces safely removed and destroyed an unspecified explosive device in the La Marin sector. Residents and local business owners were alarmed by a suspicious package and called police authorities. Police authorities did not give information on the type of explosive. There is no further information available.

Property destruction: On 5 January 2024, in San Vicente (Manabi), an unknown number of perpetrators vandalized a grave at a local cemetery and exhumed and set fire to the body of a man who was killed by a group of unidentified armed men on 2 January (coded separately). There is no further information available.

On 5 January 2024, in Ventanas (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen/criminals riding two motorcycles killed two men and injured four others in a drive-by shooting at an auto repair shop near Ignacio Ibarra and Pacifico Gordillo streets. The target of the attack was likely the shop owner as he was shot fifteen times. The other killed victim was a customer at the shop and was shot five times. The four injured men were also customers at the shop. The perpetrators fled the scene after the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Policia Ecuador
notes: Around 5 January 2024 (as reported), near Febres Cordero (Los Rios), two women were sexually assaulted, tortured, and killed, and their dead bodies were found near a cacao farm in the La Teresa sector. The victims had been reported missing on 3 January after they each left their respective homes, and they were discovered in separate graves on 5 January. One woman had been decapitated, while the other one, who was eight weeks pregnant, had been slashed in the throat. In response, police forces raided four properties in the La Ventura sector and arrested three adults and a minor suspected of being involved in the crime. Authorities also confiscated two knives, two guns, and four motorcycles. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 5 January 2024, in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), police authorities arrested a prominent Los Lobos gang leader in the El Condado neighborhood. He was also a suspected organizer of the assassination of presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio the year before (coded separately). The gang leader escaped with 32 other convicts on 8 January from Riobamba prison during prison riots (coded separately).

On 5 January 2024, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Nuevo Quininde sector. The attackers approached the victim while he was on the street with friends and fired seven shots, several of which hit the victim. The victim was later pronounced dead at the hospital due to his injuries. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.
On 6 January 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), residents of Siete de Octubre parish captured and beat up a couple who were accused of robbery in the sector. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 6 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants set a bus on fire in the Assad Bucaram sector, Pascuales parish. Police forces suspect the attack was linked with intimidations from extortionists groups.

On 6 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects described as delinquents / hitmen traveling in two cars shot and killed an off-duty police officer in a drive-by shooting in the intersection of 25 de Julio and Ernesto Alban Avenues. The officer was taken to hospital, where he died from his wounds. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 6 January 2024, in Duran (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed three women and one man in a drive-by shooting in the Los Helechos sector. The victims were inside a vehicle when the perpetrators arrived on their motorcycle and fired at them. A baby was also in the vehicle but was not harmed. Witnesses stated that the victims had been conversing inside the vehicle for about an hour before the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. 4 fatalities.

On 6 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), four unidentified armed men shot and killed a man walking on the street. Two of the armed individuals chased down the victim on foot to shoot and kill him, while two other armed individuals followed them on a motorcycle and shot the victim while he was laying on the ground. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 6 January 2024, in Milagro (Guayas), a group of residents captured and beat a suspected thief and forced him to march on the street while riding behind him on motorcycles. The man was forced to walk with a sign labeling him a criminal.

On 6 January 2024, in Playas (Guayas), four unidentified armed men shot and killed a man who was a teenager inside a supermarket on Zenon Macias Avenue. The perpetrators arrived on two motorcycles and entered the supermarket to find the victim, whom they shot and killed inside. The assailants fled immediately. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil
notes: Around 6 January 2024 (between 5 - 6 January), in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), at least nine unidentified perpetrators kidnapped for extortion and then killed a prominent businessman and left his body in the Chapingo area. The victim had been kidnapped on 5 January. The perpetrators had initially asked for a large amount of money for the release of the victim, which was not paid. Police authorities arrested nine male suspects, including a minor, involved in the kidnapping and killing of the victim during a series of raids on 7 January. Police also seized two vehicles, five motorcycles, and other items as evidence. 1 fatality.

On 6 January 2024, in San Vicente (Manabi), two armed men described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed two men and injured two others as they were playing cards outside a local business in a drive-by shooting on Humberto Garcia and Juan Montalvo streets. The attackers fled the scene immediately. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 6 January 2024 (as reported), in the rural area of Zaruma canton (El Oro), military forces seized a large quantity of illegal mining materials during a raid in a mining camp. Authorities confiscated 6,262 sticks of ammonium nitrate, 1,150 meters of detonating cord, 300 ordinary capsules, and 23 sacks of ammonium nitrate. The operation was part of ongoing efforts to combat illegal mining in the region.

On 6 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of perpetrators kidnapped a woman for extortion. Police authorities indicated that the perpetrators demanded an unspecified large sum of money for the liberation of the victim. Police forces liberated the victim around 12 January in the Portete sector during a raid in which they also arrested one perpetrator.

Around 6 January 2024 (as reported), in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), four unidentified perpetrators traveling by car kidnapped a male veterinarian who was driving his vehicle along Quevedo Avenue as he was working. The victim was entering an agricultural ranch (likely to perform veterinary work) when he was intercepted by the perpetrators. Police authorities liberated the victim on 6 January during a raid in which they arrested two perpetrators in the Montesdeoca sector of Santo Domingo. It is not specified whether the perpetrators were criminal gang members.

On 7 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a former professional football player in a drive-by shooting. The assailants shot the victim various times. Police authorities suspect that the attack may be a drug-related settling of scores. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed the former president of the Fuerza Amarilla football club in a drive-by shooting in the Las Brisas sector. The attack occurred as the victim was entering an evangelical church. The perpetrators shot at the victim eight times, with at least five bullets at him. The victim previously ran for mayor in Machala and was currently working as a mining, banana, and shrimp entrepreneur. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 January 2024, in Pedernales (Manabi), at least one unidentified perpetrator kidnapped a man for ransom. Police authorities liberated the victim on 10 January 2024 during a raid in which they also arrested one perpetrator and confiscated a gun and illicit drugs.

On 7 January 2024, in El Naranjo (Manabi), two unidentified armed men described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed a male minor in a drive-by shooting along the Portoviejo-Santa Ana road. The attackers caught up to him as he attempted to run away from them and fired multiple shots, leaving the victim dead on the road. The assailants fled the scene. The authorship and motivation are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 7 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two unidentified individuals dressed up as transit officers kidnapped a transport truck driver as he was working in the Puerto Trinitaria sector. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown.

On 7 January 2024, in Santa Maria (Manabi), two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting along Luis Maria Pinto Avenue. The victim was shot at least seven times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 7 January 2024 (as reported), near Simon Bolivar (Guayas), a man was killed and his decapitated body was discovered in a ditch in the Gran Colombia area. The victim had been kidnapped after leaving his home on a motorcycle on 4 January in Babahoyo, Los Rios. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Other: On 8 January 2024, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), President Daniel Noboa signed a presidential decree 110 to implement an emergency state for 60 days to allow police and military officers to intervene in the control of prisons that were taken by force by prisoners around the country. The emergency state also implemented a curfew from 11 pm to 5 am in all the country.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 8 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), prisoners at El Oro No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held around 16 prison guards hostage to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
notes: On 8 January 2024, in San Luis (Chimborazo), prisoners took control of the Riobamba prison after the Prisoners Integral Attention National Service (SNAI) announced the transfer of another prisoner, who is a gang leader. The prisoners captured prison guards and held them as hostages. During this, a car was blown up in Mexico and Pichincha Avenues intersection. Thirty-two prisoners escaped and were recaptured later after military officers intervened.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 8 January 2024, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), prisoners of the Inca prison took control of the prison to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. The prisoners set fire to a mattress and caused a fire within the establishment. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Interception: On 8 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police officers captured two assailants who had an explosive artifact at Jaime Roldos avenue near the Military Infantry Battalion. The assailants attempted to throw the explosive to the station from a car, but were discovered by officers and threw it to an empty lot. They were able to control it and arrested the two assailants. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros, a gang involved with The Sinaloa cartel of Mexico, escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Policia Ecuador; Primicias
notes: Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants described as delinquents set fire to a car in a gas station at the Y de Vuelta Larga sector. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Policia Ecuador; Primicias
notes: Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Tonsupa (Esmeraldas), unidentified assailants described as delinquents set fire to a car at a fuel deposit area of a gas station. Workers at the gas station extinguished the fire. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; Ecuavisa; El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), two men described as suspected criminal gang members abandoned and set a car on fire at a gas station in the San Luis de Chillogallo sector. The vehicle had two cooking gas cylinders inside it that would explode when lit, but local witnesses put out the fire before the cylinders exploded and called the police. Police authorities suspect that the two individuals were criminal gang members threatening local businesses. The two perpetrators then likely left the scene on a motorcycle. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Interception: On 8 January 2024, in Loja (Loja), police officers captured four assailants on motorcycles that were using dynamite to explode cars in Daniel Alvarez, Tebaida and Consacola sectors, and arrested them with marihuana and other objects. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros, a gang involved with The Sinaloa cartel of Mexico, escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

On 8 January 2024, in Cuenca (Azuay), unidentified assailants threw an explosive at a military truck. The artifact exploded before it hit the truck, and no one was injured and no damages were registered. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There were no casualties.

Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Gualaceo (Azuay), unidentified assailants set a local government car on fire. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Azogues (Canar), unidentified assailants set a new car-transport truck on fire while it was on the Cuenca - Azogues highway. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

On 8 January 2024, in Puebloviejo (Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants shot and killed a transgender person outside her house at Puerto Pechiche parish, while they were on a motorcycle (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 8 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified suspects described as delinquents threw an explosive device at the sub-zonal police command of Esmeraldas. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There were no casualties.

Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Santa Rosa (Santa Rosa), unidentified assailants set three vehicles on fire. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, near El Empalme (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set two cars on fire on Macul Road. There is no further information available. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

source: Ecuavisa; El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Movement of forces: Around 8 January 2024 (from 7 - 8 January), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), hundreds of military personnel and police officers conducted a large-scale operation at the Regional Prison of Guayaquil following the disappearance of the leader of the Los Choneros Gang in the prison on 7 January. Military and police personnel entered the prison with military vehicles, patrol cars, and ambulances. Police authorities did not discover the escaped gang leader after an extensive search in the prison.

On 8 January 2024, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two people were shot and killed and their bodies burned in the Pueblo de Nuevo parish. Each victim had multiple gunshot wounds, with local witnesses reporting hearing over 15 shots. The victims were killed the same night their bodies were discovered in the area. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

Defusal: On 8 January 2024, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), police forces deactivated an explosive artifact outside the premises of the El Inca prison after inmates took control of the prison to prevent gang leaders to be transferred to another prisons. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 8 January 2024, in Puyango (Loja), an unknown number of unidentified suspects set cars on fire (unspecified number). This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang and other gang leaders escaped from prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There were no fatalities.

Looting: On 8 January 2024, on the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as pirates pursued two fishermen 40 nautical miles off the coast of Esmeraldas, stealing the motors off their boat and leaving them stranded in the water. The fishermen drifted for three days before they were found and rescued by other fishers near Muisne, Esmeraldas.

On 8 January 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), two men were killed and their dismembered bodies were found in the Cruz Maria sector of San Camilo parish. One of the two victims was identified as a man who had been abducted on the same day. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.

Around 8 January 2024 (as reported), in Quevedo (Los Rios), at least seven perpetrators described as criminal gang members and extortionists kidnapped a man for ransom. Police authorities confirmed on 8 January that they arrested seven individuals for the kidnapping and liberated the victim. The seven perpetrators were also linked with the nine perpetrators arrested for the kidnapping and killing of a businessman for ransom in San Jacinto de Buena Fe around 6 January 2024 (coded separately).

Interception: On 8 January 2024, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), police arrested two unidentified men as they were trying to place an explosive device at the Communitarian Police Unit (UPC) in the San Martin neighborhood. Police confiscated 16 sticks of dynamite, a firearm, and mobile telephones. The same perpetrators likely also set fire to a motorcycle parked near the station.

On 9 January 2024, in Quito - Eloy Alfaro (Pichincha), around 300 residents of La Escalinata, in Chilibulo sector, captured, tied to a post, beat up, and killed a man who had been accused of committing a crime. Police officers came and took the body. 1 fatality.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Other: On 9 January 2024, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), President Daniel Noboa signed a presidential decree 111 that catalogues 22 criminal groups as terrorists, according to the decree, recognizes the existence of an internal armed conflict and allows the mobilization and intervention of the armed and police forces to execute operations to eliminate such groups. This was carried out after armed assailants took control of a tv station live (coded separately). This happened after president Daniel Noboa implemented an emergency state to allow police and military officers to intervene in the control of prisons that were taken by force by prisoners around the country.

On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), members of the Los Tiguerones gang broke into the TC and Gamavision television offices and took control of the tv broadcasting rooms by force. They kept the journalists and workers as hostages for several hours. Police officers intervened for the release of the hostages, arrested 13 members, and seized firearms and explosive devices. At least five other people, among them some minors, were also apprehended near the premises of the attack with a suspected car bomb. Two workers suffered minor injuries. This happened after Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.
On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants threw a grenade at an ATM and destroyed it in the Isla Trinitaria sector. There were no casualties.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), four unidentified assailants on two motorcycles sprayed a public school bus with a liquid and then set it on fire with an incendiary object in the Isla Trinitaria sector. The flames consumed two other cars near the bus. This attack took place in the context of multiple prison riots and assaults across the country, during which the Los Choneros gang leader escaped from prison and the declaration of a state of emergency by President Daniel Noboa.

Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), unidentified assailants set two motorcycles and two cars on fire around the city. They also damaged the infrastructure of a Communitarian Police Unit (UPC) with an explosive. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros, escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

source: El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants burned a car with three people inside at the 22 de Abril housing cooperative in Isla Trinitaria sector. The civilians were tied up and had been tortured according to the police. All of them died. There is no further information available. 3 fatalities.

On 9 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), unidentified assailants threw gasoline and set fire to a car that had stopped at a traffic light, burning and killing the male driver who was inside it. The victim was a spokesperson for the Esmeraldas Narcotics Anonymous (NA) program. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), unidentified assailants threw a grenade to the Tenguel parish Communitarian Police Unit (UPC) offices. Infrastructure and the windows were destroyed, but no one was injured. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There were no casualties.

Looting: On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants looted commercial establishments in the Malvinas, Huancavilca, and Guangala sectors. This attack took place during the different assaults committed in the country after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Interception: On 9 January 2024, in Quito district (Pichincha), police forces arrested a suspect with a GLP explosive device in a car in the south part of the city. This took place during the different assaults committed after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified suspects abducted four people from the Nueva Prosperina district, two of whom were for extortion. Two victims were later released. For the other two, the kidnappers were demanding ransom payments to release them. Police forces rescued the two remaining victims a day later in the Trinidad de Dios neighborhood. The four suspects were arrested, and three of them had unspecified criminal records.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil
notes: On 9 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), for the second day in a row, prisoners at El Oro No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held around 16 prison guards hostage to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas) an unknown number of unidentified, masked individuals set fire to at least six parked vehicles across various locations in the city, including one near Mexico and Mejia streets, one in the Codesa sector, one in the 15 de Marzo neighborhood, and another near the Delfina Torres de Concha Hospital. The assailants used gasoline to ignite the vehicles. There is no other information available on the two remaining burned vehicles. Another vehicle was set on fire by a Grenade around the same time near Aire Libre Square (coded separately). This incident occurred amidst a national state of emergency declared by President Daniel Noboa to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police and military forces burned down a hideout used by the Los Tiguerones gang in the La Guacharaca sector. This action is part of a broader strategy announced by President Daniel Noboa to eliminate gang hideouts.

On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), 15 unidentified perpetrators dressed as police officers kidnapped a man and his sons. Police authorities liberated the victims on 10 January 2024 during a police operation in which they apprehended the 15 perpetrators. Sources differ on whether the man was kidnapped with one or two of his sons.

On 9 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants threw an explosive device at a house in the Ciudadela El Fortin neighborhood, causing an explosion that put a hole in the roof and damaged belongings inside the house. The residents of the house were likely inside due to the time of day in which the attack took place. Authorship and motivation unknown.

Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set a car on fire on the La Primavera road, near the local gas station. Also on 9 January 2024, in Machala, an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set a taxi on fire on La Ferroviaria Avenue, near the Velasco Ibarra Health Center. It is unspecified whether the taxi was in use at the time. Finally, on the same day, in Machala, an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set a public bus on fire near the Zoila Ugarte Park. A few hours later, another public bus was set on fire in the Venezuela neighborhood. It is unspecified whether the bus was in use at the time. These events took place in the context of a declaration of a state of emergency by President Daniel Noboa to fight organized crime. Authorship and motivation unknown.

Around 9 January 2024 (between 8 - 9 January), near Pueblo Nuevo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators shot, tortured, killed two men and left their dead bodies near the Portoviejo-Pueblo Nuevo Road, close to the El Gramal service station. The bodies were found on a plot of land used for soil extraction. The victims were likely killed within 24 hours of being discovered, as local witnesses reported hearing multiple gunshots the night of 8 January 2024 and discovered the bodies upon investigation. Authorship and motivation are unknown. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
notes: Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Santa Rosa (El Oro), two unidentified individuals on a motorcycle set fire to a vehicle outside a house in the Virgen de Chilla area. The attack occurred around 3:30 AM. The perpetrators threw an incendiary object at the car, causing it to blaze. Authorship and motivation unknown. Also on 9 January, in Santa Rosa, an unidentified number of individuals set fire to the vehicle of a prison guard at her home in the Atahualpa neighborhood. The attack happened in the early morning hours, and the guard discovered her car burning after hearing a noise. Finally, on the same day in Santa Rosa, an unidentified number of individuals caused damage to a vehicle in the La Embotelladora sector. This took place in the context of a state of emergency declared by President Daniel Noboa to fight organized crime. Authorship and motivation unknown.

On 9 January 2024, in San Luis (Chimborazo), a group of prisoners kept control over the local prison facility after a riot was carried out the day before (coded separately). During the continuation of the riot 38 prisoners, including a leader of the Los Lobos gang, escaped the facility. There were no fatalities.

On 9 January 2024, in Huaquillas (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified individuals threw an explosive device at the Police Command located on La Republica Avenue. The explosion caused damage to the building's windows. This incident is part of a series of violent events following the national state of emergency declared by President Noboa. Police officials were likely present in the building given the time of the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators riding a motorcycle set fire to a vehicle parked in front of a butcher shop near 12 and June Guzman avenues. The perpetrators threw an incendiary device at the vehicle to set it on fire. The butcher shop owners were likely the targets of the incendiary attack as they lived in the same building the vehicle was parked. Around the same time, unspecified arson attacks also occurred in the area of the Brasil de la Galo Plaza.
Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, near Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators set fire to a taxi on the Quevedo Ring Road (Paso Lateral).
Property destruction: Around 9 January 2024 (between 8 - 9 January), in Catamayo (Loja), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set fire to two vehicles parked at the Central Park.

This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 9 January 2024, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set two vehicles on fire in the Nuevo Quininde neighborhood. There is no further information available. This incident occurred amidst a national state of emergency declared by President Daniel Noboa to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
notes: On 9 January 2024, in Archidona (Napo), for the second day in a row, prisoners at Archidona No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held around 9 prison guards hostage to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Defusal: On 9 January 2024, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), police authorities confiscated two gas cylinders, a fuel canister, and a stick of dynamite found inside an abandoned taxi serving as a car bomb near a store on Susana Letor Street and Maldonado Avenue, in El Conde neighborhood. The taxi driver reported that he been intercepted by two unidentified individuals who had robbed his vehicle. There is no further information on the identity of perpetrators.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Telegrafo
notes: On 10 January 2024, in Ambato (Tungurahua), for the third day in a row, prisoners at the Tungurahua No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held 15 prison guards hostage to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil
notes: On 10 January 2024, in Cuenca (Azuay), for the third day in a row, at least 30 prisoners at Turi prison (Azuay No. 1 prison) blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held between 45 and 89 people hostage, including around 45 prison guards, to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. Sources differ on the number of people held hostage within the facility. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 10 January 2024, in Cuenca (Azuay), unidentified assailants threw gasoline on a car and set it on fire in Narancay sector. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros, a gang involved with The Sinaloa cartel of Mexico, escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Property destruction: On 10 January 2024, in Pasaje de las Nieves (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified assailants set five cars on fire around the city. Armed individuals set a vehicle on fire on the La Cocha bridge on the Pasaje-Quera route. Firefighters and police arrived to extinguish the blaze. Simultaneously, another vehicle was burned in the Banco de la Vivienda neighborhood, and a third vehicle was incinerated at the Bella India interchange. All three incidents caused traffic disruptions until the fires were controlled. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There is no further information on the two other vehicles burned.

Property destruction: On 10 January 2024, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), two unidentified assailants set a car on fire in the intersection of Las Higueras and Eloy Alfaro streets, Monteserrin sector in the north part of the city. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There were no fatalities.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 10 January 2024, in Puerto Francisco de Orellana (Orellana), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as criminals set fire to and caused an explosion at El Coca night club, resulting in two or three people being killed and up to 11 injured. Reports differ on whether the perpetrators only set fire to the building or also placed an explosive device. Police suspect the attack was linked with gang members. At least 2 fatalities.

Interception: On 10 January 2024, near San Miguel de Ibarra (Imbabura), police forces intercepted seven suspected members of Los Lobos gang who were carrying dynamite in a pick-up truck accompanied by two motorcycles traveling along the road to Urcuqui. Police authorities also gathered information on the location of two car bombs filled with dynamite and gas bottles in the Imbaya sector (coded separately). Four of the Los Lobos gang members were Ecuadorian nationals while the other three were unspecified foreign nationals. The suspects were arrested after President Daniel Noboa declared the internal armed conflict state and over 300 suspected gang members were arrested in different operations.

Property destruction: On 10 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified assailants set public transport bus on fire. This attack took place during the different assaults committed in the country after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil
notes: On 10 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), during the third day in which they took control of the prison, prisoners at El Oro No. 1 prison hanged a prisoner to death, wrapped his body in plastic, and dumped his body outside the prison. The prisoners released a video online of a prison guard being hanged, but the victim was later confirmed to be another prisoner on 11 January after the prisoners dumped his dead body outside the prison wrapped in plastic and with the noose around his neck. This took place in the context of a riot in which the prisoners took control of the prison and held around 16 prison guards hostage to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. 1 fatality.

On 10 January 2024, in Cuenca (Azuay), a mob of local residents caught and beat two men they suspected of attempting to rob a house. The residents subdued the suspects and began beating them, but police intervened before they could be lynched. The two suspects denied any involvement in criminal activity, but the locals claimed they acted to prevent a crime. There were no fatalities.

Around 10 January 2024 (as reported), near Ventanas (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified heavily armed men kidnapped two people on the road to Encheandia for extortion. They were liberated on 10 January in Ventanas by police authorities.

This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Interception: On 10 January 2024, near Imbaya (Imbabura), police intercepted two car bombs belonging to Los Lobos gang members on the rural road to Hoja Blanca (Ibarra - San Lorenzo road). Both vehicles had gas tanks inside connected to 13 and 16 industrially manufactured high-power explosives, respectively. Police authorities suspected that the gang members were intending to detonate the car bombs in San Miguel de Ibarra. Police authorities learned of the car bombs after intercepting and arresting seven Los Lobos gang members near San Miguel de Ibarra earlier in the day (coded separately).

Property destruction: On 10 January 2024, in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators set fire to a car in the Mena de Hierro sector. There is no further information available.

Around 10 January 2024 (as reported), in San Miguel de Ibarra (Imbabura), police forces and military forces arrested a Los Lobos gang leader during a raid on his house. Police authorities also discovered and confiscated a gun and sticks of dynamite with a slow fuse inside the house. There is no further information available. Also around 10 January, in San Miguel de Ibarra, police and military forces arrested a Los Lobos gang member, a national of the Dominican Republic, and confiscated six sticks of dynamite and slow fuses among other small weapons and illicit substances.

Defusal: On 10 January 2024, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), police forces deactivated an unspecified explosive device found inside a car parked behind the Inca prison. Two unidentified individuals riding a motorcycle placed an explosive device inside the vehicle and set it on fire. The owners of the vehicle put out the fire and called police authorities when they discovered the explosives inside it. This is in the context of inmates taking control of El Inca prison on 8 January to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards

Sources differ on the number of people held hostage within the facility. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Defusal: On 11 January 2024, in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), police forces removed and destroyed an explosive device in the Turubamba neighborhood, south part of the city, in the surroundings of the former civil registry building. Locals alerted the police of the presence of a suspicious package. The type of explosive device was not detailed. Additionally, police forces carried out a controlled explosion of an explosive device found under Guajalo bridge on Moran Valverde Avenue, in the south part of the city. Police authorities revealed that the explosive was a home-made artifact detonated by a match, which was set on fire but did not burn fully, resulting in it not detonating. Police authorities further suspect that the explosion would have caused damage in a 50-meter radius.

notes: On 11 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), for the fourth day in a row, prisoners at El Oro No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held around 16 prison guards hostage to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. The prisoners dumped a body in front of the prison of an inmate killed the day before (coded separately). This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

On 11 January 2024, in Ambato (Tungurahua), two unidentified armed individuals shot and injured a man in Sucre Park. The victim was injured in the foot and hospitalized. Police authorities did not report a robbery. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no fatalities.

Around 11 January 2024 (as reported), in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators tortured, shot, and killed a woman and left her dead body outside in the 5 de Junio housing cooperative. The victim's body was wrapped in packing tape, and her mouth was gagged with a cloth. The perpetrators shot the woman five times in the head, torso, and limbs. Witness reports indicate that the perpetrators brought the woman to the location on a motorcycle and shot her once more in the back of the head, killing her, before leaving the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Around 11 January 2024 (as reported), in Duran (Guayas), a man was killed and his dead body was found wrapped in plastic near an abandoned house in the San Gregorio sector. The body was wrapped with plastic bags tied with a cord and white cable. Police authorities are investigating whether the perpetrators were the same that killed a person and left their dismembered body on the same day on the Duran-Tambo highway (coded separately). The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 11 January 2024 (as reported), near Duran (Guayas), a person was killed and their dismembered body was found in plastic bags on kilometer 14 of the Duran-Tambo highway. Police authorities are investigating whether the perpetrators were the same that killed a person and left their body wrapped in plastic on the same day in Duran (coded separately). The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Esmeraldas News
notes: Weapons seizure: On 11 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), police forces arrested a suspected Los Lobos gang member and confiscated 76 rifle rounds, 72 explosive cartridges, and a stolen motorcycle during a raid on a house in the Puerto Limon sector. Authorities suspect that the house served as a weapons stockpile for planned attacks in the province. The operation was conducted as part of the national state of emergency declared by President Noboa.

Property destruction: On 11 January 2024, in the rural area of Mejia canton (coded to Machachi, Pichincha), police forces intercepted gold ore being transported by an unknown number of individuals, described as members of a delinquent group linked to the Los Lobos gang, who were transporting gold ore valued at USD 3 million that they extracted from illegal mines in Buenos Aires, Imbabura. The gold was being moved in two trucks, escorted by other vehicles that fled upon seeing police. Police authorities suspect the gold was intended for illegal sale to fund arms purchases and criminal activities.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Property destruction: On 12 January 2024, on the Coast of Manta (Manabi), police and military forces confiscated around 1.5 tons of cocaine being transported by boat between 200 and 250 miles off the coast of Manta and arrested 21 or 22 suspected members of a criminal armed group. The drugs were found on a main ship accompanied by six smaller boats.

Property destruction: Around 12 January 2024 (as reported), in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), unknown assailants set a car on fire in the Carapungo neighborhood. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There is no further information available.

Property destruction: Around 12 January 2024 (as reported), in Quito - Quitumbe (Pichincha), unknown assailants set a car on fire in the Guamani neighborhood. This was part of the different assaults committed after the leader of Los Choneros escaped a prison and the president Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons. There is no further information available.

Looting: On 12 January 2024, on the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as pirates assaulted fishing boats, stealing their motors, nets, communication devices, and seafood, forcing the fishermen to stay stranded on the water. A similar assault occurred on 15 January 2024 (coded separately). Between the two events on 12 and 25 January, at least five fishing boats were assaulted, resulting in 27 fishermen missing. 12 were rescued as of 15 January with 15 still missing.

On 12 January 2024, in Crucita (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man while driving a truck in the Las Dunas sector. The perpetrators intercepted the truck, at which point one of them dismounted and approached the truck to fire multiple shots. The man was a local fish salesman. Authorship and motivation unknown. Reports differ on whether there were one or two perpetrators riding the motorcycle. 1 fatality.

On 12 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), one unidentified armed perpetrator described as a hitman (and likely a criminal gang member due to suspected drug trafficking) shot and killed a man in a park in the Simon Bolivar housing cooperative in the La Florida sector. The preparator waited for the victim to walk up to him, at which point he shot the victim eight times. Local witnesses indicated that the perpetrator had his back toward the victim and the victim did not recognize the perpetrator, but approached to greet him. Authorities suspect the attack was related to drug trafficking. 1 fatality.

On 12 January 2024, in Naranjito (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a male taxi driver inside his vehicle along the main road of the city. The taxi driver picked up unidentified passengers on 12 January 2024 in Milagro and messaged his wife that the passengers he was driving to Manta were acting suspicious. The driver's body was discovered shortly inside his taxi with a bullet wound to the head. Also on 12 January 2024, in Naranjito, an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man and left his body along the main road of the city, 20 meters from the body of the killed taxi driver in his taxi. Around the same time, also in Naranjito, an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed another man whose dead body was found in a ditch near the two other killed victims. There is no further information available, and police authorities are investigating whether the three victims were attacked by the same perpetrators. Authorship and motivation unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 12 January 2024, in Nobol (Guayas), three unidentified perpetrators traveling in a pickup truck with tinted windows kidnapped a man in the Barrio Lindo sector. Local witnesses reported the abduction, leading to a police operation on the Nobol-Daule road on the same day, where officers stopped the vehicle, freed the victim, and arrested three suspects. Police authorities also confiscated over $2,000 in cash, a mask, handcuffs, and a 9mm pistol found inside the vehicle.

Property destruction: On 12 January 2024, in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), police and military personnel used dynamite to destroy a clandestine airstrip used by criminal armed groups. The operation took place in the San Rafael community, part of the Chanduy parish in southern Santa Elena.

notes: On 12 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), prisoners at Litoral prison rioted, and police intervened. Some prison guards had to climb the wall out of the prison due to unspecified disturbances within the prison. There is no further information available. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.
