This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
notes: On 12 January 2024, in Loja (Loja), for the fifth day in a row, prisoners at Loja No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held around 20 people hostage, including 16 prison guards, to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Around 12 January 2024 (as reported), in Cuenca (Azuay), an unknown number of perpetrators (likely drug traffickers due to drugs seized) kidnapped a woman who worked as a civil servant. Military forces liberated the woman around 12 January during a raid in which they also confiscated unspecified weapons and drugs portioned for sale. There is no further information available.

Property destruction: On 12 January 2024, in Machachi (Pichincha), police forces intercepted and confiscated USD 2 million worth of gold ore in two trailers on a road through the city bound from Imbabura to El Oro, arresting two individuals. Military authorities indicated that the gold was intended to fund narcotrafficking groups with ties to illegal mining operations. The gold ore likely belonged to the Los Lobos Gang, as reports indicate that this gang expanded its illicit gold ore extraction efforts in the Imbabura and Azuay regions.

Around 12 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of Los Aguilas gang members kidnapped a person. Police forces liberated the victim around 12 January during a raid in which they arrested two gang members.

Around 13 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), military and police forces arrested two leaders of Los Aguilas gang in the Las Orquideas sector, Pascuales district during a joint operation. With the suspects police seized one rifle, one machine gun, one pistol, one submachine gun and 55 rounds of ammunition.

On 13 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), military and police forces arrested two leaders of the Los Gangster gang during a joint operation. The suspects were among the gang's most wanted, according to police forces.

On 13 January 2024, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), six unidentified armed individuals shot and killed two people and injured four others inside a pool bar in the Atucucho sector in the Cochapamba parish. The perpetrators arrived on three motorcycles and entered the building, where they opened fire on the people inside. Two people were shot and killed, while four others, including a minor, were injured and hospitalized. 2 fatalities.

On 13 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), two or three unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen traveling by motorcycle opened fire against a group of around 20 people playing football, including minors, in a drive-by shooting in the Proletarios sin Tierra housing cooperative in the Guasmo Sur sector, killing one minor and injuring 10 or 13 others. The killed minor was shot various times by the perpetrators. There is no further information on the identity and motivation of the perpetrators, but local residents suspect the involvement of the Los Lagartos Gang because they control the drug trade in the area. 1 fatality.

On 13 January 2024, in Crucita (Manabi), two unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle killed a man at a beach restaurant in a drive-by shooting along the Crucita pier. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle and opened fire at the victim while he was eating at the establishment before quickly leaving the scene. Other people present ducked for cover to avoid the bullets. The victim was a fishing boat captain. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 13 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a male minor and injured between eight and 12 others, mostly minors, in a drive-by shooting in the Proletarios Sin Tierra housing cooperative in the Guasmo Sur sector. The attackers opened fire on a group of around 20 minors playing football on the street before fleeing the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Police and military forces intervened to liberate 13 guards (two of whom were released peacefully sometime in the week). This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

After negotiations with police and military forces, the prisoners agreed to release the hostages. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Sources differ on the number of people held hostage within the facility. After negotiations with police and military forces, the prisoners agreed to release the hostages. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Upon negotiations with representatives of the catholic church, the prisoners agreed to release the remaining 11 hostages. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

After negotiations with police and military forces, the prisoners agreed to release the hostages. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
source: Cronica (Ecuador); Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador en Vivo; El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 13 January 2024, in Loja (Loja), for the sixth day in a row, prisoners at Loja No. 1 prison rioted, blocked access to the prison, took control of the prison, and held around 20 people hostage, including 16 prison guards, to prevent gang leaders from being transferred to other prisons. After negotiations with police and military forces, the prisoners agreed to release the hostages. This occurred in the context of various prison riots held across Ecuador after the leader of the Los Choneros gang escaped a prison and President Daniel Noboa signed an emergency state decree to allow military officers to deal with the unrest in prisons.

Around 13 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified perpetrators kidnapped two people. Police forces liberated the two victims around 13 January 2024 in the Monte Sinai sector. There is no further information available.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Ecuador (2023-); Police Forces of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
notes: On 14 January 2024, in Loja (Loja), prisoners of Loja prison 1 took control of the prison to prevent gang leaders to be transferred to another prisons. They captured an unknown number of police officers captive. Military and police officers intervened and regained control of the prison that was held for seven days.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Movement of forces: On 14 January 2024, in Turi (Azuay), over 1,000 members of the National Police and Armed Forces took control of the Turi No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding between 45 and 89 prison guards and administrative workers hostage. Police authorities had negotiated for the release of the hostages on 13 January (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration). After taking control of the prison, authorities seized some weapons, ammunition, and illicit substances found within the prison, as well as an unspecified number of grenades.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Movement of forces: On 14 January 2024, in Azogues (Canar), a large number of National Police and Armed Forces members took control of the Azogues No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding around 12 prison guards hostage. Police authorities had negotiated for the release the hostages 13 January (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration). After taking control of the prison, authorities seized some weapons, ammunition, and illicit substances found within the prison.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Movement of forces: On 14 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), around 800 members of the National Police and Armed Forces took control of El Oro No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding around 16 prison guards and prisoners hostage. Police forces carried out two controlled detonations at two doors to the prison complex to enter it. Police authorities had negotiated for the release of 16 hostages on 13 January, with one of them dying in an unspecified manner (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration). After taking control of the prison, authorities seized some weapons, ammunition, and illicit substances found within the prison.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); Esmeraldas News; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Movement of forces: On 14 January 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), around 1,100 members of the National Police and Armed Forces took control of the Esmeraldas No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding around 11 prison guards and administrative workers hostage. Police authorities had negotiated for the release of 11 hostages on 13 January (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration). Reports indicate that unspecified gunfire was heard from inside the prison, but no clashes were reported. After taking control of the prison, authorities seized some weapons, ammunition, and illicit substances found within the prison, as well as nine explosive devices.

On 14 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), six members of the Los Lobos gang blew up artifacts at the Judicial Police car retention patio. The six members, among them a minor, were later arrested in the Ceibos district, on the west of the city on the same day. With the suspects, police seized two firearms, four cell phones, three motorcycles, 41 rounds of ammunition, 26 non-electric detonating capsules, and three charges of primed explosives. There were no casualties.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Movement of forces: On 14 January 2024, in Loja (Loja), a large number of National Police and Armed Forces members took control of the Loja No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding around 20 prison guards hostage. Police authorities had negotiated for the release of the hostages on 13 January (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration). After taking control of the prison, authorities seized some weapons, ammunition, and illicit substances found within the prison.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Telegrafo; Policia DMG Zona 8; Policia Ecuador
notes: Around 14 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as a group of delinquents kidnapped three individuals for extortion in different points of Guayaquil. Police rescued the three victims on 16 January during a police operation in the Florida sector and arrested five suspects. One of the victims was kidnapped on 14 January in the Petrillo sector, but there is no further information on the kidnapping of the other two victims. The family of the victim kidnapped in Petrillo received an extortion message from the perpetrators and reported it to authorities. Police authorities indicated that the three victims had been held at different locations across the city.

On 14 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), four unidentified armed individuals described as delinquents and extortionists traveling on two motorcycles injured a male shop owner in the Carlos Magno housing cooperative in the Juan Montalvo sector. The perpetrators fired five shots at the victim, hitting him in the arm and leg. He was subsequently taken to a hospital. Police authorities indicate that the perpetrators robbed the shop owner and that he had suffered various robberies and extortion events in the previous year (unspecified), suspecting that the attackers of this event were responsible for past extortions. There were no fatalities.

On 14 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), six members of the Los Lobos gang were arrested after carrying out an explosive attack on the vehicle impound lot of the Judicial Police on the coastal highway. The perpetrators threw four explosives, but only one detonated, causing damage to the entrance gate. The suspects were located and arrested shortly after in a warehouse. Seized items included three motorcycles, a stolen vehicle, a pistol, ammunition, and detonators. Among the arrested were a woman and a minor. There were no casualties.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Policia Ecuador
notes: Movement of forces: Around 14 January 2024 (from 13 - 14 January), in Ambato (Tungurahua), around 400 members of the National Police and Armed Forces took control of the Tungurahua No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding around 15 prison guards hostage. Police authorities had negotiated for the release of 13 hostages on 13 January, with two of them being released earlier in the week (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration).

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador en Vivo; El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Policia Ecuador
notes: Movement of forces: On 14 January 2024, in Latacunga (Cotopaxi), around 1,000 members of the Armed Forces and 758 members of the National Police took control of the Cotopaxi No. 1 prison from prisoners after prisoners took control of the prison since 8 January (coded separately), holding around 45 prison guards hostage and one administrative worker. Police and military authorities used armored vehicles in their takeover of the prison. Police authorities had negotiated for the release of the hostages on 13 January (coded separately on the previous day of demonstration).

On 15 January 2024, in Charapoto (Manabi), at least four men described as delinquents kidnapped a male farmer while he was conducting agricultural work for extortion. The kidnappers demanded USD 40,000 for his release. Police forces liberated the victim on 16 January during an operation in which they arrested four perpetrators holding him captive. All four perpetrators were Ecuadorian nationals with unspecified criminal records.

Looting: On 15 January 2024, on the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as pirates assaulted fishing boats, stealing their motors, nets, communication devices, and seafood, forcing the fishermen to stay stranded on the water. A similar assault occurred on 12 January 2024 (coded separately). Between the two events on 12 and 25 January, at least five fishing boats were assaulted, resulting in 27 fishermen missing. 12 were rescued as of 15 January with 15 still missing.

On 15 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals described as delinquents riding a motorcycle killed a man in the Los Vergeles neighborhood. The attackers intercepted the victim while he was walking on a sidewalk, where one of the perpetrators briefly stepped off the motorcycle to shoot the victim five times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.
On 15 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), military and police forces arrested a prominent Los Choneros gang leader during a joint operation in the city.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador en Vivo; El Telegrafo; Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Weapons seizure: On 15 January 2024, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), an unknown number of unidentified individuals abandoned at least 130 sticks of dynamite at the Community Police Unit (UPC) in the San Roque neighborhood along Ramon Pacheco and El Placer streets. The explosives were left at the entrance of the UPC. Police authorities stated that the dynamite was typically used in mining and that it was found in white sacks and lacked some components needed for detonation. Explosive experts and forensic agents retrieved the explosives.

On 15 January 2024, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a male taxi driver as he was working. The victim's dead body was found abandoned in the Barro Colorado sector on the same day, while his taxi was left abandoned on Avenida Simon Plata Torres. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 15 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), Ecuadorian Armed Forces discovered a monitoring center inside a house in Isla Trinitaria during a military operation. The house was equipped with closed-circuit cameras, a computer, and internet equipment. A foreign national from Morocco was found inside, along with doses of illegal substances. The operation was part of ongoing efforts to combat criminal organizations under an executive decree. Additional information regarding the purpose of the monitoring or the foreigner's involvement remains unclear.

Defusal: Around 15 January 2024 (as reported), in the rural area of Latacunga canton (Cotopaxi), police forces arrested six individuals described as criminal gang members and confiscated an unspecified number of dynamite explosives hidden in a box of bananas in an area close to Pujili. Authorities removed the explosives and detonated the explosives in a safe location away from civilians.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
source: Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 16 January 2024, around Lago Agrio canton (coded to Nueva Loja, Sucumbios), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators described as criminals and hitmen shot and killed a uniformed prison guard as he was in his car arriving home from his work at Sucumbios No. 1 prison (off-duty). The armed assailant shot the victim seven times. 1 fatality.

Looting: Around 16 January 2024 (as reported), in the rural area of Zaruma canton (El Oro), at least two unidentified assailants looted mining material and explosives from a mining location in Zaruma canton. Military forces apprehended the two individuals and confiscated 10 ammonium nitrate plugs, 29 explogel plugs, 2 hydraulic drills, 2 batteries, 1 meter of detonating cord, 6 drill bits, 8 drill bits, 2 combos, 1 blowtorch with hose, and a 10-pound bag of gold material. They also confiscated a handgun with ammunition.

source: El Diario (Ecuador); El Heraldo (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Prensa Chimborazo; Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 17 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of armed assailants in a car, members of Chone Killers gang, shot and killed a state attorney at Bombero Av., in Los Ceibos sector at the north of the city in a drive-by shooting. The state attorney was part of the National Specialized Investigation Unit against Transnational Organized Criminality (UNIDOT) and was currently investigating the case of armed assailants that entered TC Television media building (coded separately). The suspects shot the victim at least 20 times. Two gang members were arrested the day after the attack and two others on 24 June. The motivation behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: Defusal: On 17 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), police forces carried out a weapons operation in the Divino Nino neighborhood in which they entered a house and arrested four men who had in their possession four grenades. They carried out a controlled explosion of the four grenades without any issues. The four men were suspected criminal gang members connected to the killing of a woman in Manta on 16 January 2024 (coded separately).

On 17 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the 28 de Agosto housing cooperative. The victim was shot six times in the back. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), unidentified armed individuals described as hitmen shot and killed a fishing bussinessman outside a physical rehabilitation center between 17 Street and 22 Avenue. The victim was entering the building when at least one armed perpetrator shot him four times with a 9-mm pistol before fleeing with an accomplice by motorcycle. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 18 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed suspects, described as hitmen on two motorcycles shot and killed a man in the 28 de Agosto de Pascuales neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The motivation behind the attack and its perpetrators are unknown. The attack took place during the curfew restrictions that are part of the internal armed conflict state declared by the president on 9 January. 1 fatality.

On 18 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified suspects detonated an explosive device outside a house in the 28 and Calicuchima neighborhood, damaging large part of the exterior of the house. Witnesses stated the attack was linked to extortion groups after the homeowners refused to pay extortion payments. It was likely that people were inside the house due to the time of the attack. There were no casualties.

Property destruction: On 18 January 2024, in Guayas province (coded to Guayaquil), elements of the Ecuadorian Air Force used explosives to disable three areas suspected of being used as landing strips for drug planes operated by criminal gangs in a series of controlled explosions.

Weapons seizure: On 18 January 2024, in La Herradura (Zamora Chinchipe), police and military forces intercepted and confiscated 21 sticks of dynamite, 38 meters of slow fuse, 288 gallons of diesel, and other illegal mining items inside a residence in the town. Authorities arrested two Venezuelans and one Peruvian national and further discovered 296 grams of cocaine and 237 grams of marijuana inside. There is no further information on whether the arrested individuals belonged to a criminal gang.

Around 18 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as extortionists opened fire on a supermarket with 15 people inside, who were forced to take cover. The perpetrators fired on the supermarket as part of an extortion threat. There were no casualties.

Defusal: Around 18 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Garcia Moreno (Guayas), police forces defused an unspecified explosive device at a house along 29 and Calicuchima Street placed there by unidentified perpetrators.

Around 18 January 2024 (as reported), in Portoviejo (Manabi), at least four unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a person and demanded ransom. Police forces liberated the victim and arrested four perpetrators on 18 January in Portoviejo.

source: Ecuador Comunicacion; Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Movement of forces: On 18 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), around 1,000 members of the National Police and Armed Forces entered Guayas Regional Prison No. 4 and seized control of the prison as part of an announced security raid to seize prohibited objects and maintain control of the prison center. Reports indicate that this movement of forces was partially in response to the killing of a state attorney in Guayaquil on 17 January by Chone Killers gang members (coded separately), with authorities seizing control of the prison to search for more information on that attack. Military authorities further indicated that they reinforced control over the external and internal perimeter of the prison. This is in the context of a series of prison riots in previous weeks across the country (coded separately) in which prisoners and suspected criminal gang members took control of various prisons in Ecuador.

On 19 January 2024, in Bahia de Caraquez (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators killed a male municipal employee near his home in the Jorge Lomas neighborhood, Leonidas Plaza parish. The perpetrators ambushed the victim while he was inside his car accompanied by his wife, who was injured during the attack and later hospitalized. The victim worked in municipal revenue services. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); La Prensa Chimborazo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 19 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), two unidentified armed assailants described as delinquents shot and injured the lawyer of two brothers that have been arrested for money laundering in front of his office near Ayacucho and 25 de Junio street. The two armed men arrived at the victim's office on a motorcycle, at which point one of them stepped off and approached the lawyer, who was entering the office. The armed man shot at the lawyer at least twice, but the lawyer ran away to safety in the nearby Machala municipal building. The lawyer was largely unharmed, but reports differ on whether he was hit in the hand by a bullet or injured his hand falling while running from the perpetrators. The two perpetrators left the scene on their motorcycle. There is no further information on the identity of the attackers. There were no fatalities.

Around 19 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least six unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a person in the Nueva Prosperina district. Police forces liberated the victim on 19 January during a raid in Nueva Prosperina in which they also arrested six perpetrators and confiscated one vehicle and two guns.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (Ecuador); Private Security Forces (Ecuador); Vigilante Group (Ecuador)
notes: On 20 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Olmedo (Guayas), a group of residents, merchants, and private security officers attacked a suspected male thief and sexually abused him by inserting a stick into his body near Chiriboga Street. The mob chased down the suspected thief after he allegedly stole from a vendor in the Bahia sector. A video of the assault went viral on social media. The victim was eventually restrained by a security guard and handed over to the police.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Ecuador (2023-); Military Forces of Colombia (2022-); Police Forces of Colombia (2022-)
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: Property destruction: On 20 January 2024, on the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), military and police forces seized 161 packages containing around 3.2 tons of cocaine in a semi-submersible boat, 32 nautical miles away from the coastline of Esmeraldas and 4 nautical miles from the maritime border with Colombia. Three Colombian citizens were arrested.

Weapons seizure: On 20 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), military and police forces carried out an operation inside the Litoral prison facility and seized, among other material, rifles, short arms, grenades, ammunition, cell phones and drugs.

Weapons seizure: Around 20 January 2024 (as reported), in Guaytacama (Cotopaxi), military and police forces carried out an operation inside the Libertador de Cotopaxi prison facility and seized one M4 rifle, ammunition of different caliber, four rifle chargers, three pistol chargers, two pineapple grenades, two grenade fuses, computers, knives, drugs, among other smuggled goods, such as liquor.

Weapons seizure: Around 20 January 2024 (as reported), in Guaytacama (Cotopaxi), police authorities confiscated a large number of munitions and explosives discovered within Cotopaxi No. 1 prison. This included six different types of grenades, around 4,000 pieces of munition of various calibers, and dozens of pistols and rifles.

Around 20 January 2024 (as reported), in Portoviejo (Manabi), an unidentified man was killed and his incinerated remains were discovered in a vacant lot in the Eloy Alfaro neighborhood. Preliminary reports indicate that only bones remained, suggesting the body may have been burned days prior. No clothing or documents were found near the remains. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 21 January 2024, in Estero Lagarto (Los Rios), military forces seized 22 tons of cocaine in a pig farm during an operation. The drug was appraised at USD 1,000. During the operation were also seized 10 assembly rifles, 10 machine guns, 4 long guns, 3 nine-millimeter pistols, and 7,000 ammunition. One person was arrested.

actor2: Farc Dissident - Oliver Sinisterra Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces Of Colombia Dissident Faction (Oliver Sinisterra Front)
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 21 January 2024, around Imbabura province (coded to San Miguel de Ibarra), police and military officers captured a head of the Oliver Sinisterra Front armed group of Colombia and allied to the Los Tiguerones gang in Ecuador. Police authorities linked the group leader to the kidnapping and killing of an Ecuadorian couple in Tumaco, Colombia, and a car bomb attack in San Lorenzo de Esmeraldas in April and January 2018, respectively (both coded separately). Ecuadorian authorities handed the armed group leader over to Colombian authorities a few days after his arrest.

Around 21 January 2024 (as reported), in Duran (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped and subsequently asphyxiated and killed a merchant for extortion in the Bahia sector. The perpetrators demanded USD 50,000 for his release. 1 fatality.

Around 21 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), at least five unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a person in the Trinitaria sector. Police forces liberated the victim on 21 January during a raid in the Distrito Esteros neighborhood in the same sector in which they also arrested five perpetrators and confiscated two vehicles.

Property destruction: Around 21 January 2024 (as reported), in Machala (El Oro), military forces uncovered and dismantled a clandestine communication network operating within Machala prison. Military authorities dismantled 40 unauthorized internet connections and paid television installations that had been set up by inmates and that served as communication with other prisons in the country. Authorities suspect that these communication services were used for organizing criminal gang activity. They confiscated 1,500 meters of cable.

Around 21 January 2024 (as reported), in Naranjal (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators beat, shot, and tortured a man and left his dead body, with its throat cut, in the Brisas del Rio neighborhood. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Property destruction: On 22 January 2024, in Los Cedros (Los Rios), more than 150 military officers seized approximately 22 tons of drugs that were hidden underground in a banana plantation near the Estero de Lagarto sector. The value of the drugs all together was between 300 and 500 million U.S. dollars. During the seizure a man was arrested. Military authorities also seized twelve 5.56mm caliber long and short rifles, three 9mm caliber pistols, two 12mm caliber handmade cartridge belts, 350 9mm caliber ammunition, and 7,000 5.56mm caliber ammunition. The confiscated drugs belong to the Los Fatales Gang.

On 22 January 2024, near El Guabo (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals shot at two men, a father and son, traveling by vehicle on the Barbones-Tendales road, killing the son and injuring the father. The perpetrators shot multiple times. The father, who was hospitalized from his injuries, was the former president of the Tendales Parish Board. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling by vehicle killed a Colombian national as he drove with his wife in a drive-by shooting on the Narcisa de Jesus highway. The perpetrators fired at least three shots at the victim. The wife of the victim was not harmed. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Defusal: On 23 January 2024, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), police officers found 20 explosive artifacts in the La Colmena sector. With the aid of the Intervention and Rescue Group (GIR) of the police, they successfully controlled the explosions of the 20 artifacts.

On 23 January 2024, in El Guabo (El Oro), two unidentified armed men dressed in black shot and killed a man who was loading bananas in the Los Naranjos sector. The perpetrators fired multiple shots to the victim's head and chest. Police authorities recovered thirteen bullet shell casings from the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators riding on a motorcycle killed a man outside a mechanic workshop, where he worked, in a drive-by shooting in the 9 de Octubre neighborhood, Tarqui parish. The perpetrators fired at least four shots at the victim. Reports indicate that the perpetrators purposefully intercepted the victim at his workplace. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 23 January 2024, in Zaruma (El Oro), military forces seized over 1,000 explosives during a military operation against illegal mining in the Muluncay sector. Military authorities found and confiscated 1,272 blocks of explosives, 257 armed capsules, 200 meters of slow-burning fuse, 39 sacks of ammonium nitrate, and 34 blocks of explogel. There were no arrests.
Property destruction: On 24 January 2024, in Montecristi (Manabi), military officers destroyed two clandestine landing airstrips used by an unspecified criminal organization for narcotrafficking.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 24 January 2024, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants described as hitmen shot and killed an off-duty police officer in the Santa Rosa sector, intercepting him in a drive-by shooting as he rode on a motorcycle. The police officer was shot various times. 1 fatality.

On 24 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police forces carried out a series of operations in the Nueva Prosperina district, in the north part of the city to dismantle surveillance systems that gang members used to control. During the operations two leaders of Los Fatales gang, linked to extortion and drug trafficking, and allied to Los Aguilas and Los Choneros gangs, were arrested. With the individuals police seized a machine gun, a pistol, explosive devices and ammunition. No clashes were reported.

Weapons seizure: Around 24 January 2024 (as reported), in Buenos Aires (Imbabura), military forces discovered and confiscated 106 explosives and 397 fulminating capsules and other items used for illicit mining. Authorities arrested one individual during the raid.

Property destruction: On 24 January 2024, in Cuenca (Azuay), military forces destroyed a network of tunnels discovered beneath the Turi prison complex. Authorities indicated that the tunnels were used by inmates to conceal weapons and drugs. They also identified a corridor that they suspected prisoners used as a workshop for making unauthorized items. Additional tunnels connecting the prison's nine cell blocks were also detected and dismantled.
Defusal: On 24 January 2024, in Quito - Manuela Saenz (Pichincha), police forces discovered 20 sticks of dynamite in the La Colmena sector and safely defused it at a different location.

On 24 January 2024, in Riobamba (Chimbarazo), a group of local residents apprehended and beat a suspected thief attempting to steal valuable items from a hardware store on Edelberto Bonilla Avenue in the Calzado Libre neighborhood. The mob subdued the suspect with sticks and ropes, but were stopped from lynching the suspect by police, who took him into custody. There were no fatalities.

Defusal: On 24 January 2024, in San Mateo (Manabi), an alert was raised for a suspected explosive device at the State Fisheries Office located at the San Mateo pier in Manta. An initial report noted a detonation sound, though officials have not confirmed details. The Bomb Squad from the Intervention and Rescue Group (GIR) arrived on-site to investigate, and personnel at the Fisheries Office were evacuated as a precaution.

On 25 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), an explosive was triggered inside a warehouse of the Aquaculture and Fishing Ministry. The explosive was of military use to control multitudes, and according to the police was used for intimidation to a person of the warehouse. No infrastructure was damaged and no one was injured.

On 25 January 2024, in Santa Elena (Santa Elena), the son of the prefect of Los Rios was kidnapped by unidentified armed assailants for ransom. He was rescued after an intervention from military and police officers.

On 25 January 2024, in Duran (Guayas), two unidentified armed individuals described as criminals traveling by motorcycle killed a man at a restaurant in a drive-by shooting on Gonzalo Aparicio Avenue. Police authorities believe the assailants were the same individuals responsible for the murder of a criminal leader in the area on 21 January (coded separately), and that the victim was killed because he was a witness to the attack. Authorities further suspected that the attack is related to territorial disputes between rival criminal organizations in the canton. 1 fatality.

Around 25 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a suspected Los Choneros gang member shot at the store of a female businessowner at a bazaar in the Urbanor neighborhood in an extortion attempt. The assailant approached on foot and fired five shots at the business as the owner was closing the store. The attack occurred because the businessowner had refused to pay an extortion fee. There were no casualties.

On 25 January 2024, in Huaquillas (El Oro), two unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man as he walked in a drive-by shooting along San Antonio y Azuay streets in the Brisas del Mar neighborhood. The perpetrators shot the victim at least eight times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: Around 25 January 2024 (as reported), in Turi (Azuay), military forces discovered and dismantled various tunnels built by criminal armed groups and prisoners as a way in and out Pavillion 9 of the prison. There is no further information available on how long the tunnels were in use.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); La Prensa Chimborazo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 25 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), military forces arrested the leader of the Mafia-18 gang in the La Floresta sector. The gang leader was released from detention on 26 January by a local judge. The gang leader had a criminal record of kidnapping in 2022 (unspecified) and murder in 2023 (unspecified), as well as a further charge for weapon possession in 2021.

On 25 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least four Los Tiguerones gang members abducted a motorcycle rider near the Entrada de la 8 sector. The victim was liberated by police forces on the same day after they clashed with the gang members near Casuarina market in the Guerreros del Fortin housing cooperative in the Nueva Prosperina sector (coded separately).
On 26 January 2024, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), military forces arrested the second-in-command of Los Tiguerones.

On 26 January 2024, in Quito - Eugenio Espejo (Pichincha), two unidentified perpetrators kidnapped two men for extortion who were in a taxi near the Guapulo Bridge in the La Pradera sector, physically beating one of the men. Police authorities suspect that both men were drugged. One of the two men was discovered in the same area on 27 January, while the second man was discovered in the same area on 30 January, with signs of being physically beaten. The man proceeded to remain missing as he could not effectively communicate with witnesses who could help him due to his disoriented state. The whereabouts of the man are unknown. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 26 January 2024 (as reported), near Guayaquil (Guayas), police forces intercepted two vehicles, one being an oil tank, carrying illicit petrol (gasoline). They confiscated 9,500 gallons of liquid petrol and other items used for illegal gasoline extraction by an unidentified criminal organization. Authorities arrested six individuals at the scene.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 27 January 2024, in Ambato (Tungurahua), two Chinese nationals and restaurant owners, a husband and wife, were shot in the head and killed, and their dead bodies were found in their home on Los Chasquis Avenue, with one of them also being found gagged, tied at the hands and feet, and with a sack over their head. The victims ran a chifa restaurant on the ground floor of a three-story building in which they lived. The male victim had been killed in the kitchen with one gunshot wound to the head, while the female victim was killed in the bedroom, where her body was discovered tied up at the hands and feet, with a bag over the head, and with a gunshot wound to the head. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown, but police authorities tentatively suspect robbery as USD 15,000 was missing from the victim's house. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Ecuador (2023-); Military Forces of Colombia (2022-); Police Forces of Colombia (2022-)
source: Ecuador Comunicacion; Ecuador en Vivo; Ecuavisa; Esmeraldas News
notes: Property destruction: On 27 January 2024, on the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), military and police forces from Ecuador and Colombia seized 28 packages containing around 1 ton of cocaine in a semi-submersible boat, 25 nautical miles away from the coastline of Esmeraldas. Some sources report around 900 kilograms instead of 1 ton of cocaine. Authorities also confiscated 918 gallons of petrol (gas). Three Ecuadorian citizens were arrested with the drug charges.

On 27 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling by vehicle killed two people, a man and a woman, outside the woman's house in a drive-by shooting on Josa Mascote and A streets. The man was buying food from the woman when the perpetrators drove past and opened fire at least five times. Authorship and motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 27 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), prisoners at Litoral prison set mattresses on fire to demonstrate for an unspecified reason.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2024, near La Libertad (Santa Elena), police forces dismantled a system used to steal hydrocarbons from the Libertad-Manta pipeline along km 5 of the Spondylus Route. The system included sophisticated equipment and materials that were found to steal fuels (gasoline, diesel), like underground tanks, tunnels, a closed tank, hoses, and valves, among other items.

Property destruction: Around 27 January 2024 (as reported), in Loja (Loja), military forces uncovered and dismantled a clandestine communication network operating within the Loja Rehabilitation Center. Military authorities dismantled 40 unauthorized internet connections and paid television installations that had been set up by inmates and that served as communication with other prisons in the country. Military personnel also found and confiscated mobile devices hidden in various secret compartments in the prison that prisoners used to communicate.

On 27 January 2024, in Machala (El Oro), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators attacked a trans woman with a hammer, resulting in severe fractures to her skull and face. The victim was left critically injured in their apartment and later transported to a local hospital followed by a private clinic while in critical condition. Police authorities classified the incident as a suspected trans femicide. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 27 January 2024, in Rocafuerte (Manabi), two unidentified armed men shot and killed a motorcycle mechanic while he was working outside a repair shop on Sucre Avenue. The men arrived on a motorcycle; one dismounted, drew a firearm, and fatally shot the victim before fleeing the scene. Another individual was injured by a stray bullet and received medical assistance. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2024, in Los Rios province (coded to Babahoyo, Los Rios), military officers destroyed two clandestine landing airstrips belonging to a criminal armed group used for drug trafficking.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 27 January 2024, in Vinces (Los Rios), around eight Los Choneros gang members who arrived in two pickup trucks shot and killed five people at a house at Walter Andrade and Jose Echeverria streets in the Ciudadela La Virgen neighborhood. The perpetrators shot at three people standing in front of the house before entering it and shooting at the people gathered inside. Five people were killed and seven or eight were injured. One of the killed victims was a woman who was a Venezuelan national. Police authorities suspect that the target of the attack was an Ecuadorian man who escaped the house and avoided the attackers. The motivation is unknown. 5 fatalities.

source: El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador); Policia Ecuador
notes: Property destruction: On 28 January 2024, off the Coast of Manta (Manabi), military forces seized close to a ton of cocaine that was being transported on a small boat 200 nautical miles from the coast of Manta. The value of the drugs was 20 million dollars. Some sources indicate that around 900 kilograms of cocaine were seized. During the seizure three men were arrested.

On 28 January 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a man standing with a group of people in a drive-by shooting in the 16 and P sector in the southwest of the city. The assailants fired on the group of people standing at the porch of a house, hitting the victim various times while the others fled unharmed. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 28 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), three armed assailants in a black car passing through Carlos Guevara Moreno 2 cooperative in Esteros district shot and injured five residents in a drive-by shooting. The perpetrators and motivations for the attack are unknown. Also, three armed individuals riding on a motorcycle killed a man attending a party in a drive-by shooting near El Oro and 43 streets in the Carlos Guevara Moreno 2 housing cooperative, Esteros district. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; El Universo (Ecuador); La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Property destruction: On 29 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of Los Choneros gang members traveling by vehicle opened fire on the General Prosecutor's Office in a drive-by shooting along 4 de Noviembre Avenue and left several threatening pamphlets at the scene. The pamphlets contained messages from the Los Choneros Gang, which included a warning against interfering with their operations. The attack caused only material damage to the building. Police authorities discovered around 15 ballistic rounds at the scene. The perpetrators burned the vehicle they used in the attack and abandoned it in the Palo Santo sector. There was nobody in the building at the time of the attack. There were no casualties.

Weapons seizure: Around 29 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), police forces confiscated various arms and explosives during a raid in Litoral prison. Authorities confiscated at least around 30 sticks of dynamite hidden by prisoners.

Property destruction: On 29 January 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), an unknown number of unidentified individuals set fire to the entrance of Unidad Educativa Replica Nicolas Infante Diaz (school) in the San Rafael sector of 24 de Mayo parish. Videos later emerged on social media in which security footage captured the suspects igniting the flames outside the school in San Rafael, parish 24 de Mayo, and additional videos surfaced of unidentified individuals claiming responsibility for the arson attack and threatening further attacks on the school. The flames caused some damage to the face of the school.

Property destruction: Around 29 January 2024 (as reported), in the rural area of Zaruma canton (El Oro), military forces seized a large quantity of illegal mining materials during a raid in a mining camp. The seizure included 400 sticks of ammonium nitrate, 181 ordinary capsules armed with slow-burning fuse, 46 sacks of ammonium nitrate, 38 meters of fuse, 118 sticks of Emulnor, and 109 sticks of ANFO. The operation was part of ongoing efforts to combat illegal mining in the region.

On 29 January 2024, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), an unidentified armed man shot and killed a woman and injured an elderly woman after firing at a group of people in the Quinto Callejon sector. The armed perpetrator stepped out of a vehicle to shoot at the victims. The target of the attack was the killed woman, as she had a criminal record for drug possession and likely bought drugs from the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 30 January 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), residents of Las Orquideas sector captured and beat up a man that was accused of being a extortionist. They threatened to burn the man, but did not carry it out. There were no fatalities.

On 30 January 2024, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), two armed assailants on a motorcycle came inside a brothel, shot and killed a man and later escaped. The perpetrators and motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

source: Ecuador en Vivo; Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: Defusal: On 30 January 2024, in San Carlos (Los Rios), two cars were found by military officers with two sticks of dynamite and domestic gas cylinders. Military authorities indicated that both vehicles were intended as car bombs. They later successfully deactivated both cars.

On 30 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), a fisher from Santa Marianita parish was kidnapped by at least two assailants. The man was later rescued in El Corozo sector in Portoviejo in a police operative on 2 February. Two assailants, one male and the other female, were arrested. They had cut a finger from the fisher to send to his family members to force them to pay money for them to release him. There were no fatalities.

Around 30 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators kidnapped two people in the Pascuales neighborhood for extortion, demanding USD 100 million for their release. Police forces liberated the individuals on 31 January 2024 during a raid in the Esteros district in the Trinitaria sector in which they also arrested the perpetrators.

On 30 January 2024, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators traveling by vehicle injured a man walking on the street in a drive-by shooting in the Jocay neighborhood. The victim was hospitalized. Police authorities later detained two individuals near the entrance to the Urbirrios neighborhood suspected of having a connection with the attack. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

Defusal: On 30 January 2024, in Pujili (Cotopaxi), police authorities removed an explosive that an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators riding a motorcycle threw into a home at the intersection of Pichincha and Luis Fernando Chavez streets. The explosive consisted of two sticks of dynamite and some detonating cord. Police authorities safely detonated the explosive in a controlled environment.

Around 31 January 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least two unidentified perpetrators described as criminal gang members kidnapped a person in the Nueva Prosperina district for extortion. Police forces liberated the victim on 31 January 2024 during a raid in the Trinidad de Dio neighborhood the same sector in which they also arrested two perpetrators.
On 1 February 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), police officers captured a head of North Valley Cartel. The man was delivered to Colombian forces the next day through Rumichaca bridge.

Weapons seizure: On 1 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), police discovered and decommissioned 40 sticks of pentolite explosives in a house in the Suburbio sector. The explosives were equipped with an electrical system allowing remote activation via mobile devices and were suspected of being intended for attacks on police units. Authorities estimate the explosives could have caused destruction within a two-kilometer radius. Three individuals were arrested at the scene.

On 1 February 2024, in Quito - Calderon (Pichincha), three unidentified armed individuals in a car kidnapped a man riding a motorbike. The police rescued the victim, arrested five suspects, and seized firearms and ammunition. The perpetrators were given 14 years in two sentences. There is no further information available.

On 1 February 2024, in Manta (Manabi), several armed assailants kidnapped a man while he was outside his house. The kidnappers later contacted the victim's wife to demand the payment of a ransom. The perpetrators took the victim to the 24 de Mayo sector in Noboa parish. Police officers rescued the man on 9 February and arrested three perpetrators, with another three also being arrested in connection to the kidnapping.
Property destruction: On 2 February 2024, in Puna (Guayas), military and police officers discovered and destroyed two clandestine landing airstrips at Puna island belonging to an armed organisation.

On 2 February 2024, in Playas (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified armed assailants shot and killed three women, all minors, and injured a man in 25 de Julio sector when they were inside a house. They had no criminal record and the reason behind the attack is unknown. 3 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador)
notes: On 2 February 2024, in Manta (Manabi), between three and for unidentified armed perpetrators described as hitmen shot and killed a woman inside a ceviche restaurant that she owned at the Badaracco Plaza in the San Carlos neighborhood. One of the perpetrators entered the establishment to shoot the victim while the others waited outside. A man that was in the restaurant was shot and injured. The perpetrators outside held two security guards at gunpoint (without a clash being reported) and escaped together. They later abandoned their vehicle in Montecristi. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 3 February 2024, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas), military and police forces raided the Bellavista prison in a large-scale security operation and retrieved d 2,747 rounds of unspecified ammunition, along with 11,116 rounds of 5.56mm for rifles and 1,580 rounds of 9mm ammunition for pistols hidden in walls and columns. Police forces further retrieved three rifles, eleven pistols, ten grenades, 68 knives, 130 cell phones, 28 cigarette packs, and 60,000 doses of marijuana and cocaine from inmates in ten pavilions of the prison. Explosives experts were deployed to handle the grenades.

On 3 February 2024, in Vinces (Los Rios), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting while he was drinking with his wife outside their home. The woman was shot and injured and taken to a local hospital. The perpetrators used 9-mm bullets. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 3 February 2024, off the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), military officers seized 1.5 tons of drugs in a coast sector operation carried out. Authorities arrested three Ecuadorians and one Colombian national.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador en Vivo; Ecuavisa; El Diario (Ecuador); El Telegrafo; Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 3 February 2024, in Salinas (Santa Elena), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle entered a bar and shot two men. One of the men was killed and the other was injured. Both men had unspecified criminal records. 1 fatality.

On 4 February 2024, in Pelileo (Tungurahua), a group of residents attacked police officers that were carrying out a surveillance around La Florida Baja sector. They claimed to be members of Los Lobos and attacked the officers. The officers used tear gas and controlled the situation, and two people were arrested. It is unclear whether they are really members of Los Lobos gang or not. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 4 February 2024, off the Coast of Manta (Manabi), the Ecuadorian Navy intercepted a semi-submergible vessel carrying approximately one ton of drugs 257 nautical miles off the coast. Authorities arrested two individuals.

On 4 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), an unknown number of unidentified individuals kidnapped a man in the Suburbio sector and later abandoned him in his neighborhood with a gunshot wound and two fingers amputated. His severed fingers were found hours earlier near the Regional Prison in the San Francisco cooperative. The victim was hospitalized in critical condition. Police authorities suspect the motive to be extortion. There were no fatalities.

Defusal: On 4 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), police officers found an explosive artifact that was left outside a house in Portete sector. The owner of the house had received an extortion threat in a phone call. Police officers carried out a controlled detonation successfully.

On 4 February 2024, in Lomas de Sargentillo (Guayas), two men were shot and killed by two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by). The men were taken to a hospital, where they both died. 2 fatalities.

On 4 February 2024, in Portoviejo (Manabi), unidentified armed assailants shot their guns to random people at El Floron citadel. During the shooting, they killed a man and injured another. The reasons behind the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2024, in El Empalme (Guayas), residents beat up and killed a man that they accused of being a criminal and an extortionist. The man was found with a letter from the residents rejecting criminal activity in their sector. Family members identified the man and claimed that he was not a criminal and was leaving a family member home when he was captured by El Empalme residents. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), an unknown number of perpetrators kidnapped a man and a woman for ransom. The kidnappers demanded a $30,000 ransom and communicated with the victims' families via WhatsApp. Police authorities liberated the victims around 7 February during a police operation in which they also arrested 9 suspects linked to the kidnapping.

On 5 February 2024, in Manta (Manabi), two unidentified armed individuals riding a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the San Rafael neighborhood. The perpetrators ambushed the victim outside his residence and shot him at least nine times. Police recovered multiple 9mm bullet casings at the scene. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.
On 5 February 2024, in Rosa Zarate (Esmeraldas), military officers captured one of the main heads of Los Tiguerones gang.

On 6 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in the 12 de Octubre housing cooperative in the Mapasingue sector. The victim tried to escape the perpetrators when he noticed their vehicle, but one of the perpetrators stepped out to shoot once at him while running and then multiple times in a neighbor's house. The victim had three prior criminal records and was involved in three ongoing legal cases (unspecified). Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 6 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), police and military forces seized over 48 pentolite explosives near the Monumental Stadium in the Suburbio sector during a joint security operation. The explosives, which had remote detonation capability, were strong enough to destroy a police station. There is no further information on the ownership of the explosives.

On 6 February 2024, in Zapotillo (Loja), two unidentified perpetrators kidnapped a legal prosecutor as he left the Zapotillo Prosecutor's Office. The perpetrators threatened the victim before releasing him. The victim committed suicide three days later, in 9 February, at his home in the Piedra Tabla sector. Police authorities are investigating if the events are linked. Authorship and motivation unknown.

On 6 February 2024, in Machala (El Oro), unidentified assailants threw an explosive at the house of a lawyer at Marcel Laniado and Babahoyo streets. The explosion did not damage the house. The female lawyer is very well known in the city. She was present in the house at the time of the attack. There was a note attached to the explosive.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Primicias
notes: On 6 February 2024, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by) shot and killed a lawyer of the Manabi Government while he was at a parking lot in the center of the city. The lawyer had a criminal record for extorsion and intimidation. 1 fatality.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 7 February 2024, in Huaquillas (El Oro), three unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed a male taxi cab driver and taxi union leader along Amazonas and Bolivar Madero streets. The victim stopped to pick up a passenger, who shot him as two other perpetrators intercepted the taxi on a motorcycle. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Ecuador (2023-); MRC: Citizen Revolution Movement; Women (Ecuador)
source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuavisa; El Comercio (Ecuador); El Diario (Ecuador); El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Machala Movil; Primicias
notes: On 7 February 2024, in Naranjal (Guayas), two Los Lobos gang members on a motorcycle shot and killed a female council member (Revolucion Ciudadana Movement) of the local government in a drive-by shooting as she stood outside her house in the Corona 2 sector. One of the perpetrators was arrested on 10 February 2024, and the other was arrested on 10 December 2025. 1 fatality.

On 7 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Pascuales (Guayas), four Los Tiguerones gang members kidnapped a woman from where she worked along the Daule road, in the Pascuales sector. The perpetrators threatened to mutilate the victim's fingers if she didn't sign five $50,000 checks. Police forces rescued the woman hours later during a police operation at a house in the Vilcabamba sector in which they arrested the four perpetrators.

On 7 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), an unknown number of perpetrators on a trimotor kidnapped three teachers, two women and a man, in front of a school in the El Fortin sector as they arrived for work. The two women were abandoned in the La Antena area and the man near a shopping center, both in the Nuevo Guayaquil sector. Police forces arrested two perpetrators suspected of being linked with the abduction. Police authorities are investigating whether the kidnapping was to steal the male teacher's vehicle or demand ransom for the victims.
On 7 February 2024, in Guayaquil (Guayas), four Los Lobos gang members kidnapped a man. Police authorities liberated the victim on the same day and arrested the four gang members.

On 7 February 2024, in Quito - La Delicia (Pichincha), four unidentified individuals kidnapped a man in the La Ofelia sector and demanded a $1,500 ransom for his release. The perpetrators took the victim to a house in the Pisuli sector, where he was bound and blindfolded. The victim later freed himself and sought help. Police identified his vehicle in the Calderon sector, pursued the suspects, and arrested them.

On 7 February 2024, off the Coast of Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), three fishers were abducted by armed assailants engaged in piracy while they were in the sea, at 50 nautical miles from the coast. Military officers rescued them.

On 7 February 2024, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants shot and injured a man in Las Vegas sector. The man was taken to a hospital in Quevedo city, were he died. Police officers claimed that the attack was part of a dispute between gangs. Elsewhere, unidentified armed assailants shot and injured a man in Nogales sector. The assailants were on a motorcycle when they shot the man (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 7 February 2024, in Babahoyo (Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle and a car shot and killed a man and a boy on Vargas Machucha and Martin Icaza streets intersection (drive-by). One of the men had a criminal record for homicide. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); Ecuador Comunicacion; Ecuador en Vivo; El Mercurio (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Expreso; Primicias
notes: On 7 February 2024, in Santa Lucia (Guayas), police and military officers arrested three members of Los Tiguerones gang, one of them being a second in command, and a leader of the Litoral prison. The second-in-command of Los Tiguerones gang was also the second-in-command of Los AK47 Gang, with connections with criminal gangs in Colombia.

source: Diario Extra (Ecuador); El Universo (Ecuador); Machala Movil
notes: On 8 February 2024, in El Guanabano (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling by vehicle shot at a car in which a woman was traveling in a drive-by shooting on the road to La Cadena. The woman was the widow of a legal prosecutor killed in January 2024 (coded separately). The perpetrators shot various times at the vehicle but missed the woman. who was uninjured. There were no casualties.
tags: women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons

notes: On 8 February 2024, in Duran (Guayas), members of the Latin Kings shot and killed a man in Vida Nueva sector in a drive-by shooting on a motorcycle, after they asked him if he was part of Los Chone Killers gang. The man had a criminal record. It is unclear if this was part of a clash between gangs. 1 fatality.

Weapons seizure: On 8 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Febres Cordero (Guayas), police officers seized 111 dynamite sticks, munitions, a pistol, and explosive-making materials, in a house in Gomez Rendon street. During the seizure they arrested two members of Los Lobos gang.

On 9 February 2024, in Otavalo (Imbabura), Indigenous residents of Imbaqui sector captured, stripped of his clothes, tied him up and blindfolded a man that had been opening car doors to steal them. The residents decided to apply a traditional Indigenous justice punishment since the man had been caught previously for criminal acts. There were no fatalities.

On 9 February 2024, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by) shot at a barber shop located at Lucia Gilces and Felipe Alvarez streets. They shot more than 20 times, killed three people and one was injured. 3 fatalities.

Around 9 February 2024 (as reported), in Montecristi (Manabi), a male taxi cab driver was shot and killed and his dead body was found, with its hands tied up, near Colorado roundabout in the Monterey 1 sector. The cab driver had been missing for an unknown amount of time. The number of perpetrators is unknown. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 February 2024, in Portoviejo (Manabi), two unidentified armed assailants riding a motorcycle killed a man in a drive-by shooting as he stood at a tire repair shop in El Guabito sector. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 9 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a group of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling on four motorcycles and two cars, dressed in police uniforms, faked a police control at the exit of Las Penas tunnel of Santa Ana hill and kidnapped two men. The victims were released hour later. Police authorities arrested two Venezuelan nationals on 12 February in connection to the event (but likely not every member of the kidnappers were Venezuelan nationals, given the size of the group). An alternative report indicates that the victims were instead liberated during a police operation on 12 February in a clash where they arrested the two Venezuelan nationals (coded separately).

On 9 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), at least five armed assailants kidnapped a business owner outside of his shop on the Bastion Popular sector, at block 1B. During the kidnapping attempt, the victim's son-in-law was shot and killed for attempting to save the business owner. The perpetrators then demanded ransom money from the victim's family for his release. They had been charging extortion money at the man for several months and were likely the same perpetrators that placed an explosive device at the victim's home on 27 November (coded separately). Police authorities liberated the victim a day later and arrested four assailants. 1 fatality.

Around 9 February 2024 (as reported), in Mocache (Los Rios), a man was kidnapped and killed, and his body was found in Las Campanas sector in a pond. The body had signs of torture, his hands were tied, and with gunshot injuries. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2024, in Manta (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified armed perpetrators traveling in a vehicle opened fire on people inside an armored vehicle in a drive-by shooting along 17 Street and 38 Avenue. At least 20 shell casings of various calibres were found at the scene. Both vehicles involved fled the location after the attack. There were likely no injuries due to the armored vehicle's protection. Authorship and motivation unknown. There were no casualties.

Around 10 February 2024 (as reported), in El Guabo (El Oro), a man was killed and his body was found inside a banana farm in Borbones parish. He was found with his hands tied up and beside a burned motorcycle. The reason behind the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 10 February 2024, in San Jacinto de Buena Fe (Los Rios), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle (drive-by) shot at a woman with her son when they were traveling on a motorcycle on 19 de Octubre housing cooperative, at Segundo Jimenez and 6 de Marzo streets. The woman was killed. 1 fatality.

On 11 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), two unidentified armed perpetrators shot and killed a man inside a restaurant on Agustin Freire Avenue in the La Garzota sector. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle, with one of them entering the restaurant to shoot at the victim at least eight times using 9-mm bullets. Both perpetrators then fled on the motorcycle, which was found abandoned nearby. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 11 February 2024 (as reported), in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), a man was killed and beheaded, and his remains were found in Paraiso de la Flor, block 16 sector. The body also had several cuts, and police officers claimed that he was killed in another place and his remains were dropped there. 1 fatality.
Property destruction: On 11 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Ximena (Guayas), police officers seized approximately 1.27 tons of cocaine in the Naportec Maritime Port.

On 12 February 2024, in Montecristi (Manabi), two men were shot and killed by several unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle in Santa Isabela neighborhood (drive-by). One of the men died immediately and the other died in a hospital. 2 fatalities.

Property destruction: Around 13 February 2024 (as reported), on the Coast of Esmeraldas province (coded Esmeraldas), Ecuadorian and Colombian naval forces intercepted and confiscated a semi-submergible ship on the maritime border between Ecuador and Colombia. Authorities suspected the vessel to have been used for transporting several tons of drugs. They arrested four Colombian nationals.

On 13 February 2024, in Duran (Guayas), unidentified armed assailants riding a motorcycle shot and killed a woman at Oramas Gonzalez citadel in a drive-by shooting. The woman's daughter was shot and injured. The victims were standing at a stop used by informal motor taxis that sees frequent extortion attacks by criminal groups. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 13 February 2024 (from 12 - 13 February), in Duran municipality (Guayas), two men were killed and their bodies were found in the Duran - Tambo highway at the 11KM with their hands and feet tied up. 2 fatalities.

Around 13 February 2024 (from 12 - 13 February), in Duran (Guayas), three unidentified armed assailants shot and killed a man while he was washing his car in Gabriel Garcia Moreno cooperative sector. Another man that was with him was injured and taken to a hospital. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces Of Ecuador (2023-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Ecuador (2023-); Police Forces of Ecuador (2023-)
notes: On 14 February 2024, in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas (Santo Domingo de los Colorados), prisoners of the Bellavista Rehabilitation Center (CRS) staged a prison riot and attempted to take the keys of a prison guard. The police and military forces took control of the situation and stopped the riot.

On 14 February 2024, in Esmeraldas (Esmeraldas), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man while he was resting with his family and friends by the riverbank in the El 30 sector. Authorship and motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 14 February 2024, in Guayaquil - Tarqui (Guayas), seven unidentified armed perpetrators kidnapped a woman for ransom in the Las Orquideas sector. The victim's mother received demands for $15,000 in exchange for her daughter's release. Police authorities rescued the victim on 16 February and arrested seven perpetrators. One of the perpetrators had a criminal record for robbery, extortion, and scamming. Authorities confiscated two guns, phones, and police-style jackets used by the perpetrators. One of the arrested suspects was the victim's father, leading police authorities to suspect that the perpetrators had pretended to kidnap the victim to take money from the family, but are still investigating the presence of the father.
On 14 February 2024, in Duran (Guayas), two women were killed by a man known to be an extortionist who had already threatened them both and their families to pay up. 2 fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States (2021-2025)
source: Ecuador Comunicacion; El Telegrafo; La Republica (Ecuador)
notes: Property destruction: On 14 February 2024, at 150 miles of the Norwest of the Galapagos islands (coded to Puerto Baquerizo Moreno, Galapagos), local military officers, with the support of military officers of the United States, seized a ship with 1.7 tons of cocaine. They arrested two men that attempted to escape.

On 14 February 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), a man was shot and killed while he was driving his car on Walter Andrade Avenue by unidentified armed assailants on two motorcycles in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.

On 15 February 2024, on the Coast of San Mateo (Manabi), an unknown number of unidentified perpetrators described as pirates assaulted and stole material from around 15 fishing boats while the fishermen were working. The victims were threatened, assaulted, and left stranded without their boat motors or fishing gear. No injuries were reported. The fishermen were eventually able to drift toward the San Mateo pier.
On 15 February 2024, in Zaruma (El Oro), two unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle shot and killed a man at La Colina sector (drive-by). The man was shot eight times. 1 fatality.

On 15 February 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), three unidentified armed assailants intercepted the car of a man and a woman that were a couple, beat them up and took control of their car with them inside and abducted them to an unknown place.

On 15 February 2024, in Quevedo (Los Rios), unidentified armed assailants shot at an off-duty police officer that was travelling on a motorcycle through the Quevedo - Valencia avenue. The officer was injured and taken to a hospital. There were no fatalities.

On 15 February 2024, in Manta (Manabi), a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed assailants on a motorcycle in the San Ignacio de Loyola neighborhood in a drive-by shooting. The man was shot at least seven times before the assailants fled the scene. 1 fatality.
